original: cig shos ni 'bru'i chang gis gang ba thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin h'um dang hr'i yig gi sa bon gyi byin gyis brlabs pa dang / me tog dgram pas mdzes par byas te padma'i snod gsum po dbus ma nas brtsams te g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag gos sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po rnams kyis dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni 'bru'i chang gis gang ba thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin h'um dang hr'i yig gi sa bon gyi byin gyis brlabs pa dang / me tog dgram pas mdzes par byas te padma'i snod gsum po dbus ma nas brtsams te g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag gos sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po rnams kyis dga' bar bya'o //
translated: One should delight the three lotus vessels, beginning from the middle one, with blue, white, and red cloths, respectively.

original: de nas rdo rje las kyi phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyis rdzas dri zhim po la sogs pa mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje las kyi phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyis rdzas dri zhim po la sogs pa mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod par bya'o //
translated: Then, preceded by the homage of the vajra activity, one should worship with the five offerings, such as fragrant substances, and so on.

original: de'i rjes la snod dbus ma las bdud rtsi blangs te snod gnyis po la gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la snod dbus ma las bdud rtsi blangs te snod gnyis po la gtor bar bya'o //
translated: After that, one should take nectar from the middle vessel and sprinkle the two other vessels.

original: de'i rjes la snod gcig blangs te gos bshus nas rnal 'byor pa'i gral la go rims bzhin du drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la snod gcig blangs te gos bshus nas rnal 'byor pa'i gral la go rims bzhin du drang bar bya'o //
translated: After that, one should take one vessel, remove the cloth, and place it in the yogin's row in order.

original: de nas dge slong dang dge tshul dang dge snyen dang rdo rje slob dpon gyi gral la ste drangs pa'i 'og tu re re zhing phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dge slong dang dge tshul dang dge snyen dang rdo rje slob dpon gyi gral la ste drangs pa'i 'og tu re re zhing phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, after the monks, novices, and lay devotees, the vajra master should be invited.

original: 'dren pa gang nas brtsams pa de la phyis kyang drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dren pa gang nas brtsams pa de la phyis kyang drang bar bya'o //
translated: Beginning with the one who is invited first, they should be invited in order.🔽After that, many different kinds of meat dishes, fragrant rice, and rice of the best quality, with the six flavors, should be brought to the rows of the disciples in order, in vessels, and the mantra Oṃ āḥ hūṃ should be recited.🔽The mantra is:🔽Oṃ āḥ hūṃ🔽oṃ āḥ hūṃ

analyzed: btung ba'i rdzas rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du gcig tu bsres te myang bar bya'o //
translated: The substances for drinking should also be mixed together in just the same way and drunk.

original: de'i rjes la rdo rje las kyi cang te'u la mchod pa bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rdo rje las kyi cang te'u la mchod pa bya ste /
translated: After that, one should worship the bell of vajra action.🔽Having recited the three syllables, one should proclaim the sound of music, which is of the nature of hūṃ and phaṭ, and the vajra yoginīs should perform various vajra dances.

original: yi ge gsum bzlas nas h'um dang phat gyi rang bzhin gyi rol mo'i sgra bsgrags par bya zhing rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis kyang rdo rje'i gar sna tshogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: yi ge gsum bzlas nas h'um dang phat gyi rang bzhin gyi rol mo'i sgra bsgrags par bya zhing rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis kyang rdo rje'i gar sna tshogs pa bya ste /
translated: One should sing the vajra song, such as:

original: rgyu med dngos la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje'i glu dbyangs blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu med dngos la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje'i glu dbyangs blang bar bya'o //
translated: Homage to the deity without cause.

original: kha cig ni thams cad kyis kyang gar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni thams cad kyis kyang gar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that all should dance.

original: kha cig na re 'khor lo'i gtso bos gar byed cing gzhan rnams kyis na glu dang rol mo bya'o zhes mchog tu dga' ba thob pa na gar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'khor lo'i gtso bos gar byed cing gzhan rnams kyis na glu dang rol mo bya'o zhes mchog tu dga' ba thob pa na gar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Some say that the principal of the wheel dances, and the others sing and play music.

original: phyi rol gyi skyed mos tshal na ngang pa dang ce sbyang dang bung ba rnams sgra sgrogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skyed mos tshal na ngang pa dang ce sbyang dang bung ba rnams sgra sgrogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rtags so //
translated: The sound of geese, peacocks, and bees in the external garden is a sign of the consecration of the Blessed One.

original: gal te de'i nang du rgyu rkyen 'ga' zhig bzhad gad byed dam rtsod pa byed pa de ni skad cig de nyid la bskrad par bya zhing gus pas 'bul na chad pa'i las byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: gal te de'i nang du rgyu rkyen 'ga' zhig bzhad gad byed dam rtsod pa byed pa de ni skad cig de nyid la bskrad par bya zhing gus pas 'bul na chad pa'i las byed du gzhug go //
translated: If someone laughs or argues inside, they should be expelled at that very moment. If they offer respectfully, they should be made to perform the punishment.

original: de nas thams cad la 'bras bu gsum dang lo ma dang bsres pa'i go la drangs te yon tan rnam pa bzhi phul nas zas kyi lhag ma gcig tu bsdus te sngags 'dis dur khrod du gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thams cad la 'bras bu gsum dang lo ma dang bsres pa'i go la drangs te yon tan rnam pa bzhi phul nas zas kyi lhag ma gcig tu bsdus te sngags 'dis dur khrod du gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having offered the four qualities, the leftovers of the food should be collected in one place and scattered in the charnel ground with this mantra:

original: aom ku ru ku ru watt'a li ma h'a watt'a li /
analyzed: aom ku ru ku ru watt'a li ma h'a watt'a li /

analyzed: tsandi ka r'a li /

analyzed: sa ma ae raksham ti /

analyzed: badzra pri ti wa na ma dhye /

original: bhunydza hi / bhaksha kha hi /
analyzed: bhunydza hi / bhaksha kha hi /
translated: Bhunja Hi, Bhakṣa Khi,

original: kukshan d'a te /
analyzed: kukshan d'a te /

original: dh'u m'ang+ga ri /
analyzed: dh'u m'ang+ga ri /
translated: Dhūmāngari,

original: tsandi ka r'a li /
analyzed: tsandi ka r'a li /
translated: Caṇḍikā Rali,

original: tishtha tishtha / ai m'a mutstshishtha ba li grihna sarba dusht'am /
analyzed: tishtha tishtha / ai m'a mutstshishtha ba li grihna sarba dusht'am /
translated: Tiṣṭha Tiṣṭha, I am Ucchistha, Bali Gṛhṇa Sarva Duṣṭān,

original: bhaksha ya bhaksha ya /
analyzed: bhaksha ya bhaksha ya /
translated: Bhakṣaya Bhakṣaya,

original: ho phem phem phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ho phem phem phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Ho Phaṭ Phaṭ Phaṭ Svāhā.

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis byin gyis brlabs nas dur khrod du gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Having consecrated with this, one should scatter in the charnel ground.

original: de nas thams cad ni bde bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas thams cad ni bde bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then, all should be made to dwell in bliss.

original: de ni cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan pa yin @130a * //
analyzed: de ni cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgras bstan pa yin @130a * //
translated: This is taught by the words “in accordance with the rite.”

original: te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: It is just as the words state.

original: mchod par byas nas ci zhig bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: mchod par byas nas ci zhig bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Having made offerings, what should one do? Therefore it is said:

original: de nas 'dod yon lnga spyad pas //
analyzed: de nas 'dod yon lnga spyad pas //
translated: Then, having enjoyed the five sense objects,

original: rnal 'byor chen po mnyes gyur pas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po mnyes gyur pas //
translated: the great yogin is pleased,

original: cho ga bzhin du snyoms 'jug bya //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du snyoms 'jug bya //
translated: and one should enter into union in accordance with the rite.

original: snang ba dag ni 'byung ba na //
analyzed: snang ba dag ni 'byung ba na //
translated: When the appearances arise,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te rnal 'byor chen po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te rnal 'byor chen po ste /
translated: the great yogin

original: rdo rje slob dpon tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i mchod pa dang 'dod pa lnga la longs spyod pa'i sgo nas mnyes par gyur pas na /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i mchod pa dang 'dod pa lnga la longs spyod pa'i sgo nas mnyes par gyur pas na /
translated: The master of vajra, being pleased by means of the offering of the gaṇacakra and the enjoyment of the five objects of desire,

original: snang ba dag ni 'byung ba na ste drod kyi dus snyoms par 'jug ste sa bon lngas byin gyis brlabs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang lhan cig slob ma rjes su gzung ba'i don du sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba dag ni 'byung ba na ste drod kyi dus snyoms par 'jug ste sa bon lngas byin gyis brlabs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang lhan cig slob ma rjes su gzung ba'i don du sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: the appearances arise, that is, at the time of heat, he should enter into union with the pledge seal consecrated by the five seeds, for the sake of taking up the disciple.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
translated: “According to the rite” means that one should perform according to the rite taught in the tantra.

original: de la cho ga bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la cho ga bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The concise rite is as follows.

original: dang po stong pa nyid rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: dang po stong pa nyid rnam par bsams te /
translated: First, one should contemplate emptiness.

original: de nas bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku skad cig gis spros nas /
analyzed: de nas bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku skad cig gis spros nas /
translated: Then, by the stage of self-consecration, one should emanate the gnosis being in an instant.

original: lha mo yang de kho na bzhin du rnam par bsgoms nas sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i lnga'i sa bon rnams kyis mgo bo la sogs pa rnams su go cha bkod de /
analyzed: lha mo yang de kho na bzhin du rnam par bsgoms nas sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i lnga'i sa bon rnams kyis mgo bo la sogs pa rnams su go cha bkod de /
translated: Having also visualized the goddess in the same way, one should bless her body, speech, and mind, and having arrayed the armor with the five seed syllables of the tathāgatas on her head, and so on,

original: sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa phyag rgya bzhis nu ma dang mchu dang padma dang padma'i nang rnam par dag par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa phyag rgya bzhis nu ma dang mchu dang padma dang padma'i nang rnam par dag par bsgoms nas /
translated: one should meditate on the purification of her breasts, lips, lotus, and the interior of the lotus with the four mudras, such as Buddha eye, and so on.

original: gzugs rdo rje ma sogs pa rnams kyis yul rnam par dag par byas nas de kho na bzhin dub dag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa yang sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs nas de'i padma yang yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa'i padma
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma sogs pa rnams kyis yul rnam par dag par byas nas de kho na bzhin dub dag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa yang sa'i snying po la sogs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs nas de'i padma yang yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa'i padma
translated: Having purified the objects with Rūpavajrā, and so on, one should bless her eyes, and so on, with Kṣitigarbha, and so on, in the same way.🔽One should imagine that her lotus is also an eight-petaled lotus, arisen from the transformation of the syllable aṃ,

original: 'dab ma brgyad pa yi ge aom gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i bde ba dang ldan par bsams te /
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad pa yi ge aom gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i bde ba dang ldan par bsams te /
translated: endowed with bliss, blessed by the syllable oṃ.

original: rdo rje yang yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rtse mo lnga pa aom gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i nor bu'i cha dang ldan par byas nas /
analyzed: rdo rje yang yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rtse mo lnga pa aom gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i nor bu'i cha dang ldan par byas nas /
translated: The vajra is also generated from the syllable hūṃ, with five points, and endowed with the part of the gem, which is blessed by the syllable oṃ.

original: de dag gi rtse mor yi ge h'um dang phat go rims bzhin du char dgag pa'i don du bkod de /
analyzed: de dag gi rtse mor yi ge h'um dang phat go rims bzhin du char dgag pa'i don du bkod de /
translated: The syllables hūṃ and phaṭ are arranged on the points of those vajras, respectively, in order to block the rain.

original: rang gi lha'i 'dod pa'i nga rgyal gyis bde ba chen po nyams su myong nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchog tu rjes su chags pa'i sgras bcug ste /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i 'dod pa'i nga rgyal gyis bde ba chen po nyams su myong nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchog tu rjes su chags pa'i sgras bcug ste /
translated: Having experienced great bliss with the pride of one’s deity, one should draw in all tathāgatas with the sound of supreme passion.

original: lam dbu ma nas rdo rje'i rtse mor byang chub kyi sems thig le'i gzugs can bzung nas de'i nang gi khyab par byed pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: lam dbu ma nas rdo rje'i rtse mor byang chub kyi sems thig le'i gzugs can bzung nas de'i nang gi khyab par byed pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i de kho na nyid nyams su myong ste /
translated: Having held the bodhicitta, in the form of a drop, at the tip of the vajra through the central nāḍī, one should experience the innate reality that pervades it.

original: @130b de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems padma'i nang du dbyung bar bya ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: @130b de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems padma'i nang du dbyung bar bya ste sbas pa'o //
translated: The bodhicitta, which is the nature of all tathāgatas, should be emitted into the lotus and concealed.

original: de las langs nas ci zhig bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de las langs nas ci zhig bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What should one do after rising from that?

original: byang chub sems ni rab 'bad pas //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rab 'bad pas //
translated: The bodhicitta, having made effort,🔽is placed in the vases, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs dag ni gzhag / slob ma bzang ba bla ma yis //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs dag ni gzhag / slob ma bzang ba bla ma yis //
translated: The good disciple, the guru

original: brtse bas nam phyed dus dbang bskur //
analyzed: brtse bas nam phyed dus dbang bskur //
translated: with compassion, bestows initiation at midnight.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽After that, the bodhicitta arisen from the meditative concentration, having been taken up with the lotus of the hand without touching it, is placed in those very vases, etc. ,

original: de'i rjes la ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems padma'i sgo nas lag pas ma reg par blangs nas bum pa la sogs pa ste dung chos dang nya phyis dang padma'i snod la sogs pa de dag nyid du bzhag nas
analyzed: de'i rjes la ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems padma'i sgo nas lag pas ma reg par blangs nas bum pa la sogs pa ste dung chos dang nya phyis dang padma'i snod la sogs pa de dag nyid du bzhag nas
translated: conch, oyster shell, lotus vessel, etc.

original: / de nyid kyi ngang gis slob ma rnam par snang mdzad rdo rjer bsam ste /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi ngang gis slob ma rnam par snang mdzad rdo rjer bsam ste /
translated: , and the disciple is imagined as Vairocana Vajra by the nature of that very [bodhicitta].

original: de la snying rje bskyed nas mtshan phyed kyi dus su dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de la snying rje bskyed nas mtshan phyed kyi dus su dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having generated compassion for him, the initiation should be given at midnight.🔽By him also, with a mind of the nature of the totality of all the Ones-Gone-Thus, one should bow down.

original: des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi blos btud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus pa'i bdag nyid kyi blos btud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba ste sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the secret initiation, which is hidden.

original: shes rab ye shes dbang bskur ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab ye shes dbang bskur ba ni /
translated: The consecration of the wisdom-knowledge initiation is as follows.

original: dbang bskur yang dag thob nas ni //
analyzed: dbang bskur yang dag thob nas ni //
translated: Having obtained the perfect consecration,

original: tho rangs dus su yang mchod la //
analyzed: tho rangs dus su yang mchod la //
translated: at dawn time, again make offerings.

original: slob ma thal mo sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: slob ma thal mo sbyor ba yis //
translated: The disciple, with palms joined,

original: bstod pas bla ma mnyes par bya //
analyzed: bstod pas bla ma mnyes par bya //
translated: pleases the guru with praise.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te dgongs pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te dgongs pa 'di yin no //
translated: This is the intention.

original: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba thob pa'i rjes thogs su shes rab de bla mas de la sbyin par bya'o //

translated: Having the nature of all emptiness,

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: he has the nature of being one with the clear light.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'  dpe las byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i man ngag kun du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'  dpe las byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i man ngag kun du bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the intimate instruction of the simultaneously born, which arises from the example of manifest enlightenment.

original: mthong 'dod pa ni shes par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mthong 'dod pa ni shes par 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who wishes to see is one who wishes to know.

original: bstod nas te rdo rje sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas bstod pa byas nas so //
analyzed: bstod nas te rdo rje sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas bstod pa byas nas so //
translated: Having praised him, having praised him with the nature of the vajra body and so on,

original: thal mo sbyar nas spyi bor bzhag pa'i slob ma ni sgrub pa po'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas spyi bor bzhag pa'i slob ma ni sgrub pa po'o //
translated: the disciple who has placed his palms together on the top of his head is the practitioner.

original: bla ma ni rdo rje slob dpon no //
analyzed: bla ma ni rdo rje slob dpon no //
translated: The guru is the vajra master.🔽He should request, he should supplicate.

original: bskul bar bya ba ni gsol ba gdab par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o//
analyzed: bskul bar bya ba ni gsol ba gdab par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o//
translated: This is the literal explanation.

original: las dang skye las rnam grol zhing //
analyzed: las dang skye las rnam grol zhing //
translated: Liberated from karma and birth,

original: snang ba gsum pa spangs pa yi //
analyzed: snang ba gsum pa spangs pa yi //
translated: having abandoned the third appearance,

original: mngon par byang chub bstan pa ni //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub bstan pa ni //
translated: the teaching of manifest enlightenment🔽is the supreme intimate instruction.

original: mgon po chen po bdag la stsol //🔽kye thugs rdo rje 'chang dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi mgon po chen po de kho na nyid bzhi pa'i mngon par byang chub pa bstan zhing bshad pa bdag la stsol ba ni dpe nyid kyi sgo nas mthong gi dpe las byung ba nyid kyi sgo
analyzed: mgon po chen po bdag la stsol // kye thugs rdo rje 'chang dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi mgon po chen po de kho na nyid bzhi pa'i mngon par byang chub pa bstan zhing bshad pa bdag la stsol ba ni dpe nyid kyi sgo nas mthong gi dpe las byung ba nyid kyi sgo
translated: The great lord should grant me that.🔽O Vajradhara, the great lord who is inseparable from the nature of the fourth manifest enlightenment of reality should grant me the teaching and explanation of that.

original: nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is seen by way of the example, not by way of what arises from the example.

original: ji lta bu zhe na las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin gyi mthu las byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin gyi mthu las byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: What is it like? Karma is the karma of body and speech that arises from the power of the nature of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de yi dbang gis 'khor bar yang skye zhing nying mtshams sbyor ba ste de las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de yi dbang gis 'khor bar yang skye zhing nying mtshams sbyor ba ste de las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: By the power of that, one is born in samsara and is connected to it, liberated from that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar snang ba gsum po ste rnam par shes pa dang ye shes gsum po spangs pa ni bor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba gsum po ste rnam par shes pa dang ye shes gsum po spangs pa ni bor ba'o //
translated: Thus, the abandonment of the three appearances, the three consciousnesses and the three wisdoms, is the casting off.

original: rang bzhin gyi tshogs rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i rtsa ba can yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi tshogs rnams ni rnam par shes pa'i rtsa ba can yin la /
translated: The assemblies of the natures are rooted in consciousness.

original: de'i mthu las byung zhing de'i dbang gis skye ba 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu zad pa las 'bras bu mi 'byung ste sa bon tshig pa las myu gu dang / shing rtsa ba nas bton pa las sdong bu dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i mthu las byung zhing de'i dbang gis skye ba 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu zad pa las 'bras bu mi 'byung ste sa bon tshig pa las myu gu dang / shing rtsa ba nas bton pa las sdong bu dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams bzhin no //
translated: Because it arises from that power and because it arises by the power of that, the effect does not arise from the exhaustion of the cause, just as a sprout does not arise from a burnt seed, and a trunk, leaves, flowers, and fruits do not arise from a tree uprooted from its very base.

original: de ni mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas gsol ba 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas gsol ba 'debs pa yin no //
translated: This is the supplication through the door of Akshobhya.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi ye shes che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi ye shes che //
translated: The great wisdom of all Buddhas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi gnas //
translated: the abode of all Tathagatas,

original: rdo rje ye shes bla na med //
analyzed: rdo rje ye shes bla na med //
translated: the unsurpassed vajra wisdom,

original: slob dpon chen po bdag la stsol //
analyzed: slob dpon chen po bdag la stsol //
translated: great master, grant to me!

original: sems can gyi khams chen po'i tshig gi sgo nas dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams chen po'i tshig gi sgo nas dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the purification itself through the door of the words of the great realm of sentient beings,

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin gyi slob dpon chen pos rdo rje ye shes bdag la stsol ba ste ston cig @133a * //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rang bzhin gyi slob dpon chen pos rdo rje ye shes bdag la stsol ba ste ston cig @133a * //
translated: the great master who is of the nature of Amitabha should grant, should teach, the vajra wisdom to me.

original: pa'o ; / rdo rje ltar mi shigs shing mi g-yo ba'i ye shes ni de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / rdo rje ltar mi shigs shing mi g-yo ba'i ye shes ni de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is indestructible and unshakable like a vajra is the fourth reality.

original: gang las bla mar gyur pa gzhan med pa de ni bla na med pa ste bzhi pa las de kho na nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las bla mar gyur pa gzhan med pa de ni bla na med pa ste bzhi pa las de kho na nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unsurpassed because there is no other guru than it, since there is no other reality than the fourth.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi ste stong pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ye shes chen po ni thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi ste stong pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ye shes chen po ni thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: The great wisdom of all the buddhas, of emptiness and so forth, is all empty.🔽The abode of all the tathagatas, of the aggregates and so forth, which are of the nature of the five wisdoms, is the state of one taste.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun te ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas ni ro gcig pa'i dngos pos gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i sgo nas gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun te ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas ni ro gcig pa'i dngos pos gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i sgo nas gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: This is the supplication through Amitabha.🔽Without beginning or end, peaceful,

original: thog mtha' med cing zhi ba dang // nyon mongs thams cad rnam sbyong zhing //
analyzed: thog mtha' med cing zhi ba dang // nyon mongs thams cad rnam sbyong zhing //
translated: purifying all afflictions,

original: lus dang ngag sems dag byed pa //
analyzed: lus dang ngag sems dag byed pa //
translated: purifying body, speech, and mind,

original: rdo rje chen pos bdag la stsol //
analyzed: rdo rje chen pos bdag la stsol //
translated: grant me the great vajra.

original: kye sku rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin rdo rje chen po lus la sogs pa rnams dag par byed pa'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa bdag la stsol te bdag la ston cig pa'o //
analyzed: kye sku rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin rdo rje chen po lus la sogs pa rnams dag par byed pa'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa bdag la stsol te bdag la ston cig pa'o //
translated: Oh! Bestow upon me, the nature of Vajradhara, the great vajra of the body, etc., the four realities that purify, that is, teach me!

original: thog ma ni dga' ba dang mchog dga'o //
analyzed: thog ma ni dga' ba dang mchog dga'o //
translated: The beginning is joy and supreme joy.

original: mtha' ma ni bral ba ste de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir thog mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' ma ni bral ba ste de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir thog mtha' med pa'o //
translated: The end is separation, and because of being free from that, it is without beginning or end.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni rang bzhin rnams dang de'i rtsa ba rnam par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni rang bzhin rnams dang de'i rtsa ba rnam par shes pa rnams te /
translated: All afflictions are the natures and the consciousnesses that are their roots.

original: de rnams par sbyong ba ni 'od gsal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje'i sgo nas gsol ba 'debs pa yin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams par sbyong ba ni 'od gsal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje'i sgo nas gsol ba 'debs pa yin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Purifying those is making them clear light. This is the supplication through the vajra of body, and it is not a hypothetical case.

original: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs su bla ma'i bshad pa ni /🔽de ltar yon tan yang dag pa //
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs su bla ma'i bshad pa ni / de ltar yon tan yang dag pa //
translated: After the supplication, the teacher's explanation is:🔽Thus, the yogi/nī who is pleased

original: brjod pas mnyes pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: brjod pas mnyes pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
translated: by the perfect expression of qualities,

original: snying rje slob ma la bskyed de //
analyzed: snying rje slob ma la bskyed de //
translated: having generated compassion for the disciple,

original: de nas rim pa 'di skad bshad //
analyzed: de nas rim pa 'di skad bshad //
translated: then explains the stages in this way:

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus,

original: de ltar te tshul de ltar yon tan yang dag par brjod cing ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i spyod pa dam pa rnams la bstod pas rnal 'byor pa ste rdo rje slob dpon gyi slob ma sgrub pa po la snying rje ste snying brtse ba bskyed nas
analyzed: de ltar te tshul de ltar yon tan yang dag par brjod cing ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i spyod pa dam pa rnams la bstod pas rnal 'byor pa ste rdo rje slob dpon gyi slob ma sgrub pa po la snying rje ste snying brtse ba bskyed nas
translated: having generated compassion, i.e., sympathy, for the practitioner, i.e., the disciple of the vajra master, the yogi, by praising the holy ones who abide in the way that is, in the way of the correct expression of the qualities,

original: / 'di skad de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bshad cing man ngag bstan par bya ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: / 'di skad de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas bshad cing man ngag bstan par bya ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: he should explain, i.e., teach, this, i.e., the sequence that will be explained, by means of the oral instructions, just as it is.

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: That itself is

original: mtshan mo snang ba'i cha ste gsal ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer snang ba gsal ba yin //
analyzed: mtshan mo snang ba'i cha ste gsal ba'i nyi ma'i 'od zer snang ba gsal ba yin //
translated: the night, the part of illumination, the sun, the light rays, the illumination.

original: mtshams nas snang ba thob pa rang gi rang bzhin rnams dang lhan cig min par ldan //
analyzed: mtshams nas snang ba thob pa rang gi rang bzhin rnams dang lhan cig min par ldan //
translated: The attainment of illumination from the directions is not endowed with one's own natures.

original: mtshan min nyin par ma yin mtshams min gang zhig rang bzhin rnams @133b dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: mtshan min nyin par ma yin mtshams min gang zhig rang bzhin rnams @133b dang rnam bral ba //
translated: That which is neither night, day, nor the directions, free from natures,

original: de ni byang chub skad cig yin te bla ma mchog bshad rnal 'byor pa nyid yum //
analyzed: de ni byang chub skad cig yin te bla ma mchog bshad rnal 'byor pa nyid yum //
translated: is the moment of enlightenment, the mother of the yogi himself, explained by the supreme guru.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: kye bu khyod kyis thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su dang por 'dod chags kyi skad cig dga' ba'i rang bzhin can nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni snang pa zhes bya ba yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: kye bu khyod kyis thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su dang por 'dod chags kyi skad cig dga' ba'i rang bzhin can nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni snang pa zhes bya ba yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: O son, you should know that at the time of the union of means and wisdom, the first moment of passion, which has the nature of joy, is called appearance,

original: cung zhig gsal ba'i bde ba 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zhig gsal ba'i bde ba 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a slightly clear bliss arises.

original: bde ba de nyid kyi mtshan mo'i cha zhes bya ste mtshan mo zla ba'i snang ba yod kyang dngos po rnams gsal bar mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba de nyid kyi mtshan mo'i cha zhes bya ste mtshan mo zla ba'i snang ba yod kyang dngos po rnams gsal bar mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That bliss is called the night portion, because at night, although there is the appearance of the moon, one does not see things clearly.

original: khyod kyis mchog tu dga' ba'i skad cig 'dod chags bar ma'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni snang ba gsal ba'i mtshan mo la ltos nas snang ba 'phel bar 'gyur ba dga' ba khyad par can du rab tu gsal ba'i phyir nyi ma'i
analyzed: khyod kyis mchog tu dga' ba'i skad cig 'dod chags bar ma'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni snang ba gsal ba'i mtshan mo la ltos nas snang ba 'phel bar 'gyur ba dga' ba khyad par can du rab tu gsal ba'i phyir nyi ma'i
translated: The moment of supreme joy, which you experience, which has the nature of middling passion, is called the increase of appearance, because it is the special joy that is very clear in dependence on the clear appearance of night, like the sun.

original: 'od zer gsal ba ste nyi ma'i 'od zer rab tu gsal ba dang mtshungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gsal ba ste nyi ma'i 'od zer rab tu gsal ba dang mtshungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The light is clear, like the clear light of the sun.

original: bral ba'i rang bzhin gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba med pa yid mi bde ba'i mtshan nyid kyi snang ba nye bar thob pa snang ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin par khong du chud
analyzed: bral ba'i rang bzhin gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba med pa yid mi bde ba'i mtshan nyid kyi snang ba nye bar thob pa snang ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin par khong du chud
translated: The nature of separation is freedom from attachment, which is to be understood as the attainment of the light characterized by mental dissatisfaction, the absence of the light of the moon and sun, the characteristic of the complete light.

original: par bya'o // rigs kyi bu gsum po 'di ni de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: par bya'o // rigs kyi bu gsum po 'di ni de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: Son of noble family, these three are not reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar skad cig de rnams ni rang gi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rnams te sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang ldan zhing 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig de rnams ni rang gi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin rnams te sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang ldan zhing 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Because those moments have their own nature, and are connected with mental factors.

original: yang rigs kyi bu mtshan min te dga' ba dang snang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / nyin par ma yin pa dang mchog dang snang ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / mtshams min te 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / snang ba nye bar thob pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yang rigs kyi bu mtshan min te dga' ba dang snang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / nyin par ma yin pa dang mchog dang snang ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / mtshams min te 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / snang ba nye bar thob pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma yin zhing /
translated: and it is not the nature of the attainment of light.

original: de nyid kyi rang bzhin rnams te tha mal pa rnams dang bral zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rang bzhin rnams te tha mal pa rnams dang bral zhing /
translated: Those natures of that very thing, which are free from the ordinary,

original: dri ma med pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi skad cig ste 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin rtogs par dka' ba'i skad cig yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi skad cig ste 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin rtogs par dka' ba'i skad cig yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: are stainless. That is the moment of enlightenment, which should be known as the moment of clear light, which is difficult to realize.

original: gal te de lta yin na ci'i phyir thams cad kyis de mi shes she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na ci'i phyir thams cad kyis de mi shes she na gsungs pa /
translated: If that is so, why is it not known by everyone?

original: bla ma mchog bshad de rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma mchog bshad de rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las shes par bya'o //
translated: It is explained by the supreme guru, and should be known from the mouth of the vajra master.

original: gzhan du @134a * //
analyzed: gzhan du @134a * //
translated: Otherwise,

original: na yod du zin kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na yod du zin kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even if it exists, it will not be known due to the power of ignorance.

original: de ni glog gi skad cig bzhin du shes par dka' ba yin pa'i phyir bla ma ma nyes pa las thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni glog gi skad cig bzhin du shes par dka' ba yin pa'i phyir bla ma ma nyes pa las thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is difficult to know, like a flash of lightning. Therefore, it is obtained from the guru, not from a fault.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor ba ste rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa po rnams kyi yul yin zhing nges par bya ba dang thob par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor ba ste rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa po rnams kyi yul yin zhing nges par bya ba dang thob par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don te sbas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the object of yogis, that is, of practitioners who possess the valid knowledge of reflexive awareness, and it is to be ascertained and attained. This is the hidden meaning.

original: de nyid shes pa'i thabs ni /
analyzed: de nyid shes pa'i thabs ni /
translated: The method of knowing that is as follows:🔽When all the darkness of the night and the light of the horizon disappear,

original: mtshan mo'i mun pa ma lus pa dang mtshams kyi snang ba gang du nub pa dang // ji srid nyi ma ma shar skad cig dri med der ni yang dag mtha' bstan bya //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i mun pa ma lus pa dang mtshams kyi snang ba gang du nub pa dang // ji srid nyi ma ma shar skad cig dri med der ni yang dag mtha' bstan bya //
translated: and the sun has not yet risen, the moment is stainless, and the limit of reality is revealed there.

original: slob dpon mchog ni rab rig spangs pas slob ma la ni phyi rol byang chub bstan //
analyzed: slob dpon mchog ni rab rig spangs pas slob ma la ni phyi rol byang chub bstan //
translated: The supreme master, having abandoned the highest awareness, teaches the external enlightenment to the disciple.

original: nang gi bde ba gnas mchog sangs rgyas byang chub 'ga' zhig skad cig gis thob 'gyur //
analyzed: nang gi bde ba gnas mchog sangs rgyas byang chub 'ga' zhig skad cig gis thob 'gyur //
translated: Some attain the supreme abode of inner bliss, buddhahood, enlightenment, in an instant.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te mtshan mo ni 'dod chags kyi skad cig yin zhing de las byung ba'i mun pa ste yid mi bde ba'i skad cig gang yin pa nub ste ma byung zhing zhig pa dang / de bzhin du mtshams ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skad cig ste yid mi bde ba'i rang bzhin yin zhing de'i snang ba ste rab tu gsal ba yang nub cing ma byung ba dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te mtshan mo ni 'dod chags kyi skad cig yin zhing de las byung ba'i mun pa ste yid mi bde ba'i skad cig gang yin pa nub ste ma byung zhing zhig pa dang / de bzhin du mtshams ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skad cig ste yid mi bde ba'i rang bzhin yin zhing de'i snang ba ste rab tu gsal ba yang nub cing ma byung ba dang /
translated: Night is the moment of passion, and the darkness that arises from that, which is the moment of mental dissatisfaction, has set, not arisen.🔽Likewise, the interval is the moment of freedom from passion, and the light of that, which is the nature of mental dissatisfaction, has set, not arisen.🔽Likewise, the supreme sun is the moment of the middle, and the light of that, which is the nature of clarity, has not arisen, not occurred, not been heard.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma'i mchog gi skad cig ste bar ma dang snang ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma shar ba ste ma byung zhing ma thos pa'i skad cig dri med de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba der yang dag mtha' ste 'od gsal
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma'i mchog gi skad cig ste bar ma dang snang ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma shar ba ste ma byung zhing ma thos pa'i skad cig dri med de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba der yang dag mtha' ste 'od gsal
translated: In that moment, which is stainless, free from the stains of passion and so on, the limit of reality, clear light,

original: dpe'i de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi man ngag bzhi pa'i gtam bstan zhing gsal bar bya'o //🔽su la zhen slob ma ste sgrub pa po la'o //
analyzed: dpe'i de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi man ngag bzhi pa'i gtam bstan zhing gsal bar bya'o //🔽su la zhen slob ma ste sgrub pa po la'o //
translated: the nature of the example clear light, should be taught, explained, to the disciple, the practitioner.

original: slob dpon mchog ni bla ma mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon mchog ni bla ma mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The supreme master is the supreme guru.

original: gang gis rab rib ste 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma'i nyes pa dpe'i sgo nas spangs shing bsal ba de ni rab rib spangs pa ste bla ma'o //
analyzed: gang gis rab rib ste 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma'i nyes pa dpe'i sgo nas spangs shing bsal ba de ni rab rib spangs pa ste bla ma'o //
translated: He who has abandoned and dispelled the faults of the eye disease of passion, passionlessness, and the middle passion by means of the example is the one who has abandoned the eye disease, the guru.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?🔽The external enlightenment is the teaching and explanation of the external enlightenment, which is the appearance of the five-colored light rays at dawn, the clear appearance at sunrise, the attainment of the appearance at sunset, and the appearance at night.

original: phyi rol byang chub ces bya ba ni tho rangs kyi mtshams kyi dus su thams cad stong pa dang / nyi ma shar ba'i dus su snang ba gsal ba dang / nub pa'i mtshams kyi dus su snang ba nye par thob pa dang / mtshan mo byung ba'i dus su snang ba ste de bstan zhing bshad pa'i sgo nas nang gi bde ba ste nang gi @134b mngon par byang chub pa de ni dang po 'od zer kha dog lnga po'i tshogs su snang ba dang gnyis pa smig rgyu lta bur snang
analyzed: phyi rol byang chub ces bya ba ni tho rangs kyi mtshams kyi dus su thams cad stong pa dang / nyi ma shar ba'i dus su snang ba gsal ba dang / nub pa'i mtshams kyi dus su snang ba nye par thob pa dang / mtshan mo byung ba'i dus su snang ba ste de bstan zhing bshad pa'i sgo nas nang gi bde ba ste nang gi @134b mngon par byang chub pa de ni dang po 'od zer kha dog lnga po'i tshogs su snang ba dang gnyis pa smig rgyu lta bur snang
translated: The internal enlightenment is the internal manifest enlightenment, which is the appearance of the five-colored light rays at dawn, the clear appearance at sunrise, the attainment of the appearance at sunset, and the appearance at night.

original: ba dang / gsum pa srin bu me khyer lta bur snang ba ste /
analyzed: ba dang / gsum pa srin bu me khyer lta bur snang ba ste /
translated: and the third is the appearance like fireflies.

original: srin bu me khyer zhes bya ba ni srog chags bye brag rgyu ba 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: srin bu me khyer zhes bya ba ni srog chags bye brag rgyu ba 'ga' zhig go //
translated: The so-called fireflies are some moving creatures.

original: bzhi pa mar me lta bur snang ba dang / lnga pa sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bur snang ba zhes bya ba zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi mun pa dang de las ma gtogs pa'i snang ba bzhi po dang bcas pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim
analyzed: bzhi pa mar me lta bur snang ba dang / lnga pa sprin med pa'i nam mkha' lta bur snang ba zhes bya ba zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi mun pa dang de las ma gtogs pa'i snang ba bzhi po dang bcas pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim
translated: The fourth is the appearance like a lamp, and the fifth is the appearance like a cloudless sky, which should be understood to be together with the four appearances of the moon, sun, twilight, and the light that is not excluded from that.

original: pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus the inner stage of manifest enlightenment has been explained.

original: yang na phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i sgo nas nyams su myong ba'i dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i sgo nas nyams su myong ba'i dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: Or, the outer manifest enlightenment is the illustrative coemergence experienced through the door of the pledge seal.

original: nang gi mngon par byang chub pa ni dpe las byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa ste de'i phyir phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa'i thabs kyis nang gi mngon par byang chub pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang gi mngon par byang chub pa ni dpe las byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa ste de'i phyir phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa'i thabs kyis nang gi mngon par byang chub pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The inner manifest enlightenment is the innate that arises from the example, and therefore the inner manifest enlightenment is attained by the means of the outer manifest enlightenment.

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bde ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bde ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is bliss because it is the pacification of all conceptual thoughts.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub ces bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub ces bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
translated: The enlightenment of the buddhas is perfect enlightenment.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rang rig pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya ba yin gyi tshig gi yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rang rig pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya ba yin gyi tshig gi yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: The some is to be realized by the valid knowledge of reflexive awareness, and is not the domain of words.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang byang chub thob mod kyi 'on kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang byang chub thob mod kyi 'on kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis so //
translated: Although enlightenment is attained by the practitioner of the perfection of wisdom, it is attained after three incalculable aeons.

original: 'dir ni skad cig gis de kho na nyid bzhi pa nyams su myong ba'i skad cig gis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir ni skad cig gis de kho na nyid bzhi pa nyams su myong ba'i skad cig gis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, it is in an instant, meaning in the instant of the experience of the fourth reality.

original: sbas pa'o // de nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: sbas pa'o // de nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of that is stated:

original: thog min gyur dang de bzhin thog mar gyur //
analyzed: thog min gyur dang de bzhin thog mar gyur //
translated: Not the beginning, and likewise the beginning,🔽not the middle, and likewise the middle,

original: dbus min gyur dang de bzhin dbus gyur dang // mtha' min gyur dang de bzhin mtha' gyur pa //
analyzed: dbus min gyur dang de bzhin dbus gyur dang // mtha' min gyur dang de bzhin mtha' gyur pa //
translated: not the end, and likewise the end,

original: de ni thams cad stong par sangs rgyas gsungs //
analyzed: de ni thams cad stong par sangs rgyas gsungs //
translated: that is the emptiness of everything, taught by the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te de kho na nyid bzhi pa gang yin pa de ni thog ma ste dga' ba dang de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir thog min gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te de kho na nyid bzhi pa gang yin pa de ni thog ma ste dga' ba dang de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir thog min gyur pa'o //
translated: That which is the fourth reality is the beginning, and because of being free from that, it is not the beginning.

original: de bzhin du thog ma med pa la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thog mar gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du thog ma med pa la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thog mar gyur pa 'am /
translated: Likewise, because of pervading the beginning, it is the beginning,

original: thams cad skyed par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thog mar gyur pa'o //🔽dbus ma ni mchog ste de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dbus min gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad skyed par gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir thog mar gyur pa'o // dbus ma ni mchog ste de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dbus min gyur pa'o //
translated: or because of being the origin of everything, it is the beginning.🔽The middle is the supreme, and because of being free from that, it is not the middle.

original: de la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dbus su @135a * //
analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dbus su @135a * //
translated: Because of pervading that, it is the middle.

original: gyur pa'o // mtha' ni bral ba ste de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mtha' min gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gyur pa'o // mtha' ni bral ba ste de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mtha' min gyur pa'o //
translated: It is free from extremes, and since it is free from that, it is not an extreme.

original: de la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i mthar gyur pa ste de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can de ni thams cad stong pa kho na nyid bzhi pa yin par sangs rgyas kyis gsungs shing bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i don te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa nyid yin pa'i mthar gyur pa ste de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can de ni thams cad stong pa kho na nyid bzhi pa yin par sangs rgyas kyis gsungs shing bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i don te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The Buddha has taught, or said, that the fourth is the emptiness of everything, which has the characteristic of being an extreme that pervades all.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni /
translated: The essence of that is:

original: gang la 'gro ba dang ni 'ong med cing //
analyzed: gang la 'gro ba dang ni 'ong med cing //
translated: There is no coming or going,

original: zad dang 'phel med dngos dang dngos min med //
analyzed: zad dang 'phel med dngos dang dngos min med //
translated: no increase or decrease, no entities or nonentities,

original: shin tu ngo mtshar gzugs can ngo mtshar min //
analyzed: shin tu ngo mtshar gzugs can ngo mtshar min //
translated: no wonder in the wondrous form,

original: gnas par 'gyur min myur du 'gro ba min //🔽zhes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas par 'gyur min myur du 'gro ba min //🔽zhes pa gsungs te /
translated: no abiding or swift movement.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu med cing yod pa ma yin pa'i thams cad stong pa gang la 'gro ba ste 'byung ba'i rim gyis spro ba dang / 'ong ba ste 'jug pa'i rim gyis bsdu ba dang / dang gi sgras gnas pa ste de dag gang la med pa zhes bya bas ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu med cing yod pa ma yin pa'i thams cad stong pa gang la 'gro ba ste 'byung ba'i rim gyis spro ba dang / 'ong ba ste 'jug pa'i rim gyis bsdu ba dang / dang gi sgras gnas pa ste de dag gang la med pa zhes bya bas ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This and that do not exist, and all is empty, which is nonexistent.  The “going” is the process of emanation, and the “coming” is the process of gathering.  The “abiding” is the process of the absence of both of those.  Thus, it is taught that this is not the stage of vajra repetition.

original: zad pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zad pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: “ Exhaustion” is the three consciousnesses.

original: 'phel ba ni snang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: 'phel ba ni snang ba gsum mo //
translated: “ Increase” is the three appearances.

original: dngos po ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: “ Entity” is clear light.

original: dngos min ni rang bzhin rnams te de dag med pas zhes bya bas ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dngos min ni rang bzhin rnams te de dag med pas zhes bya bas ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: “ Nonentity” is the natures.  Thus, it is taught that this is not the stage of the purification of the mind.

original: ngo mtshar gzugs can ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gzhan dang gzhan spro ba'i sgo nas skad cig tsam gyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar gzugs can ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gzhan dang gzhan spro ba'i sgo nas skad cig tsam gyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
translated: “ Wonderfully formed” is the performance of the welfare of beings in an instant through the emanation of one maṇḍala wheel after another.

original: ngo mtshar byed pa ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis rang bzhin dag 'od gsal bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: ngo mtshar byed pa ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis rang bzhin dag 'od gsal bar shes pa ste /
translated: The wondrous activity is the knowledge of the pure nature as clear light by means of the twelve examples of illusion.

original: de dag kyang med pa zhes bya bas ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang med pa zhes bya bas ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: And those are nonexistent because they are not the stage of self-consecration.

original: gnas par gyur min zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par gyur min zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la mi gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not a state of abiding means that it does not abide in either cyclic life or in nirvana.

original: myur du 'gro ba min pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba min pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase not a swift-moving state means that it is a state of immobility, like the vajra-like samadhi. This indicates that it is not the stage of union.

original: thams cad stong pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The nature of the emptiness of everything should be understood to be like that, and it is the ultimate.

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: That is also:

original: gang zhig yod med tha snyad las grol zhing //🔽bsod nams dngos min sdig pa dngos ma yin //
analyzed: gang zhig yod med tha snyad las grol zhing // bsod nams dngos min sdig pa dngos ma yin //
translated: Free from the conventions of existence and nonexistence,🔽not a positive thing, not a negative thing,

original: bsod nams sdig gi bdag min mchog gyur pa /
analyzed: bsod nams sdig gi bdag min mchog gyur pa /
translated: not a positive and negative thing,

original: de ni thams cad stong par rgyal bas gsungs //
analyzed: de ni thams cad stong par rgyal bas gsungs //
translated: The Victor has declared all to be empty.

original: @135b zhes bya ba gsungs te bye brag tu smra ba dag ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams tshad mas grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @135b zhes bya ba gsungs te bye brag tu smra ba dag ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams tshad mas grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the aggregates, elements, and sense bases exist because they are established by valid cognition.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa po rnams ni chos thams cad rnam par rig pa'i rnam pa yod de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa po rnams ni chos thams cad rnam par rig pa'i rnam pa yod de /
translated: The Yogācāras say that all phenomena exist in the aspect of cognition.

original: phyi rol na cung zad kyang med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyi rol na cung zad kyang med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Nothing exists externally.

original: mdo sde pa rnams ni phyi rol rjes su dpag par yod kyi mngon sum du ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams ni phyi rol rjes su dpag par yod kyi mngon sum du ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: The Sautrāntikas say that external objects are inferred but not perceived.

original: dbu ma pa rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gcig dang du ma nyid du med pa'i phyir stong pa tsam 'ba' zhig yod do zhes so //
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag gcig dang du ma nyid du med pa'i phyir stong pa tsam 'ba' zhig yod do zhes so //
translated: The Mādhyamikas say that only emptiness exists, because apprehendeds and apprehenders do not exist as one or many.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams ni 'byung ba rnams kho na sems dpa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams ni 'byung ba rnams kho na sems dpa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med do zhes zer te /
translated: The Lokāyatas say that there is no world beyond because the elements are the nature of sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i yod pa dang med pa'i tha snyad rnams las grol zhing spang ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yod pa dang med pa'i tha snyad rnams las grol zhing spang ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is free from and transcends such conventions of existence and non-existence.

original: de bzhin du bsod nams kyi 'du byed ni dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsod nams kyi 'du byed ni dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Similarly, meritorious compositional activity refers to faith and so on.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams te de dag dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams te de dag dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Non-meritorious compositional activity refers to taking life and so on.

original: bsod nams dngos min sdig pa dngos min pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dngos min sdig pa dngos min pa'o //
translated: It is neither meritorious nor non-meritorious because it is free from both.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa 'dres ma'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin te cha de gnyis ka yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa 'dres ma'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin te cha de gnyis ka yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not a nature that is a mixture of meritorious and non-meritorious compositional activity because it lacks both of those aspects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid yin pas mchog tu gyur pa ste dam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid yin pas mchog tu gyur pa ste dam pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is supreme, that is, sublime, because it is free from all elaborations.🔽The buddhas have said that such a state is the emptiness of everything, the fourth appearance.

original: de lta bu ni thams cad stong pa ste snang ba bzhi pa yin par sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rang dga' ba yin pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni thams cad stong pa ste snang ba bzhi pa yin par sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rang dga' ba yin pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: This is a refutation of the assertion of natural bliss.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.

original: re zhig bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang de'i 'bras bu ni yod mod kyi 'on kyang de dag la rnam par dpyad pa byas nas don dam par yod pa ma yin te de kho na nyid shes pa la bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag med🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang de'i 'bras bu ni yod mod kyi 'on kyang de dag la rnam par dpyad pa byas nas don dam par yod pa ma yin te de kho na nyid shes pa la bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Merit, nonmerit, and their effects do exist, but when they are analyzed, they do not exist ultimately, because in the knowledge of reality, there is no good or bad destiny.

original: las rnams 'bras bcas nyid dang ni //
analyzed: las rnams 'bras bcas nyid dang ni //
translated: Karma and its effects

original: 'gro ba rnams kyang yang dag bshad //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyang yang dag bshad //
translated: and the destinies of beings are taught.

original: de yi rang bzhin yongs shes pas //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin yongs shes pas //
translated: By fully understanding their nature,

original: skye med pa yang bstan pa yin //
analyzed: skye med pa yang bstan pa yin //
translated: nonarising is also taught.

original: dgongs pa'i dbang gis rgyal ba rnams //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i dbang gis rgyal ba rnams //
translated: Just as the Victorious Ones, through their intention,

original: nga dang bdag ces gsungs pa ltar //
analyzed: nga dang bdag ces gsungs pa ltar //
translated: have taught “I” and “self,”

original: de bzhin dgongs pa'i dbang gis ni //
analyzed: de bzhin dgongs pa'i dbang gis ni //
translated: in the same way, through their intention,

original: phung po khams dang skye mched gsungs //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched gsungs //
translated: they have taught the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres.

original: 'byung ba che la sogs bshad pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che la sogs bshad pa //
translated: The teachings on the great elements and so on

original: @136a * // rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
analyzed: @136a * // rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
translated: are subsumed in consciousness.

original: de shes nas ni bral gyur na //
analyzed: de shes nas ni bral gyur na //
translated: When that is known and one becomes free,

original: log par rnam brtag ma yin nam //
analyzed: log par rnam brtag ma yin nam //
translated: is that not a false imputation?

original: gang tshe rgyal bas mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: gang tshe rgyal bas mya ngan 'das //
translated: When the Victorious Ones have attained nirvana,

original: gcig pu kho na bden par gsungs //🔽de tshe lhag ma log min par //
analyzed: gcig pu kho na bden par gsungs // de tshe lhag ma log min par //
translated: He alone is the truth.🔽Then, what wise man would imagine

original: mkhas pa su zhig rtog par byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa su zhig rtog par byed //
translated: that the rest is not false?

original: ces bya ba'o sogs pa gsungs te mthar thug pa'o //🔽de kho na nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyod pa ni //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o sogs pa gsungs te mthar thug pa'o // de kho na nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyod pa ni //
translated: This is the conclusion.🔽The conduct of the yogi who has attained reality is

original: de lta'i de nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: de lta'i de nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who has attained such reality

original: rgyu dang mi rgyu bdag nyid 'gro gnyer gcig / ye shes rang bzhin mi yi seng ge rgyu //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu bdag nyid 'gro gnyer gcig / ye shes rang bzhin mi yi seng ge rgyu //
translated: is the one friend of the animate and inanimate, the cause of the lion among men who is the nature of intuition,

original: 'gro kun gnas nas mi zad dus thob yin //
analyzed: 'gro kun gnas nas mi zad dus thob yin //
translated: the one who has attained the inexhaustible time of the world.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te sngar bshad pa'i de kho na de lta bu nyid thob cing rnyed pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni rgyu dang mi rgyu'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te sngar bshad pa'i de kho na de lta bu nyid thob cing rnyed pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni rgyu dang mi rgyu'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The yogi who has attained and found such reality as was explained above is the one friend of the animate and inanimate, the nature of all things that are stable and moving.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin thams cad la khyab par gnas so //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin thams cad la khyab par gnas so //
translated: He abides pervading everything.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi gnyen gcig yin pa ni gzhan la phan pa byed par lhur len pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi gnyen gcig yin pa ni gzhan la phan pa byed par lhur len pa'i phyir ro//
translated: He is the one friend of all beings because he is intent on benefiting others.

original: rgyu ba ni spros pa med pa dang shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba ni spros pa med pa dang shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pas gnas pa'o //
translated: “Moving” means remaining in the conduct that is free of elaboration and utterly free of elaboration.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin zhes pa ni don dam pa yin la byed pa las rnam par mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin zhes pa ni don dam pa yin la byed pa las rnam par mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: “The nature of wisdom” is the ultimate, and it does not move from its function.

original: de bzhin du mi rnams kyi nang nas shes rab kyi sder mo'i rtse mo rnams kyis srid pa'i glang po che'i mtshog ma'i klad pa 'gems pa'i phyir seng ge dang 'dra bas na seng ge ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rnams kyi nang nas shes rab kyi sder mo'i rtse mo rnams kyis srid pa'i glang po che'i mtshog ma'i klad pa 'gems pa'i phyir seng ge dang 'dra bas na seng ge ste /
translated: In the same way, because they are like lions that pierce the brain in the crown of the elephant of existence with the claws of wisdom, they are “lions among men.”

original: de'i phyir mi'i seng ge 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi'i seng ge 'am /
translated: Therefore, they are “lions among men” or

original: seng ge rnam par grol ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi'i seng ge'o //
analyzed: seng ge rnam par grol ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi'i seng ge'o //
translated: “lions among men” because they are absorbed in the concentration of the liberated lion.

original: seng ge ni glang po che'i thog tu mchongs nas bsad de rang gnas su 'ongs nas 'dug go zhes grag ste /
analyzed: seng ge ni glang po che'i thog tu mchongs nas bsad de rang gnas su 'ongs nas 'dug go zhes grag ste /
translated: It is well known that a lion jumps on top of an elephant, kills it, and then returns to its own place and stays there.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig rang gi ye shes kyi seng ges gzhan gyi shes pa 'dzin pas rol pa de ni ye shes kyi ri dags kyi rgyal pos rol pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig rang gi ye shes kyi seng ges gzhan gyi shes pa 'dzin pas rol pa de ni ye shes kyi ri dags kyi rgyal pos rol pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Likewise, one who is playful with the lion of one's intuition, because it holds the consciousness of others, is endowed with the yogi/nī who is playful with the king of the deer of intuition.

original: ye shes gnyis ni rab 'dres pa //
analyzed: ye shes gnyis ni rab 'dres pa //
translated: The two intuitions are thoroughly mixed,

original: seng ge rnam rol phyag rgya yin//
analyzed: seng ge rnam rol phyag rgya yin//
translated: and the mudra is the play of the lion.

original: zhes kyang gsungs te de bzhin du 'gro ba ste sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag nyid kun gyi nang nas rnal 'byor pa de ni mi zad pa'i dus te zad pa med pa'i dus dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: zhes kyang gsungs te de bzhin du 'gro ba ste sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag nyid kun gyi nang nas rnal 'byor pa de ni mi zad pa'i dus te zad pa med pa'i dus dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: Thus, from among all the transmigrators, i.e., sentient beings and the world of the environment, the yogi/nī is the one who is at the time of non-exhaustion, i.e., the time of non-ending, which is synonymous with the time of co-emergence.

original: // de thob pa ni thob par byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @136b ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: // de thob pa ni thob par byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @136b ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The one who has attained that is the one who has attained it, i.e., the one who has made it happen.

original: da ni spyod lam gyi bya ba /🔽de ni yon po'i lus kyang lus drang yin //
analyzed: da ni spyod lam gyi bya ba / de ni yon po'i lus kyang lus drang yin //
translated: Now, the activity of the yogi/nī's conduct:🔽That one is a straight body even with a crooked body,

original: de ni stan med gyur kyang stan gnas brtan //
analyzed: de ni stan med gyur kyang stan gnas brtan //
translated: that one is a firm sitter even without a seat.

original: de ni mig btsums gyur kyang mig gdangs yin //
analyzed: de ni mig btsums gyur kyang mig gdangs yin //
translated: Even with eyes closed, he has eyes open.

original: de ni mnyam gzhag min yang mnyam gzhag 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni mnyam gzhag min yang mnyam gzhag 'gyur //
translated: Even without meditative equipoise, he has meditative equipoise.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te rnal 'byor pa de ni gal te res 'ga' yon po'i lus te lus drang po ma yin pas mal na nyal du zin kyang 'on kyang lus drang po yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te rnal 'byor pa de ni gal te res 'ga' yon po'i lus te lus drang po ma yin pas mal na nyal du zin kyang 'on kyang lus drang po yin te /
translated: This yogin, even if he sometimes lies down in bed with a crooked body, that is, an unstraight body, still has a straight body.

original: lus drang por gnas pa bzhin ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus drang por gnas pa bzhin ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as if he had a straight body, meditative concentration manifests.

original: gal te mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe stan med par gyur kyang man ngag gi mtshan nyid stan la gnas pas brtan zhing mi g-yo ba yin no //🔽de ni gal te mig gdangs pa ste mig rab tu phye ba yin du zin kyang 'on kyang phyi rol dang nang dang gnyis ka thams cad du thams cad de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin kho nar mthong ba'i phyir mig btsums pa yin te kha nang du
analyzed: gal te mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe stan med par gyur kyang man ngag gi mtshan nyid stan la gnas pas brtan zhing mi g-yo ba yin no // de ni gal te mig gdangs pa ste mig rab tu phye ba yin du zin kyang 'on kyang phyi rol dang nang dang gnyis ka thams cad du thams cad de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin kho nar mthong ba'i phyir mig btsums pa yin te kha nang du
translated: Even if he has no seat when he is in meditative equipoise, he is firm and unmoving, abiding on the seat of instruction.

original: bltas pa yin no //
analyzed: bltas pa yin no //
translated: Even if he has his eyes open, that is, his eyes wide open, still he has his eyes closed, because he sees everything, both external and internal, as only the nature of reality. He looks inward.

original: de bzhin du mnyam gzhag min yang ste spyod lam bzhi la gnas pa bzhin du yang mnyam par gzhag cing sems rtse gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mnyam gzhag min yang ste spyod lam bzhi la gnas pa bzhin du yang mnyam par gzhag cing sems rtse gcig pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, even when not in meditative equipoise, that is, when abiding in the four types of daily activity, they are in meditative equipoise and their minds are one pointed,

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba brtan par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba brtan par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their vision of suchness has become stable.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa de lta bu spros pa med dang shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa byed pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa de lta bu spros pa med dang shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa byed pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Such yogins and yoginīs who see suchness are said to engage in unelaborate and extremely unelaborate conduct.

original: sgren mo 'am gal te sgren min pas //
analyzed: sgren mo 'am gal te sgren min pas //
translated: Whether naked or not,

original: gang du ji ltar gnas pa des //
analyzed: gang du ji ltar gnas pa des //
translated: wherever and however they stay,

original: rang gi lha ru dmigs byas te //
analyzed: rang gi lha ru dmigs byas te //
translated: they should visualize themselves as the deity

original: de nyid gcig tu rnam bsam bya //🔽zhes kyang gsungs so //🔽de bzhin du gzhan yang ji lta bu zhig snyam pa'i dgongs pa bsus nas /🔽de ni tshig dang ldan yang dag bsdams yin //🔽de ni longs spyod ldan yang dmigs bral yin //🔽de ni 'jig rten mgon yang gzhan bran gyur //
analyzed: de nyid gcig tu rnam bsam bya //🔽zhes kyang gsungs so //🔽de bzhin du gzhan yang ji lta bu zhig snyam pa'i dgongs pa bsus nas /🔽de ni tshig dang ldan yang dag bsdams yin //🔽de ni longs spyod ldan yang dmigs bral yin //🔽de ni 'jig rten mgon yang gzhan bran gyur //
translated: and contemplate that alone.

original: gang zhig de nyid rtogs shing nyes kun zad //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig de nyid rtogs shing nyes kun zad // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He who realizes suchness and has exhausted all faults.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa de ni tshig dang ldan yang ste tshig dang ngag dang glu dang rgyal pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan du zin kyang ngag bsdams shing ngag kun du thul bar yin par brjod pa ste ngag gi rnam
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa de ni tshig dang ldan yang ste tshig dang ngag dang glu dang rgyal pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang ldan du zin kyang ngag bsdams shing ngag kun du thul bar yin par brjod pa ste ngag gi rnam
translated: Thus, although that yogin is endowed with speech, that is, although he is endowed with various kinds of speech, such as words, phrases, songs, and poetry, he is said to be restrained in speech, to have his speech well subdued, because he does not conceptualize speech.

original: par rtog pa sgra rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par rtog pa sgra rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not conceptualize speech because he does not observe sounds.

original: de mi dmigs pa ni 'od gsal ba khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa ni 'od gsal ba khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not observe sounds because he has realized clear light.

original: @137a * // de bzhin du longs spyod de 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po rnams dang ldan zhing 'brel du zin kyang dmigs bral zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la nye bar dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: @137a * // de bzhin du longs spyod de 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po rnams dang ldan zhing 'brel du zin kyang dmigs bral zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la nye bar dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, although he is endowed with, that is, associated with, enjoyments, that is, the five sense objects, he is free from observation, that is, he does not observe objects such as form.

original: de rnams sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyid du mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba can gyi nyan thos rigs can gyi dge slong lnga brgya sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid skad cig gcig la bcug par gyur to zhes theg pa
analyzed: de rnams sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyid du mthong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba can gyi nyan thos rigs can gyi dge slong lnga brgya sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid skad cig gcig la bcug par gyur to zhes theg pa
translated: Because they see that those are pure by nature as the illusion-like meditative stabilization.

original: chen po'i mdo sde rnams las thos te /
analyzed: chen po'i mdo sde rnams las thos te /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān, in the Mahāyāna sūtras, heard that the five hundred śrāvakas of the family of the view with an object were instantly introduced to the reality of luminosity by the illusion-like meditative stabilization.

original: dper na thugs rje chen po'i bdud rtsis thugs brlan pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgon pa'i gnas su dge slong gi dngos por gnas pa'i nyan thos lnga brgya gzigs nas 'od zer gyi sbyor bas dge slong gi cha byad can gyi
analyzed: dper na thugs rje chen po'i bdud rtsis thugs brlan pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgon pa'i gnas su dge slong gi dngos por gnas pa'i nyan thos lnga brgya gzigs nas 'od zer gyi sbyor bas dge slong gi cha byad can gyi
translated: For example, the Bhagavān, the perfect, complete Buddha, whose mind is moistened by the nectar of great compassion, seeing the five hundred śrāvakas who were abiding as monks in a solitary place, emanated a being with the appearance of a monk by the application of light rays.

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig sprul te spros so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig sprul te spros so //
translated: He emanated him.

original: de nas de 'chag cing song ba dang / lam gyi dbus dgon par dge slong lnga brgya po de dag dang phrad par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de 'chag cing song ba dang / lam gyi dbus dgon par dge slong lnga brgya po de dag dang phrad par gyur to //
translated: Then, as he was walking along, in the middle of the road he met those five hundred monks.

original: de rnams kyis smras pa btsun pa khyod su yin /
analyzed: de rnams kyis smras pa btsun pa khyod su yin /
translated: They said, “Venerable, who are you?”

original: des smras pa btsun pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des smras pa btsun pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: He said, “There is no one called ‘venerable.’”

original: de rnams kyis smras pa sdom pas rgan nam bzhon nam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: de rnams kyis smras pa sdom pas rgan nam bzhon nam 'on te ma yin /
translated: They said, “Are you an elder, a youth, or neither?”

original: de rnams la smras pa brtul zhugs zhes bya ba ci zhig gang zhig gang gi brtul zhugs yin /
analyzed: de rnams la smras pa brtul zhugs zhes bya ba ci zhig gang zhig gang gi brtul zhugs yin /
translated: He said to them, “What is called ‘vow’? Who is what? Whose vow?
