original: rgan pa ni gang zhig gzhon pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rgan pa ni gang zhig gzhon pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: Who is an elder? Who is a youth?”

original: de rnams kyis smras pa khyod gang nas 'ongs gang du 'gro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis smras pa khyod gang nas 'ongs gang du 'gro //
translated: They said, “Where do you come from? Where are you going?”

original: des smras pa gang nas ma 'ongs gang du yang mi 'gro ste 'gro ba ni su zhig gang du 'gro bar bya /
analyzed: des smras pa gang nas ma 'ongs gang du yang mi 'gro ste 'gro ba ni su zhig gang du 'gro bar bya /
translated: He said, “I have not come from anywhere. I am not going anywhere. Who is going where?”

original: de rnams kyis smras pa khyed gang na gnas ming dang rus ci yin /
analyzed: de rnams kyis smras pa khyed gang na gnas ming dang rus ci yin /
translated: They said, “Where do you live? What is your name and clan?”

original: des smras pa gang na mi gnas shing nga'i ming dang rus la sogs pa ni cung zad kyang med do de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa gang na mi gnas shing nga'i ming dang rus la sogs pa ni cung zad kyang med do de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: He replied, “I do not abide anywhere, and I do not have any name, clan, and so on.” They said,

original: khyod kyi ting nge 'dzin gang yin nga la ting nge 'dzin 'ga' yang med de nga ni 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu nyid yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi ting nge 'dzin gang yin nga la ting nge 'dzin 'ga' yang med de nga ni 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu nyid yin no zhe'o //
translated: “What is your samādhi?” He replied, “I do not have any samādhi at all. I am just like this and that.”

original: de nas dge slong de rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus skad cig gcig la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms @137b par zhugs nas yang dag pa'i tshul gyi bdag nyid de kho na nyid mngon du byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dge slong de rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus skad cig gcig la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms @137b par zhugs nas yang dag pa'i tshul gyi bdag nyid de kho na nyid mngon du byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by the power of the Buddha’s blessing, those monks entered the samādhi that is like an illusion, free from going and coming in an instant, and they actualized suchness, the nature of reality.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, because it benefits the world,

original: 'jig rten gyi mgon du gyur pa yin yang sems can gzhan rnams kyi bran du gyur cing khol po dang mtshungs pa yin te nga rgyal med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mgon du gyur pa yin yang sems can gzhan rnams kyi bran du gyur cing khol po dang mtshungs pa yin te nga rgyal med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the protector of the world, but he is a slave, a servant of other beings, because he is free of pride.

original: 'gro ba rnams la gdol ba'i phru gu bzhin //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams la gdol ba'i phru gu bzhin //
translated: He is like a caṇḍāla child to the world.

original: rgyags dang nga rgyal dregs pa spangs nas ni //
analyzed: rgyags dang nga rgyal dregs pa spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned intoxication, pride, and arrogance,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid shes pas na de nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid shes pas na de nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: He is a knower of reality because he knows nondual reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa kun zad pa yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa kun zad pa yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said of him who has extinguished all faults such as passion and so on. This is the conclusion.

original: da ni ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi sgo nas mngon par byang chub /
analyzed: da ni ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi sgo nas mngon par byang chub /
translated: Now, in terms of the two meditative stabilizations, there is manifest enlightenment.

original: man ngag thob pa'i slob ma yis //
analyzed: man ngag thob pa'i slob ma yis //
translated: The disciple who has received the instructions

original: de nas rnal 'byor rnam gnyis bslab //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor rnam gnyis bslab //
translated: then trains in the two kinds of yoga,🔽the stage of apprehending the whole

original: ril por 'dzin pa'i rim pa dang // de bzhin rjes su gzhig pas so //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa'i rim pa dang // de bzhin rjes su gzhig pas so //
translated: and likewise the stage of subsequent destruction.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bla ma'i zhal nas man ngag ste mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i man ngag thob nas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal nas man ngag ste mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i man ngag thob nas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnal 'byor rnam gnyis te /
translated: Having obtained the esoteric instructions of the guru, the esoteric instructions of the stage of manifest enlightenment, in order to demonstrate that, one should cultivate meditative concentration with two kinds of yoga.

original: bye brag gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin goms par bya'o//
analyzed: bye brag gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin goms par bya'o//
translated: The teaching is that one should cultivate meditative concentration with two kinds of yoga.

original: gcig ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rim pa yin zhing gnyis pa ni rjes su gzhig pa'i rim pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rim pa yin zhing gnyis pa ni rjes su gzhig pa'i rim pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: One is the stage of apprehending the totality, and the second is the stage of subsequent destruction.

original: bshad pa ni /🔽mgo nas rkang pa'i bar dag gam //
analyzed: bshad pa ni / mgo nas rkang pa'i bar dag gam //
translated: The explanation is as follows.🔽From the head to the feet,

original: ji srid snying gar phyin pa'i bar //
analyzed: ji srid snying gar phyin pa'i bar //
translated: or as far as the heart,

original: rnal 'byor yang dag mthar 'jug pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor yang dag mthar 'jug pa //
translated: the yoga that enters into the perfect endpoint

original: ril por 'dzin pa zhes bshad do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa zhes bshad do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is explained as apprehending the totality.

original: lte ba chos kyi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa la yi ger bkod nas chos thams cad bdag med pa'i blos de las 'di spros te de'i steng du song nas mgo bo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i bar du bsregs nas slar snying gar song ste yang de kho na
analyzed: lte ba chos kyi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa la yi ger bkod nas chos thams cad bdag med pa'i blos de las 'di spros te de'i steng du song nas mgo bo nas brtsams te rkang pa'i bar du bsregs nas slar snying gar song ste yang de kho na
translated: Again, having gone to the heart, one does it just like that.

original: bzhin byas nas rnal 'byor pa yang dag mtha' ste don dam pa la 'jug pa de ni ri por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin byas nas rnal 'byor pa yang dag mtha' ste don dam pa la 'jug pa de ni ri por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: That yoga of the yogin entering into the perfect end, the ultimate, should be said to be the meditative stabilization of apprehending the whole.

original: cha drug pa'i gong bu mi dmigs par 'dzin pa ni ril por 'dzin pa'o //🔽bshad do zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung tshad ma @138a * //
analyzed: cha drug pa'i gong bu mi dmigs par 'dzin pa ni ril por 'dzin pa'o // bshad do zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung tshad ma @138a * //
translated: Apprehending the six-part aggregate as not observable is apprehending the whole.🔽This is explained indicates that scripture is valid knowledge.

original: yin par bstan te zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: yin par bstan te zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is taught is the ultimate.

original: rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu nyid //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang ni mi rgyu nyid //
translated: The moving and the unmoving

original: dang po 'od gsal bar bya ste //
analyzed: dang po 'od gsal bar bya ste //
translated: are first made luminous,

original: phyi nas de bzhin bdag nyid bya //
analyzed: phyi nas de bzhin bdag nyid bya //
translated: and then one should do the same to oneself.

original: de ni rjes gzhig rim pa yin //
analyzed: de ni rjes gzhig rim pa yin //
translated: That is the sequence of subsequent destruction.

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyis ba sbu'i bu ga'i gseb thams cad nas byung ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i bdag nyid kyi 'gro ba snang ba med par bya ste de bzhin du bdag nyid kyang snang ba med par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdul bzhin rdul
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyis ba sbu'i bu ga'i gseb thams cad nas byung ba'i 'od zer gyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i bdag nyid kyi 'gro ba snang ba med par bya ste de bzhin du bdag nyid kyang snang ba med par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdul bzhin rdul
translated: By this very process, one should make the world, which is the nature of the wheel of light rays that arise from all the pores of the body, invisible, and likewise, one should make oneself invisible.

original: phra rab re re phye nas 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir rjes su gzhig pa zhes bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: phra rab re re phye nas 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir rjes su gzhig pa zhes bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is called “disintegration into atoms,” because one cannot observe the world when it is divided into atoms, into the most subtle particles. This is the ultimate.

original: 'dir dpe gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir dpe gnyis te /
translated: Here there are two examples:

original: ji ltar chu bo 'am lteng ka'i chu ni dri med dag la zla ba gnas pa ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar chu bo 'am lteng ka'i chu ni dri med dag la zla ba gnas pa ltar //
translated: Just as the moon is situated in the water of a river or a pool,

original: de bzhin rim pa 'di yis rjes su gzhig ces rnal 'byor pas ni rtag tu bsam //
analyzed: de bzhin rim pa 'di yis rjes su gzhig ces rnal 'byor pas ni rtag tu bsam //
translated: in the same way, by this process, the yogi should always contemplate “disintegration.”

original: me long la ni rlung dag rim gyis zad par 'gyur ba bzhin du 'ang blta bya ste //
analyzed: me long la ni rlung dag rim gyis zad par 'gyur ba bzhin du 'ang blta bya ste //
translated: And just as the wind gradually dissipates in a mirror,

original: ril por 'dzin pa dag la bya ba'i rim pa 'di ni de bzhin yang dag brtag / ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa dag la bya ba'i rim pa 'di ni de bzhin yang dag brtag / ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: one should observe the process of action in the whole world in the same way.

original: 'od gsal ba la yang dang yang du goms par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba la yang dang yang du goms par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to repeatedly cultivate clear light,

original: dbugs kyi rlung ni me long la //
analyzed: dbugs kyi rlung ni me long la //
translated: the wind-energies enter the central channel

original: ji ltar kun du thim 'gyur ba //🔽de bzhin rnal 'byor yang dag mtha' //
analyzed: ji ltar kun du thim 'gyur ba // de bzhin rnal 'byor yang dag mtha' //
translated: just as the breath is absorbed🔽into a stainless mirror.🔽Thus, the yogi should repeatedly enter

original: yang dang yang du 'jug par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te ji ltar me long dri ma med pa la dbugs kyi rlung ste kha'i rlung bzhag pa na skad cig nyid kyis thim zhing zhi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas skad cig re re zhing yang dag mtha' ste 'od gsal ba
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'jug par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te ji ltar me long dri ma med pa la dbugs kyi rlung ste kha'i rlung bzhag pa na skad cig nyid kyis thim zhing zhi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas skad cig re re zhing yang dag mtha' ste 'od gsal ba
translated: the limit of reality, clear light.

original: la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni goms par brtan par bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni goms par brtan par bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Just as the breath, the wind of the mouth, is absorbed and pacified in an instant when placed on a stainless mirror, so the yogi should enter the limit of reality, clear light, in each instant. This teaches the stability of cultivation.

original: gzhan du na glog bzhin du g-yo ba'i don dam pa'i skad cig la gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na glog bzhin du g-yo ba'i don dam pa'i skad cig la gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, like lightning, one would not abide in the ultimate instant. This is the culmination.

original: spyod lam thams cad du 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad du 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa ni //
translated: Entering clear light in all activities🔽is taught by the following verse.

original: 'gro dang 'dug dang nyal dang za //
analyzed: 'gro dang 'dug dang nyal dang za //
translated: Going, staying, lying down, eating,🔽opening and closing the eyes, laughing,

original: mig 'byed 'dzums dang dgod pa dang // bsam gtan sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: mig 'byed 'dzums dang dgod pa dang // bsam gtan sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
translated: by this yoga of meditation,

original: de nyid rig pa rtag tu gnas //
analyzed: de nyid rig pa rtag tu gnas //
translated: one always abides in the knowledge of reality.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams ni spyod lam rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams ni spyod lam rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Going and so forth are the four postures.

original: za ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ni dbang po'i bya ba rnams nye bar mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: za ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ni dbang po'i bya ba rnams nye bar mtshon par bya ste /
translated: Eating and so forth illustrate the activities of the senses.

original: de na las thams cad la 'jug pa na rnal 'byor @138b pa ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid la ston par byed do //
analyzed: de na las thams cad la 'jug pa na rnal 'byor @138b pa ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid la ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, when engaging in all actions, the yogi/nī introduces this very samādhi.

original: de nyid rig pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rig pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: The so-called knowledge of reality is the clear realization of the ultimate just as it is.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni nyin dang mtshan du'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni nyin dang mtshan du'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Always means day and night.

original: 'od gsal bzhugs pa'i sems can gyi don ni /
analyzed: 'od gsal bzhugs pa'i sems can gyi don ni /
translated: The benefit of sentient beings who abide in luminosity is as follows:

original: brgya la sems can don byed na //
analyzed: brgya la sems can don byed na //
translated: If one benefits sentient beings,🔽then light rays in accord with that

original: de dang de mthun 'od zer dang // rnam shes rlung dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: de dang de mthun 'od zer dang // rnam shes rlung dang ldan pa ni //
translated: and consciousness endowed with the vāyu

original: bdag byin brlab pa'i rim pas bya //
analyzed: bdag byin brlab pa'i rim pas bya //
translated: One should do so by the stage of self-consecration.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs kyi gtso bor byas pa'i sgo nas de dang de mthun pa'i 'od zer spros la rnam shes rlung dang ldan pa ste yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i🔽sku rnam grangs gzhan yang bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa des gzhan 'ja' tshon lta bu'i skur bskyed nas sku de dang 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bshad pa na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs kyi gtso bor byas pa'i sgo nas de dang de mthun pa'i 'od zer spros la rnam shes rlung dang ldan pa ste yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i sku rnam grangs gzhan yang bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa des gzhan 'ja' tshon lta bu'i skur bskyed nas sku de dang 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bshad pa na /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽When the yogi/nī wishes to work for the welfare of sentient beings, then, having emanated light rays in accordance with this and that, by way of the principal of the five Tathagata families, he/she should generate the body of the mind-nature deity, endowed with consciousness and wind, into another body like a rainbow, by means of that other stage called “self-consecration.”

original: smin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'gro ba'i don bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: smin pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'gro ba'i don bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: Having generated that body and light rays, he/she should work for the welfare of beings by way of the modes of ripening and so forth.🔽This is the hidden meaning.

original: 'od gsal ba ni thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin par /🔽ji ltar dang ba'i chu klung las //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin par / ji ltar dang ba'i chu klung las //
translated: The cause of the arising of everything is clear light.🔽Just as fish quickly leap

original: nya dag myur bar 'phar ba ltar //
analyzed: nya dag myur bar 'phar ba ltar //
translated: from a clear river,

original: de bzhin thams cad stong gsal las //
analyzed: de bzhin thams cad stong gsal las //
translated: Likewise, from everything empty and luminous,

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'byung bar 'gyur//
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'byung bar 'gyur//
translated: the net of illusions will arise.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.🔽Just as fish, suddenly seeking food, quickly leap out of a river’s water,🔽which is free of the turbidity of the faults of mud and mire,

original: ji ltar dang zhing 'dam gyi nyes pa'i rnyog pa med pa'i chu klung ste chu bo'i chu las glo bur du zas don du gnyer ba'i nya de nya rnams myur du skad cig tsam gyis 'phar zhing 'byung ste chu na spyod pa nyid yin pas de'i nang du
analyzed: ji ltar dang zhing 'dam gyi nyes pa'i rnyog pa med pa'i chu klung ste chu bo'i chu las glo bur du zas don du gnyer ba'i nya de nya rnams myur du skad cig tsam gyis 'phar zhing 'byung ste chu na spyod pa nyid yin pas de'i nang du
translated: and then quickly return to it,

original: myur du 'gro bar nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: myur du 'gro bar nus pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because they are able to move quickly within it,

original: / de kho na bzhin du thams cad stong pa ste 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i 'dam gyi dri ma dang bral zhing gsal ba las sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha'i sku 'di 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir skad
analyzed: / de kho na bzhin du thams cad stong pa ste 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i 'dam gyi dri ma dang bral zhing gsal ba las sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi lha'i sku 'di 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir skad
translated: in just the same way, from the reality of everything empty and luminous, free of the stains of the mire of afflictions such as attachment and clear, this illusory nature of the deity’s body arises or is born in an instant for the sake of migrating beings.

original: cig gis 'byung zhing skye ba 'am 'pho bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: cig gis 'byung zhing skye ba 'am 'pho bar 'gyur ro//
translated: It is born for the sake of migrating beings.

original: dra ba ste 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ma lus pa yang de kho nas 'byung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dra ba ste 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ma lus pa yang de kho nas 'byung ba nyid yin no //
translated: The entire wheel of cyclic existence, the net, arises from just that.

original: rnal 'byor pa dang so so'i skye bo dag la yongs su shes pa dang yongs su ma shes pas byas pa dang rang dbang can dang rang dbang can ma yin pas byas pa'i khyad par yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dang so so'i skye bo dag la yongs su shes pa dang yongs su ma shes pas byas pa dang rang dbang can dang rang dbang can ma yin pas byas pa'i khyad par yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: The difference between yogins and ordinary beings is to be understood as being due to complete knowledge and incomplete knowledge, and to being self-dependent and not self-dependent.

original: de nyid @139a * //🔽bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po rnams kyi rgyu ni gcig pa nyid yin zhing de nyid du thim par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni rim pa gsum par bshad zin
analyzed: de nyid @139a * // bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po rnams kyi rgyu ni gcig pa nyid yin zhing de nyid du thim par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni rim pa gsum par bshad zin
translated: That is🔽the presentation of bondage and liberation. The cause of the things of affliction and purification is just that, and it is also dissolved into just that.

original: pas 'dir mi spro ste sbas pa'o //
analyzed: pas 'dir mi spro ste sbas pa'o //
translated: Since that has already been explained in the third stage, it is not expanded upon here; it is hidden.

original: de las byung ba'i sku'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sku'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: The nature of the body that arises from that is

original: rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas la ltos pa'i //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas la ltos pa'i //
translated: the five buddha families.

original: phyag rgya chen por brtag pa ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen por brtag pa ni //
translated: The examination of the great seal

original: 'od zer lnga ni 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: 'od zer lnga ni 'byung ba ste //
translated: is the arising of the five lights.

original: nam mkha' 'ja' tshon mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'ja' tshon mtshungs pa yin //
translated: It is like a rainbow in the sky.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnal 'byor bas 'od gsal ba de las sku spros pa gang yin pa de ni phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bas 'od gsal ba de las sku spros pa gang yin pa de ni phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The body that the yogi projects from that clear light is the Great Seal.

original: de'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i phyag dang zhal dang sku mdog dang dbyibs dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyag rgya yang yin la 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir chen po yang yin pas phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i phyag dang zhal dang sku mdog dang dbyibs dang ldan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyag rgya yang yin la 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir chen po yang yin pas phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: It is a seal because it has the form of hands, faces, colors, and shapes that are endowed with all supreme aspects. It is great because it arises from clear light.

original: brtag pa ni shes par bya'o//
analyzed: brtag pa ni shes par bya'o//
translated: It should be understood that it is imagined.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na mos pa'i bye brag gi sgo nas sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du'am zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na mos pa'i bye brag gi sgo nas sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du'am zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du rigs lnga'i sangs rgyas la ltos pa ste /
translated: In what way? It is in relation to the five buddha families, for the sake of guiding sentient beings by means of various aspirations, or for the sake of pacification, and so on.

original: rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the five buddha families.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'od zer lnga 'byung ba na zhes bya ba 'od zer kha dog sna lnga pa'i 'od zer rim pa'am cig car du 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'od zer lnga 'byung ba na zhes bya ba 'od zer kha dog sna lnga pa'i 'od zer rim pa'am cig car du 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the five lights arise, the five-colored light rays arise in sequence or simultaneously, and they are the cause of the light rays.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor las khyad par du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor las khyad par du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement “the yoga of the creation stage” is a distinction.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' ste nam mkha'i 'ja' tshon 'od zer kha dog sna lnga'i pa'i tshogs 'phro bar byed pa snang ba de bzhin du de yang yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin no zhes sgyu ma bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' ste nam mkha'i 'ja' tshon 'od zer kha dog sna lnga'i pa'i tshogs 'phro bar byed pa snang ba de bzhin du de yang yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin no zhes sgyu ma bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Just as a rainbow in the sky radiates a collection of five-colored light rays, it should be understood that it is like an illusion, neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: te sbas pa'o //
translated: The meaning is hidden.

original: sku bskyed nas phyag rgya bcing ba la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid la gnas pa kho nas bya ba yin no snyam du thugs la bzhag nas /🔽phyag rgya 'ching bar byed pa'am //
analyzed: sku bskyed nas phyag rgya bcing ba la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid la gnas pa kho nas bya ba yin no snyam du thugs la bzhag nas / phyag rgya 'ching bar byed pa'am //
translated: Thinking that the binding of the mudra and so on after generating the body should be done only by abiding in reality,🔽if one binds the mudra,

original: gal te gsang sngags bzlas pa'am //
analyzed: gal te gsang sngags bzlas pa'am //
translated: if one recites the mantra,

original: gzhan dag thams cad byed pa na //
analyzed: gzhan dag thams cad byed pa na //
translated: or if one does everything else,

original: thams cad stong pa'i gzhi la gnas //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa'i gzhi la gnas //
translated: Abiding in the basis of the emptiness of everything.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: phyag rgya bcing ba ste phyi rol gyi lag pa'i phyag rgya la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: phyag rgya bcing ba ste phyi rol gyi lag pa'i phyag rgya la sogs pa'am /
translated: Binding the mudra, either the external mudra of the hands, and so on,

original: nang gi dgug pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: nang gi dgug pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: or the internal mudra of attraction, and so on,

original: las kyi phyag rgya la sogs @139b pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mchan nyid kyi byed pa'am las te gsang sngags ngag gi bzlas pa'i sgo nas gsal ba'am /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya la sogs @139b pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i mchan nyid kyi byed pa'am las te gsang sngags ngag gi bzlas pa'i sgo nas gsal ba'am /
translated: the action of the karmamudra, and so on, is the clarity of the mantra recitation through the voice,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i sgo nas mi gsal bar zlos shing 'don pa'am /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i sgo nas mi gsal bar zlos shing 'don pa'am /
translated: or the indistinct recitation through vajra repetition.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dkyil 'khor dang ting nge 'dzin dang phyag rgya sngags dang bya ba dang gnas thabs dang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa byed pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad stong pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dkyil 'khor dang ting nge 'dzin dang phyag rgya sngags dang bya ba dang gnas thabs dang bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa byed pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad stong pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: Similarly, all the activities of others, such as the maṇḍala, samādhi, mudra, mantra, action, method of abiding, recitation, homa, and so on, should be performed while abiding in the basis of emptiness,

original: 'od gsal ba'i gnas la gnas shing 'dug pas bya'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i gnas la gnas shing 'dug pas bya'o //
translated: the stage of luminosity.

original: de lta na ni de'i de dag 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni de'i de dag 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ba dang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, they are endowed with fruit, and are the accumulation of merit and wisdom.🔽Otherwise, they would be just the accumulation of merit, like the yoga of the creation stage.

original: gzhan du na bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang mtshungs par bsod nams kyi tshogs tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang mtshungs par bsod nams kyi tshogs tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the culmination.

original: bya ba thams cad la de kho na nyid du gnas pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad la de kho na nyid du gnas pa ni /
translated: Abiding in reality in all actions,

original: thams cad za dang thams cad 'thungs //
analyzed: thams cad za dang thams cad 'thungs //
translated: one should eat everything, drink everything,

original: kun la phyag byed kun du 'gro //
analyzed: kun la phyag byed kun du 'gro //
translated: bow to everyone, go everywhere,

original: thams cad byed dang mtshan ma kun //🔽thams cad stong pas 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad byed dang mtshan ma kun // thams cad stong pas 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: do everything, and know all signs.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa des thams cad stong pa de kho na nyid bzhi pa la brten nas grub pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa des thams cad stong pa de kho na nyid bzhi pa la brten nas grub pa'am /
translated: One will be successful through the emptiness of everything.

original: 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is a yoga practitioner of the perfection stage will be successful, or will become successful, through the emptiness of everything, based on the fourth stage of reality.

original: de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is that like?

original: thams cad za zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yul thams cad dang phyogs thams cad na 'gal ba 'am mi 'gal ba thams cad za ba na nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad za zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yul thams cad dang phyogs thams cad na 'gal ba 'am mi 'gal ba thams cad za ba na nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase all is to be eaten means that there is no fault in eating all things at all times, in all places, and in all directions, whether they are pure or impure.

original: de bzhin du thams cad 'thungs na yang nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad 'thungs na yang nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, there is no fault in drinking all things.🔽 All means all childish ordinary beings,

original: kun la ste byis pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams sam /🔽'phags pa rnams la phyag byed pa na nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun la ste byis pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams sam / 'phags pa rnams la phyag byed pa na nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or all noble beings.

original: de kho na bzhin du gal te 'gal ba dang mi 'gal ba'i yul la sogs pa thams cad la 'gro bas na kun du 'gro ba yin pa de'i tshe yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gal te 'gal ba dang mi 'gal ba'i yul la sogs pa thams cad la 'gro bas na kun du 'gro ba yin pa de'i tshe yang nyes pa med de /
translated: If one goes everywhere, to all places, whether pure or impure, there is no fault.

original: de kho na nyid shes pa yid la byed pa khyad par can gyis zin pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes pa yid la byed pa khyad par can gyis zin pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that attachment and so forth, which are embraced by the special attention of the knowledge of reality, bring about the attainment of the unsurpassed result.

original: ji skad du rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal mchog dang po las /
analyzed: ji skad du rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal mchog dang po las /
translated: As it is said in the glorious Supreme Original Buddha of the Great Yoga Tantra:🔽 🔽The five nectars are the supreme offering to the buddhas.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ste //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ste //
translated: Desire, hatred, and delusion,

original: gsum po 'di dag dug chen yin //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag dug chen yin //
translated: these three are great poisons.

original: dug nyid kyis ni brtan byas na //
analyzed: dug nyid kyis ni brtan byas na //
translated: If one is firm in poison,

original: dug tu nye bar 'gro ba nyid //🔽bdud @140a * //
analyzed: dug tu nye bar 'gro ba nyid // bdud @140a * //
translated: one will go to the poison.

original: rtsi nyid kyis brtan byas na //
analyzed: rtsi nyid kyis brtan byas na //
translated: If one is firm in nectar,

original: bdud rtsi nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdud rtsi nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: one will go to the nectar.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo sde dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang 'od srungs 'di lta ste bu ram shing gi zhing dang / 'bras kyi zhing dang ldum ra rnams la lud kyi phung pos phan par byed par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo sde dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang 'od srungs 'di lta ste bu ram shing gi zhing dang / 'bras kyi zhing dang ldum ra rnams la lud kyi phung pos phan par byed par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: And in the Ratnakuṭa Sūtra it says, “Kāśyapa, it is like this: heaps of manure are helpful to sugarcane fields, rice fields, and gardens.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la nyon mongs pas phan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la nyon mongs pas phan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, afflictions are helpful to bodhisattvas.

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste sngags dang sman gyis zin pa'i dug gis gsod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste sngags dang sman gyis zin pa'i dug gis gsod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: poison that is held by a spell and medicine does not kill.

original: de bzhin du thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir don yod par grub pa'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / de nyid kyi phyir don yod par grub pa'i rgyud las /
translated: For that reason, the Tantra of Amoghasiddhi says:🔽Whatever causes confusion for some,

original: gang gis rmongs par 'gyur ba dang // de yis mkhas pa grol 'gyur te //
analyzed: gang gis rmongs par 'gyur ba dang // de yis mkhas pa grol 'gyur te //
translated: that liberates the wise.

original: de ltar byang chub bsgoms pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub bsgoms pa yis //
translated: Thus, through cultivating enlightenment,

original: 'di dag ma lus bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: 'di dag ma lus bzlog pa yin //
translated: all of these are completely reversed.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang gzhan las kyang /
translated: And in other scriptures it says:

original: las ni drag po gang gang gis //
analyzed: las ni drag po gang gang gis //
translated: Whatever karma binds beings

original: skye bo rnams ni 'ching 'gyur ba //
analyzed: skye bo rnams ni 'ching 'gyur ba //
translated: is liberating from the bondage of existence

original: thabs dang bcas na de nyid kyis //🔽srid pa 'ching las grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas na de nyid kyis // srid pa 'ching las grol bar 'gyur //
translated: when it is accompanied by method.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate.

original: da ni man ngag thob pa'i slob ma phyir mi ldog pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi sngags bla mas byin pa gdon pa'i phyir de la mchod par bya'o snyam du thugs la bzhag nas /
analyzed: da ni man ngag thob pa'i slob ma phyir mi ldog pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi sngags bla mas byin pa gdon pa'i phyir de la mchod par bya'o snyam du thugs la bzhag nas /
translated: Now, in order that the disciple who has received the esoteric instructions not turn back, thinking that he will make offerings to the guru in order to receive the mantra of the spirit of enlightenment taught by the Bhagavat,

original: skal bzang slob ma bzang por man ngag thob /
analyzed: skal bzang slob ma bzang por man ngag thob /
translated: the disciple of good fortune, having received the esoteric instructions,

original: thal mo sbyar nas me tog 'dzin pa yis //🔽byang chub sems sngags don dam zhes bya ba //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas me tog 'dzin pa yis // byang chub sems sngags don dam zhes bya ba //
translated: with palms joined, holding a flower,

original: bla ma las ni slar yang blang bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bla ma las ni slar yang blang bar bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: should again receive from the guru🔽the mantra of the spirit of enlightenment, called the ultimate.

original: man ngag thob ces bya ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: man ngag thob ces bya ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa thob pa'o //
translated: Having received the esoteric instructions means having received the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: skal bzang zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mngon du byas pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi skur 'dzin pa ste de skad du yang dpal sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: skal bzang zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mngon du byas pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi skur 'dzin pa ste de skad du yang dpal sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba'i rgyud las /
translated: Of good fortune means that, because of the realization of reality, he grasps the body which is the nature of the five transcendent lords.

original: kun du sna tshogs skal bzang las //
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs skal bzang las //
translated: The various good fortunes are

original: rang bdag sgrub pa skal bzang yin //
analyzed: rang bdag sgrub pa skal bzang yin //
translated: the good fortune of accomplishing one’s own aim.🔽The good fortune of the Buddha Bhagavān

original: chos la bdag med dang ldan zhing //
analyzed: chos la bdag med dang ldan zhing //
translated: is endowed with the selflessness of phenomena.🔽The bad fortune of the bad times

original: dam tshig sdang bskal ngan yin //🔽srid pa shin tu bsgrub pa'i @140b phyir //
analyzed: dam tshig sdang bskal ngan yin // srid pa shin tu bsgrub pa'i @140b phyir //
translated: is the hatred of the commitments.🔽The good fortune of the Buddha Bhagavān

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan skal bzang yin //🔽shin tu mya ngan 'das pa yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan skal bzang yin // shin tu mya ngan 'das pa yi //
translated: is for the sake of accomplishing existence.🔽The bad fortune of the bad times

original: 'jig rten nyan thos skal ngan yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten nyan thos skal ngan yin //
translated: is the world of the śrāvakas who are utterly in nirvāṇa.🔽The good fortune of Vajrapāṇi

original: rtog pa thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir //🔽phyag na rdo rje skal bzang yin //🔽stong nyid shin tu sbyor ba yi //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir // phyag na rdo rje skal bzang yin // stong nyid shin tu sbyor ba yi //
translated: is for the sake of accomplishing all concepts.🔽The bad fortune of the bad times

original: rang rgyal rnams ni skal ngan yin //
analyzed: rang rgyal rnams ni skal ngan yin //
translated: is the pratyekabuddhas who are utterly devoted to emptiness.🔽The good fortune of Avalokiteśvara

original: 'dod chags thams cad sbyang ba'i phyir //🔽spyan ras gzigs dbang skal bzang ste //🔽log par lta ba dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad sbyang ba'i phyir // spyan ras gzigs dbang skal bzang ste // log par lta ba dang ldan pa'i //
translated: is for the sake of purifying all desire.🔽The bad fortune of the bad times

original: 'jig rten mu stegs skal ngan yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten mu stegs skal ngan yin //
translated: is the world of the tīrthikas who have wrong views.🔽The good fortune of Vajrasūrya

original: don dam mchog ni sdud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don dam mchog ni sdud pa'i phyir //
translated: is for the sake of gathering the supreme ultimate.

original: rdo rje nyi ma skal bzang ste //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma skal bzang ste //
translated: The bad fortune of the bad times

original: rang gi lus la 'ang chags med pa'i //
analyzed: rang gi lus la 'ang chags med pa'i //
translated: is the world of the tīrthikas who are attached to their own bodies.

original: dka' thub can kun skal ngan yin //
analyzed: dka' thub can kun skal ngan yin //
translated: All ascetics are unfortunate.

original: rgyal srid mchog tu sdud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyal srid mchog tu sdud pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are attracted to the highest sovereignty,

original: dpal ldan rta mchog skal bzang ste //🔽bdag gi med cing 'dzin med pa'i //
analyzed: dpal ldan rta mchog skal bzang ste // bdag gi med cing 'dzin med pa'i //
translated: the glorious supreme horse is fortunate.

original: sdom brtson thams cad skal ngan yin //
analyzed: sdom brtson thams cad skal ngan yin //
translated: All those who are diligent in vows are unfortunate,

original: bde kun bdag nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bde kun bdag nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: because they are without self and without grasping.

original: slob dpon thams cad skal bzang yin //🔽ltas ngan dam tshig la sdang ba'i //
analyzed: slob dpon thams cad skal bzang yin // ltas ngan dam tshig la sdang ba'i //
translated: All masters are fortunate,🔽because they are the nature of all bliss.🔽All disciples are unfortunate,

original: slob ma thams cad skal ngan yin //
analyzed: slob ma thams cad skal ngan yin //
translated: because they are inauspicious and hostile to the commitments.

original: de nyid gsang ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: de nyid gsang ba 'di yis ni //
translated: By this secret of reality,

original: rnam par shes pa don gsal 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don gsal 'gyur //
translated: consciousness becomes clear about the meaning.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rin po che lta bu'i gang zag nyid yin pas slob ma bzang po ste bu khyad par can no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rin po che lta bu'i gang zag nyid yin pas slob ma bzang po ste bu khyad par can no //
translated: For that very reason, he is a good disciple, a special son, because he is a person who is like a jewel.

original: thal mo sbyar zhes bya ba ni spyi bor lag pa'i thal mo sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar zhes bya ba ni spyi bor lag pa'i thal mo sbyar ba'o //
translated: With palms joined means with the palms of the hands joined at the crown of the head.

original: gang gis lag pa dag na me tog ste me tog gi phreng ba rnams 'dzin pa ste bla ma'i zhal snga nas lha mchod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gis lag pa dag na me tog ste me tog gi phreng ba rnams 'dzin pa ste bla ma'i zhal snga nas lha mchod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Who holds flowers in his hands, that is, garlands of flowers, for the sake of worshipping the deity in the presence of the guru, is the meaning.

original: byang chub kyi sems ston par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sngags zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ston par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sngags zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The mantra of enlightenment is the expression, because it reveals the mind of enlightenment.

original: brjod par bya ba'i gtso bo don dam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i gtso bo don dam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The ultimate is the object to be expressed, because it is the supreme object to be expressed.

original: de bla ma ste rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal padma las blang zhing gzung bar bya ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de bla ma ste rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal padma las blang zhing gzung bar bya ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: That should be taken, that is, grasped, from the mouth lotus of the guru, the vajra master.

original: da ni byang chub kyi sems kyi sngags /
analyzed: da ni byang chub kyi sems kyi sngags /
translated: Now, the mantra of the mind of enlightenment is:

original: aom dngos po kun dang rnam bral zhing ;
analyzed: aom dngos po kun dang rnam bral zhing ;
translated: Om, free from all things,🔽free from the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: phung po khams dang skye mched dang // gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched dang // gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pa //
translated: free from the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: chos kun bdag med mnyam nyid las //
analyzed: chos kun bdag med mnyam nyid las //
translated: from the equality of the selflessness of all phenomena,

original: rang sems gzod nas ma skyes pa //
analyzed: rang sems gzod nas ma skyes pa //
translated: the mind itself is primordially unborn.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /🔽re zhig dngos po kun ni bdag dang skyes @141a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te 'di'i don ni 'di yin te / re zhig dngos po kun ni bdag dang skyes @141a * //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: bu dang / gang zag dang / dbang phyug dang / srog dang / dus dang / nges pa dang / rang bzhin dang / gza' dang / las dang / lha dang / skal pa dang / bsod nams rnams te gzhan dag gis brtags pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: bu dang / gang zag dang / dbang phyug dang / srog dang / dus dang / nges pa dang / rang bzhin dang / gza' dang / las dang / lha dang / skal pa dang / bsod nams rnams te gzhan dag gis brtags pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: First, all things are imagined by others to be a self, a person, an individual, a master, a life-force, time, necessity, nature, fate, karma, gods, fortune, or merit.

original: de la bdag ces bya ba ni rnam par dpyad na phung po la sogs pa las logs shig tu mi dmigs te tshad ma med pa dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri bo mtho ba nyi shu las byung ba'i bdag la rnam par dpyad na yod pa ma🔽yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba ni rnam par dpyad na phung po la sogs pa las logs shig tu mi dmigs te tshad ma med pa dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri bo mtho ba nyi shu las byung ba'i bdag la rnam par dpyad na yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, a “self” is not observed separately from the aggregates, etc., when analyzed, because it does not exist when analyzed in terms of the self that arises from the twenty high peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection, which is devoid of valid knowledge.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i skyes bu yang yod pa ma yin te gtan med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i skyes bu yang yod pa ma yin te gtan med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: A “person” that is not the nature of cause and effect does not exist, because it is utterly nonexistent, like the horn of a donkey.

original: gang zhig sgyu ma yin zhing 'bras bu ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig sgyu ma yin zhing 'bras bu ma yin pa //
translated: What is an illusion and not a result?🔽

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu'i dngos po ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu'i dngos po ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But a thing that is an illusion and not a result is not perceived.

original: gang zag kyang rtag pa yang yin la yang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zag kyang rtag pa yang yin la yang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory to say that a person is permanent and is born.

original: dbang phyug kyang byed pa po'i nus pa dang ldan pa yang yin zhing rtag pa yang yin par rigs pa ma yin te byed pa po nyid yin pas 'bras bu 'byung ba na rgyu 'gag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang byed pa po'i nus pa dang ldan pa yang yin zhing rtag pa yang yin par rigs pa ma yin te byed pa po nyid yin pas 'bras bu 'byung ba na rgyu 'gag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that God is the creator and is endowed with the power to create and is permanent, because when the result is seen to arise, the cause is seen to cease.

original: de bas na rtag pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he would not be permanent.

original: srog ces bya ba khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin par rigs pa ma yin te rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang tshe 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin par rigs pa ma yin te rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang tshe 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the life force is a pervasive, intrinsic nature, because consciousness, the sense faculties, and life cease.

original: dus ni skad cig gzhan dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang nyid yod pa ma yin pas 'byung ba rnams dus kyis smin par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa yin no zhes ci'i phyir brjod par bya /
analyzed: dus ni skad cig gzhan dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rang nyid yod pa ma yin pas 'byung ba rnams dus kyis smin par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa yin no zhes ci'i phyir brjod par bya /
translated: Time is not itself, because it is the nature of one instant after another. Therefore, why would one say that the elements are matured and generated by time?

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba ste /
translated: “Determination” means death.

original: de ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'byung ba rnams skyed par byed pa dang sdud par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'byung ba rnams skyed par byed pa dang sdud par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also untenable to say that the elements generate and withdraw according to the desire of that,

original: de rgyu yin na de'i rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyu yin na de'i rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is a cause, its permanence is undermined.

original: rang bzhin du smra ba la dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin par mi 'thad de rang bzhin ni gcig pu yin pa dang / thams cad cig car skye ba dang // 'jig par mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin du smra ba la dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin par mi 'thad de rang bzhin ni gcig pu yin pa dang / thams cad cig car skye ba dang // 'jig par mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the proponents of intrinsic nature, it is untenable that things are various, because intrinsic nature is singular, and it is seen that everything arises and is destroyed simultaneously.

original: las su smra ba yang rmongs pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i dbang du byas nas gzhan pa yin gyi don dam par ni las yod pa ma yin te de ni sems dang 'brel pa nyid dang / skad cig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir las kyi nus pa yod par ga la 'gyur /🔽de bzhin du @141b yang las ni byed pa po la ltos pa yin te byed pa po dang las logs shig na las med cing /
analyzed: las su smra ba yang rmongs pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i dbang du byas nas gzhan pa yin gyi don dam par ni las yod pa ma yin te de ni sems dang 'brel pa nyid dang / skad cig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir las kyi nus pa yod par ga la 'gyur / de bzhin du @141b yang las ni byed pa po la ltos pa yin te byed pa po dang las logs shig na las med cing /
translated: Also, karma is posited in terms of the confusion of fools. In reality, karma does not exist because it is related to the mind and it is momentary. How could karma have the ability to produce results?

original: las logs shig na yang byed pa po med la de dag phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: las logs shig na yang byed pa po med la de dag phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Karma depends on the agent because apart from the agent there is no karma, and apart from karma there is no agent. Since they are mutually dependent, neither is established.

original: gal te thams cad lha'i byed do zhe na thams cad bzang pa 'am ngan par ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: gal te thams cad lha'i byed do zhe na thams cad bzang pa 'am ngan par ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: If you say that everything is done by God, why does he not make everything good or bad?

original: gal te rnam pa sna tshogs pa byed pa'i nus pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa sna tshogs pa byed pa'i nus pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that he has the ability to make various things, then why does he not make everything at one time?

original: 'o na ni nus pa kho na byed pa po yin gyi lha ni ma yin te de dag gi 'brel pa ni sngar bsal zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni nus pa kho na byed pa po yin gyi lha ni ma yin te de dag gi 'brel pa ni sngar bsal zin pa kho na'o //
translated: But if that is so, then only the potential is the agent, not the god, and the relation between them has already been refuted.🔽And the synonyms of that, such as fortune and merit, should be understood as before.

original: de'i rnam grangs kyi skal pa dang bsod nams dag kyang snga ma bzhin du shes par bya ste de lta bu la sogs pa tshad mas gnod par 'gyur ba'i dngos po kun dang rnam par bral zhing spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam grangs kyi skal pa dang bsod nams dag kyang snga ma bzhin du shes par bya ste de lta bu la sogs pa tshad mas gnod par 'gyur ba'i dngos po kun dang rnam par bral zhing spangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the self is completely devoid of and abandons all such things that are undermined by valid knowledge.

original: nyan thos rnams gal te de lta yin du zin kyang 'gro ba'i phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams gal te de lta yin du zin kyang 'gro ba'i phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The śrāvakas say: Even if that is so, the self is the nature of the aggregates and so on of transmigrating beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rab 'byor thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad yin no zhes gsungs so zhes zer na de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rab 'byor thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad yin no zhes gsungs so zhes zer na de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: The Bhagavān also said, “Subhūti, all refers to the five aggregates, the twelve sense bases, and the eighteen elements.”

original: rnam par rig pa kho na de rnams kyis rnam par snang ba yin te don dam par ni phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa kho na de rnams kyis rnam par snang ba yin te don dam par ni phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is only consciousness that appears as those [objects], because ultimately external objects do not exist.

original: de bzhin du yang gang gsal ba de ni yod pa yin la gang mi gsal ba de ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gang gsal ba de ni yod pa yin la gang mi gsal ba de ni med pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, whatever is clear is existent, and whatever is unclear is nonexistent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang rang nyid gsal ba med pa'i phyir med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang rang nyid gsal ba med pa'i phyir med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since forms and so on are not clear by themselves, they are nonexistent.

original: ngo bo gang gis gsal ba ni rnam par rig pa yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba ni de'i rang bzhin can kho na yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo gang gis gsal ba ni rnam par rig pa yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba ni de'i rang bzhin can kho na yin no //
translated: Since the clarity of an entity is consciousness, the world is only of its nature.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don bden pa'i dngos po yod na ;
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don bden pa'i dngos po yod na ;
translated: If external objects were real things,

original: bud med shi ba'i ro gcig la blo'i snang ba tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bud med shi ba'i ro gcig la blo'i snang ba tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the appearance of different minds would not occur with regard to the corpse of a single dead woman.

original: bud med lus ni gcig po la //
analyzed: bud med lus ni gcig po la //
translated: With regard to the body of a single woman,

original: ro dang 'dod bya bza' ba shes //🔽kun rgyu 'dod can khyi rnams kyis //
analyzed: ro dang 'dod bya bza' ba shes // kun rgyu 'dod can khyi rnams kyis //
translated: some see a corpse, some an object of desire, some food.🔽The various thoughts of the tīrthikas, dogs,

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam gsum mo //
translated: and those who desire sex are threefold.

original: de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin te bcom 'das kyis nyan thos rnams gzhug pa'i don du gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po la sogs pa rnams ni yod pa ma yin te bcom 'das kyis nyan thos rnams gzhug pa'i don du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates and so on do not exist, but were taught by the Buddha for the sake of introducing the śrāvakas.

original: de bas na phung po dang khams dang skye mched spangs shing de dang bral ba yin no //🔽rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams gal te /🔽de lta yin du chug kyang rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba thams cad snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'ba' @142a * //
analyzed: de bas na phung po dang khams dang skye mched spangs shing de dang bral ba yin no // rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams gal te / de lta yin du chug kyang rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba thams cad snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'ba' @142a * //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are abandoned and rejected.🔽Yogācāras may say, “Even if that is so, only the consciousness that appears as all moving and nonmoving things exists, and everything has its nature.”

original: zhig kho na yod pa yin zhing thams cad de'i rang bzhin can no zhes zer na de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhig kho na yod pa yin zhing thams cad de'i rang bzhin can no zhes zer na de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also untenable.

original: rnam par rig pa zhes pa ci zhig yin par brjod par bya /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa zhes pa ci zhig yin par brjod par bya /
translated: What is this so-called consciousness?

original: rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par rig pa yin no zhen ci zhig shes par byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par rig pa yin no zhen ci zhig shes par byed /
translated: If you say, “It is consciousness because it makes distinctions,” what makes distinctions?

original: rang gi rnam pa kho na gzung ba'i don no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa kho na gzung ba'i don no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “It makes distinctions about its own aspect, the object that is apprehended,”

original: de'i phyir gcig dang du ma dang bral bas de med pa ni 'dzin pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig dang du ma dang bral bas de med pa ni 'dzin pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is free from being one or many, the nonexistence of that is also the nonexistence of the apprehender.

original: gzhan yang don 'das pa ma 'ongs pa 'am da ltar byung ba zhig gis rnam par rig pa bskyed grang na re zhig 'das pa ni ma yin te de ni zhig zin pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzhan yang don 'das pa ma 'ongs pa 'am da ltar byung ba zhig gis rnam par rig pa bskyed grang na re zhig 'das pa ni ma yin te de ni zhig zin pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Moreover, is the object that generates a representation past, future, or present? First, it is not past because it has already ceased.

original: / ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te ma thob pas mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te ma thob pas mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not future because it is not perceived due to not having been obtained.

original: da ltar bas kyang skyed par nus pa ma yin te skad cig ma nyid dang gnyi ga'i chas zin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar bas kyang skyed par nus pa ma yin te skad cig ma nyid dang gnyi ga'i chas zin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not able to generate a representation that is present because it is momentary and both are already present.

original: skyed par nus pa yin du chug na yang cig car skyed par byed dam 'on te rim gyis yin /
analyzed: skyed par nus pa yin du chug na yang cig car skyed par byed dam 'on te rim gyis yin /
translated: Even if it is able to generate a representation, does it generate it simultaneously or gradually?

original: rim gyis skyed na ni don skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir zhig pa na rnam par rig pa ji ltar brten nas skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rim gyis skyed na ni don skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir zhig pa na rnam par rig pa ji ltar brten nas skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If it generates it gradually, then when the object is momentary and has ceased, how could a representation arise in dependence on it?

original: cig car gyis na ni gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa yin /
analyzed: cig car gyis na ni gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa yin /
translated: If it generates it simultaneously, then what is related to what?

original: rnam par rig pa yang ci'i phyir don skyed par mi byed de de'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa yang ci'i phyir don skyed par mi byed de de'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Why does consciousness not produce objects? Therefore, it is free from grasped and grasper.

original: gal te de lta yin na byang chub kyi sems de ji lta bu zhig ce na gsungs pa phung po la sogs pa chos kun gyi bdag med pa ni bdag yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na byang chub kyi sems de ji lta bu zhig ce na gsungs pa phung po la sogs pa chos kun gyi bdag med pa ni bdag yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: If that is so, what is the enlightenment mind? It is the selflessness of all phenomena such as the aggregates, which is the nonexistence of self.

original: de dang mnyam pa ni thams cad la khyab pa ste de yis so //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa ni thams cad la khyab pa ste de yis so //
translated: Equality with that is the pervasion of everything, by which.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang ma rig pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin rang gi sems gzod ma nas ma skyes pa ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang ma rig pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin rang gi sems gzod ma nas ma skyes pa ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: One’s mind, which is the nature of the three consciousnesses—the mind, mental factors, and ignorance—is primordially unborn, and thus it is essenceless.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa spangs shing rtag pa dang chad par lta ba dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa spangs shing rtag pa dang chad par lta ba dang bral ba yin no //
translated: It is free from arising, abiding, and ceasing, and it is free from the views of eternalism and nihilism.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid de thams cad stong pa yin zhing de kho na nyid bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid de thams cad stong pa yin zhing de kho na nyid bzhi pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, that emptiness is the emptiness of everything, and it is the fourth reality.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems bdag gis bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems bdag gis bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The thought “I will cultivate the spirit of enlightenment, whose nature is that” is the remainder of the verse.

original: slob mas byang chub kyi sems kyi sngags de brjod nas slob dpon gyi zhabs kyi rtsar snyim pas med tog dbul bar bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: slob mas byang chub kyi sems kyi sngags de brjod nas slob dpon gyi zhabs kyi rtsar snyim pas med tog dbul bar bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: After the disciple has recited the spirit of enlightenment mantra, he should offer a handful of flowers at the teacher’s feet, which is the conclusion.🔽After that, he should think “I will offer the gift.”

original: de'i rjes la yul dbul bar bya'o snyam du @142b thugs bzhag nas /🔽de nas rjes su mthun pa'i yon //
analyzed: de'i rjes la yul dbul bar bya'o snyam du @142b thugs bzhag nas / de nas rjes su mthun pa'i yon //
translated: Then,🔽the disciple should offer

original: bla ma la ni dbul bya ste //
analyzed: bla ma la ni dbul bya ste //
translated: to the teacher🔽a gift that is suitable,

original: rin chen khyim dang / glang po dang // yul dang rta dang mal stan bcas //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rin chen khyim dang / glang po dang // yul dang rta dang mal stan bcas // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: such as a precious house, an elephant, a country, a horse, or a bed.

original: de'i rjes la rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: After that, a gift that is suitable,🔽a gift of precious things that is in accordance with his ability, should be offered to the teacher.

original: rang gi nus pa dang mthun pa'i yon rin po che sa bdun bla ma la dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa po de bzhin du /
analyzed: rang gi nus pa dang mthun pa'i yon rin po che sa bdun bla ma la dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa po de bzhin du /
translated: The disciple should offer to the teacher a gift that is suitable,🔽such as a precious house, an elephant, a country, a horse, or a bed.🔽The disciple should offer to the teacher a gift that is suitable,

original: zan dang bran mo chung ma sdug / bu mo shin tu gces pa dang // bdag nyid kyang ni dbul bya na //
analyzed: zan dang bran mo chung ma sdug / bu mo shin tu gces pa dang // bdag nyid kyang ni dbul bya na //
translated: such as a precious house, an elephant, a country, a horse, or a bed.

original: lhag ma gzhan lta smos ci dgos //
analyzed: lhag ma gzhan lta smos ci dgos //
translated: What need to mention the rest?

original: bran la sogs pa rnams ni sbyin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: bran la sogs pa rnams ni sbyin pa chen po'o //
translated: The servants and so forth are the Great Giver.

original: bdag nyid dbul ba ni khyad par can gyi sbyin pa yin pas lhag ma gzhan lta ci smos te dbul bar 'os pa ma yin pa gzhan ci zhig yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dbul ba ni khyad par can gyi sbyin pa yin pas lhag ma gzhan lta ci smos te dbul bar 'os pa ma yin pa gzhan ci zhig yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Since the self is the special giver, what need is there to mention the rest? What other is there worthy of poverty? The words are literal.

original: de ltar man ngag thob pas de kho na nyid bsgom pa'i sgo nas 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar man ngag thob pas de kho na nyid bsgom pa'i sgo nas 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate the attainment of the result, the Great Seal, through the door of meditation on reality, having obtained the precepts,

original: slob dpon las ni drin thob dri med brtan pa'i blo ldan dngos kun rang bzhin can //
analyzed: slob dpon las ni drin thob dri med brtan pa'i blo ldan dngos kun rang bzhin can //
translated: the wise one, having obtained the grace of the master, all things being of the nature of reality,

original: gsal dag shin tu phra ba mchog gi rang bzhin sangs rgyas mya ngan 'das pa'i khams //
analyzed: gsal dag shin tu phra ba mchog gi rang bzhin sangs rgyas mya ngan 'das pa'i khams //
translated: the nature of the clear, pure, and very subtle, the element of nirvana of the Buddha,

original: gnyis med rtog bral mchog tu bde ba'i rang bzhin de nyid bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: gnyis med rtog bral mchog tu bde ba'i rang bzhin de nyid bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: the yogin who meditates on that reality, the nature of supreme bliss, free from the conception of duality,

original: bsod nams bsod nams min grol rang nyid 'dir ni bcom ldan rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur //
analyzed: bsod nams bsod nams min grol rang nyid 'dir ni bcom ldan rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur //
translated: Here, he becomes the Blessed One, Vajrasattva.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽de kho na nyid bzhi yang dag pa'i man ngag ste de lta bu bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar gyur nas bcom ldan rdo rje sems dpa' ste rdo rje 'chang
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / de kho na nyid bzhi yang dag pa'i man ngag ste de lta bu bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar gyur nas bcom ldan rdo rje sems dpa' ste rdo rje 'chang
translated: This is what is being said.

original: chen por 'gyur zhing 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen por 'gyur zhing 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yoga of one who meditates in this way on the four realities, the true esoteric instructions, becomes free from the concepts of merit and demerit, and he becomes the Blessed One, Vajrasattva, the Great Vajradhara.

original: rnal 'byor pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of yoga?

original: gang gis slob dpon la dris te bla ma'i zhal snga nas lung thob pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis slob dpon la dris te bla ma'i zhal snga nas lung thob pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has asked the master and received the oral transmission from the guru is called that.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi dri ma med pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i 'dam dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi dri ma med pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i 'dam dang bral ba'o //
translated: Similarly, he is free from the mire of afflictions such as desire, which are naturally stainless.

original: gang la brtan pa ste bsgom pa la shin tu brtan pa'i blo yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la brtan pa ste bsgom pa la shin tu brtan pa'i blo yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has a mind that is very stable, that is, firm in meditation, is called that.

original: dngos kun ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can te de rnams kyi rang bzhin ni don dam par yongs su shes pa'i phyir dngos kun rang bzhin can no//
analyzed: dngos kun ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can te de rnams kyi rang bzhin ni don dam par yongs su shes pa'i phyir dngos kun rang bzhin can no//
translated: All entities have the nature of being stable and moving. Their nature is the ultimate, because it is thoroughly known. Thus, all entities have a nature.

original: @143a * // de kho na nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: @143a * // de kho na nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is reality?

original: gsal ba ste me long lta bu'i ye shes dag par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gsal ba ste me long lta bu'i ye shes dag par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is clarity, the nature of purifying mirror-like wisdom.

original: dag pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi yin no //
analyzed: dag pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi yin no //
translated: It is purity, the nature of purifying the wisdom of equality.

original: shin tu phra ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is extremely subtle, the nature of discerning wisdom.

original: mchog ni sems can gyi don bsgrub par nus pa ma yin zhing zhi ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mchog ni sems can gyi don bsgrub par nus pa ma yin zhing zhi ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is supreme, the nature of accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin te mchog tu zhi ba'i rang bzhin ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin te mchog tu zhi ba'i rang bzhin ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: It is non-conceptual wisdom, the nature of supreme peace. It is the nature of accomplishing activities, the nature of all-accomplishing wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The element of nirvana of the buddhas, the tathagatas, is the nature of the gnosis of the extremely pure dharmadhatu.

original: de bzhin du gnyis med de gnyis ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la de med pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis med de gnyis ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la de med pa'i phyir gnyis med do //
translated: Similarly, non-duality is the freedom from the duality of attachment and aversion, and because that does not exist, there is non-duality.

original: brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mchog tu dag pa ni rtog pa yin la de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mchog tu dag pa ni rtog pa yin la de dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Since it is imagined, the supreme purity is conceptual, and since it is free from that, it is free from conceptualization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog tu bde ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba chen po yin zhing de'i rang bzhin de de'i ngo bo kho na nyid bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog tu bde ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba chen po yin zhing de'i rang bzhin de de'i ngo bo kho na nyid bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni
translated: Therefore, the supreme bliss is the great bliss of co-emergent joy, and the nature of that is its essence itself. The yogi/nī who meditates on that becomes Vajrasattva. This is

original: ngag gi don te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi don te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: the ultimate meaning of the words.

original: rim pa lnga'i bshad pa nor bu'i phreng ba las mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: rim pa lnga'i bshad pa nor bu'i phreng ba las mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ste bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourth chapter, on the stage of manifest enlightenment, from the Ornament of the Essence: Explanation of the Five Stages.

original: // / de nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rtsom pan phyag 'tshal ba /
analyzed: // / de nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rtsom pan phyag 'tshal ba /
translated: Then, in order to compose the stage of union, the homage:

original: mgon po rgyu dang 'bras bdag nyid //
analyzed: mgon po rgyu dang 'bras bdag nyid //
translated: The protector, the nature of cause and effect,

original: gnyis pa thams cad rnam spangs la //🔽phyag 'tshal nas ni zung 'jug pa'i //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad rnam spangs la // phyag 'tshal nas ni zung 'jug pa'i //
translated: having abandoned the second and all,🔽having paid homage, I will write

original: rim pa tha ma bdag gis bri //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rim pa tha ma bdag gis bri // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the final stage of union.

original: mgon po ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog go //
analyzed: mgon po ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog go //
translated: The protector is the supreme of all the transcendent lords.

original: rgyu ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i dbye ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis yin zhing /
analyzed: rgyu ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i dbye ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis yin zhing /
translated: The cause is the twenty-two types of generation of the enlightenment mind.

original: 'bras bu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste de dag gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste de dag gi bdag nyid do //
translated: The effect is perfect complete enlightenment, and he is the nature of those.

original: gnyis po thams cad de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams dang bral ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po thams cad de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams dang bral ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: The second is all faults, such as attachment. Having abandoned them is having abandoned.

original: bcom ldan 'das de la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi rim pa tha ma ste phyi ma bri zhing bshad par bya ba sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi rim pa tha ma ste phyi ma bri zhing bshad par bya ba sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Having bowed to that Blessed One, the stage of union, the final stage of the nature of the realm of non-abiding nirvana, the latter, which is to be written and explained, is literal.

original: yang na mgon po ni thams cad kyi mchog go //
analyzed: yang na mgon po ni thams cad kyi mchog go //
translated: Or, the protector is the supreme of all.

original: @143b rgyu ni bskyed pa'i rim pas lha'i sku bsgom pa yin zhing 'bras bu ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa ste /
analyzed: @143b rgyu ni bskyed pa'i rim pas lha'i sku bsgom pa yin zhing 'bras bu ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa ste /
translated: The cause is the cultivation of the deity's body by the creation stage, and the result is the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara.
