original: de dag gi bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Their nature is the nature of that.

original: gnyis pa thams cad de phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad de phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Having bowed to the second, which is free from all conceptual elaborations of the aggregates and so forth, the stage of union should be written, this is not the intended meaning.

original: mgon po ni bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The protector is great bliss.

original: 'bras bu ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The result is the bodhicitta.

original: de'i rgyu ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the union of means and insight.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni thabs des thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni thabs des thob par bya ba'o //
translated: Its nature is what is to be attained by that means.

original: gnyis de dga' ba dang mchog dang bral ba thams cad dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis de dga' ba dang mchog dang bral ba thams cad dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: Having bowed to the two who are free from all attachment and aversion, I will write the stage of union.

original: mgon po ni nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba'o //
translated: The Lord is the conqueror of the afflictions.

original: 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The fruit is nirvana.

original: rgyu ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The cause is the selflessness of persons and things.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i lam gnyis ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i lam gnyis ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Its nature is the teaching of the path of that.

original: gnyis pa thams cad de chags pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad de chags pa dang zhe sdang la sogs pa dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: Having bowed to the two who are free from all attachment and aversion, I will explain the stage of union.

original: 'bras bu ni dkyil 'khor bzhi ru cha shas dang cha shas kyi bye brag gis gnas pa'i yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni dkyil 'khor bzhi ru cha shas dang cha shas kyi bye brag gis gnas pa'i yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: The result is the syllable HUM, which abides in the four mandalas by parts and subdivisions.

original: rgyu ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis de nyid kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis de nyid kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: The cause is the repetition of that very syllable by the process of entry and so forth.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i 'dod pa'i bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i 'dod pa'i bzlas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is the nature of the repetition of that very syllable, which is desired.

original: mgon po ni rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon no //
analyzed: mgon po ni rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon no //
translated: The protector is the seed of Vajradhara.

original: gnyis pa thams cad de aom dang gsung ge sa bon gyi yan lag rnam par spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas rjes su dran nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad de aom dang gsung ge sa bon gyi yan lag rnam par spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas rjes su dran nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: Having bowed to and remembered that very syllable, which is devoid of the parts of the seed of OM and speech, one should write the stage of union. This is the definitive meaning.

original: 'bras bu ni srog ces bya ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni srog ces bya ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: The result is the wind called “life.”

original: rgyu ni thur du sel ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu ni thur du sel ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: The cause is the wind called “downward-voiding.”

original: bdag nyid ni me dang rlung ste de rnams sdud par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni me dang rlung ste de rnams sdud par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The nature is fire and wind, because they are the collectors of those. The protector is clear light.

original: gnyis pa thams cad ni kha dog dmar po la sogs pa rnams te de dag dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad ni kha dog dmar po la sogs pa rnams te de dag dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The second, all colors, are red and so forth. Having bowed to the abandonment and freedom from those, one should write the stage of union. This is not the literal meaning.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ste byed pa dang bya ba dag yin zhing @144a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ste byed pa dang bya ba dag yin zhing @144a * //
translated: Cause and effect are cause and effect, and action and agent.

original: pha dang ma las byung ba'i 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gyi khams drug yin no //
analyzed: pha dang ma las byung ba'i 'gro ba'i rang bzhin gyi khams drug yin no //
translated: The nature of beings born from father and mother is the six elements.

original: de gyur pa'i lus 'byung ba la gnyis pa thams cad de byed rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang skal ba mnyam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i bye brag yod de /
analyzed: de gyur pa'i lus 'byung ba la gnyis pa thams cad de byed rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang skal ba mnyam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i bye brag yod de /
translated: That body, which is their transformation, has all the second causes, which are the specific causes called active cause, co-originating cause, homogeneous cause, concomitant cause, universal cause, and ripening cause.

original: de rnams dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po ste /
analyzed: de rnams dag par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po ste /
translated: Because it purifies those, it is the protector.

original: de la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i don to //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i don to //
translated: Having paid homage to that, one should write the stage of union. This is the word-meaning.

original: yang na mgon po ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na mgon po ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, the protector is emptiness.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi thob par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi thob par bya'o //
translated: One should attain the four doors of liberation, which are the nature of cause and effect.

original: gnyis pa thams cad de gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams spangs pa la phyag 'tshal te rjes su zhugs nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad de gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams spangs pa la phyag 'tshal te rjes su zhugs nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: Having paid homage to that, and having entered into the abandonment of all duality, which is the abandonment of the concepts of object and subject, one should write the stage of union. This is the general meaning.

original: rgyu ni de bzhin nyid dang zla ba dang rdo rje dang sa bon gyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni de bzhin nyid dang zla ba dang rdo rje dang sa bon gyi rim pa'o //
translated: The cause is the stages of suchness, moon, vajra, and seed.

original: 'bras bu ni lha'i sku bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni lha'i sku bskyed pa'o //
translated: The effect is the generation of the deity's body.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi mgon po ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi mgon po ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The protector who is of that nature is the bearer of the body of the five tathāgatas.

original: gnyis pa thams cad ni bdag dang gzhan du dgyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad ni bdag dang gzhan du dgyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: All duality is the concepts of self and other.

original: de rnams dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams dang bral zhing spangs pa la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: Having bowed to the abandonment and freedom from those, one should write the stage of union. This is the general meaning.

original: yang na rgyu ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu ni rdo rje'o //
translated: Or else, the cause is the vajra,

original: 'bras bu ni padma ste de dag dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas rnam par dag pa'i gnas thob par byed pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni padma ste de dag dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgo nas rnam par dag pa'i gnas thob par byed pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: and the result is the lotus. The attainment of the state of purity by means of their union is the nature of cause and effect.

original: mgon po ni bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The lord is great bliss.

original: gnyis pa thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma rnams so //
translated: The second is all those free from passion and those with intermediate passion.

original: de dag spangs ba'i lhan cig skyes pa la phyag 'tshal nas te /
analyzed: de dag spangs ba'i lhan cig skyes pa la phyag 'tshal nas te /
translated: Having bowed to the innate nature that abandons them,

original: rab tu zhugs nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhugs nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: having entered, one should write the stage of union. This is the hidden meaning.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni bdag byin gnyis brlab pa dang / 'od gsal ba'i rim pa ste de'i bdag nyid ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni bdag byin gnyis brlab pa dang / 'od gsal ba'i rim pa ste de'i bdag nyid ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The cause and effect are the stage of self-consecration and the stage of clear light. The nature of that is the nature that is not different from them.

original: mgon po ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The Lord is absorbed in the meditative concentration of the illusion-like.

original: gnyis pa thams cad ni sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams yin la de dang bral zhing spangs nas te /
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad ni sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams yin la de dang bral zhing spangs nas te /
translated: The second, all, are the conceptualizations of the objective domain of the resistances, by means of the twelve examples of illusion such as the magical creation, etc.🔽and having become free from them, having abandoned them,

original: sgyu ma'i dpe dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: one is endowed with the examples of illusion, is the meaning.

original: de la phyag 'tshal nas te 'od gsal ba las spros nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri @144b bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spas pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal nas te 'od gsal ba las spros nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri @144b bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spas pa'o //
translated: Having bowed to that, having emanated from the clear light, one should write the stage of union, is the promise.

original: mgon po ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The Lord is the fourth.

original: rgyu ni rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: The cause is the three consciousnesses.

original: 'bras bu ni rang bzhin rnams te de dag dag par byed pa 'di yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rang bzhin rnams te de dag dag par byed pa 'di yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The result is the natures, and this is the purification of them, so it is the nature of cause and result.

original: gnyis pa thams cad de stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po rnams spangs shing bor ba'i thams cad stong pa'i gzhi de kho na nyid la phyag 'tshal nas de mngon du byas nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad de stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po rnams spangs shing bor ba'i thams cad stong pa'i gzhi de kho na nyid la phyag 'tshal nas de mngon du byas nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: Having bowed to that reality, the ground of the emptiness of everything, which is the abandonment and rejection of the second, the emptiness of everything, and the emptiness of the extreme, one should write the stage of union, having realized it. This is the hidden meaning.

original: mgon po ni man ngag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni man ngag bzhi pa'o //
translated: The protector is the fourth intimate instruction.

original: rgyu ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: rgyu ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The cause is the samādhi of subsequent destruction.

original: 'bras bu ni ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de dag gis thob pa'i bdag nyid ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de dag gis thob pa'i bdag nyid ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The result is the samādhi of total retention. The nature of all entities is the nature of the attainment of those.

original: gnyis pa thams cad ni kun gzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi tshogs rnams spangs shing rab tu gsal ba'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid la phyag 'tshal nas te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba thob nas
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad ni kun gzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi tshogs rnams spangs shing rab tu gsal ba'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid la phyag 'tshal nas te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba thob nas
translated: The second, having bowed to that reality, the nature of joy, which is the abandonment and the complete clarity of the collection of traces of the consciousnesses, such as the all-basis, having attained the realization by means of reflexive awareness,

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The stage of union is to be drawn, which is the ultimate.

original: rgyu ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The cause is the conventional truth.

original: 'bras bu ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The result is the ultimate truth.

original: de dag tha mi dad par byed pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag tha mi dad par byed pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: They are the nature of cause and result because they are made non-different.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //
translated: The Lord is because of being the nature of the realm of non-abiding nirvana.

original: gnyis pa thams cad de rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa la sogs pa rnams dang gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa rnams spangs shing bor ba la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi mi slob pa'i byang chub kyi ngo bo de thob nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad de rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa la sogs pa rnams dang gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa rnams spangs shing bor ba la phyag 'tshal nas zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi mi slob pa'i byang chub kyi ngo bo de thob nas zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa
translated: Having bowed to the second, having abandoned and discarded all dualities, such as with aspects and without aspects, and pure and impure, having attained that essence of the non-learner's enlightenment, which is the nature of the stage of union,🔽the stage of union is to be drawn.

original: zhes bya ba la zung ni gnyis te kun rdzob dang don dam pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la zung ni gnyis te kun rdzob dang don dam pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin zhing /
translated: Union is a pair, the nature of the conventional and ultimate, and so on.

original: rim pa gang gis de dag 'jug pa ste 'ching zhing gcig tu byed pa dang tha mi dad par byed pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin no ;
analyzed: rim pa gang gis de dag 'jug pa ste 'ching zhing gcig tu byed pa dang tha mi dad par byed pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin no ;
translated: The stage by which they are engaged, that is, bound and made one, and made non-different, is the stage of union, which is the nature of the realm of non-abiding nirvana.

original: / mi slob pa nyid dang 'di la pha rol na bya ba gzhan med pa'i tha ma ste de bdag gis bri bar bya zhing phreng bar brgyu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: / mi slob pa nyid dang 'di la pha rol na bya ba gzhan med pa'i tha ma ste de bdag gis bri bar bya zhing phreng bar brgyu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The state of no-more-learning, and the end of this, where there is no other action beyond, is the ultimate.

original: da ni nyid kyi bye brag re re nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nyid kyi bye brag re re nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, each of the specific stages will be explained.

original: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Samsara and nirvana

original: rtog pa gnyis po spangs pa na //🔽gang du dngos po @145a * //
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis po spangs pa na // gang du dngos po @145a * //
translated: are the two concepts to be abandoned.

original: gcig gyur pa //
analyzed: gcig gyur pa //
translated: Where there is a single entity,

original: de ni zung 'jug ces byar bshad //
analyzed: de ni zung 'jug ces byar bshad //
translated: that is explained as the union.

original: de ni rim pa lnga pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni rim pa lnga pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the general definition of the five stages.

original: de bzhin du rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pa thams cad lta ba'i bye brag gi sgo nas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag khas lan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi sde pa dang gzhan gyi sde pa thams cad lta ba'i bye brag gi sgo nas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag khas lan to //
translated: In the same way, all the Buddhist and non-Buddhist schools accept saṃsāra and nirvāṇa from the perspective of the distinctions of their views.🔽How is it that the Sāṃkhyas have saṃsāra and nirvāṇa?

original: de las grangs can pa rnams kyis ji ltar 'khor ba ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de las grangs can pa rnams kyis ji ltar 'khor ba ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Saṃsāra is the nature of manifestation and nonmanifestation.

original: gsal ba ni de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum gyi rang bzhin yin la mi gsal ba ni yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba ni de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa gsum gyi rang bzhin yin la mi gsal ba ni yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Manifestation is the nature of the twenty-three principles, and nonmanifestation is the nature of the three qualities.

original: de rnams kyi rnam pa dbye ba yongs su ma shes pas nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i skyes bu 'ching bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam pa dbye ba yongs su ma shes pas nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i skyes bu 'ching bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Since the aspects of those are not fully understood, the twenty-fifth principle, the puruṣa, is bound. This is saṃsāra.

original: de dag tha dad par gyur ba ni thar pa ste /
analyzed: de dag tha dad par gyur ba ni thar pa ste /
translated: When they are differentiated, that is liberation.🔽As it is said:

original: ji ltar 'o ma sems med pa //
analyzed: ji ltar 'o ma sems med pa //
translated: Just as milk, without thought,

original: be'u bskyed phyir 'jug pa ltar //🔽de bzhin skyes bu thar bya'i phyir //
analyzed: be'u bskyed phyir 'jug pa ltar // de bzhin skyes bu thar bya'i phyir //
translated: Enters the calf in order to grow,🔽In the same way, the principle

original: gtso bo rab tu 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: gtso bo rab tu 'jug pa yin //
translated: Enters in order to liberate the puruṣa.

original: rig pa pa rnams kyi thar pa ni bdag gi yon tan dgu yongs su shes pa tsam gyis bdag gis dngos po bsam pa yongs su shes pa yin la de yongs su ma shes pa 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa pa rnams kyi thar pa ni bdag gi yon tan dgu yongs su shes pa tsam gyis bdag gis dngos po bsam pa yongs su shes pa yin la de yongs su ma shes pa 'khor ba'o //
translated: The liberation of the Vaisheṣhikas is the understanding of the self’s nine qualities, and the nonunderstanding of that is samsara.

original: zhi ba pa rnams kyi thar pa ni de kho na nyid sum rtsa drug bcad pa'i sgo nas yin zhing de yongs sum bcad pa ni 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba pa rnams kyi thar pa ni de kho na nyid sum rtsa drug bcad pa'i sgo nas yin zhing de yongs sum bcad pa ni 'khor ba yin no //
translated: The liberation of the Jains is through the elimination of the thirty-six categories of reality, and the nonelimination of those is samsara.

original: spyod pa rnams kyi ltar na bya ba'i phyogs la me'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa nyams su len pa med pas ni 'khor ba yin la de dag nyams su len pas ni thar pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa rnams kyi ltar na bya ba'i phyogs la me'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa nyams su len pa med pas ni 'khor ba yin la de dag nyams su len pas ni thar pa yin no //
translated: According to the Carvākas, since one does not practice the side of action, such as the fire sacrifice, it is samsara, and through practicing those it is liberation.

original: ye shes kyi phyogs la ni me'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa nyams su len pa 'khor ba yin la rab tu zhi ba'i tshangs pa'i de kho na nyid la blta ba ni thar pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyogs la ni me'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa nyams su len pa 'khor ba yin la rab tu zhi ba'i tshangs pa'i de kho na nyid la blta ba ni thar pa yin no //
translated: On the side of wisdom, practicing the fire sacrifice and so on is samsara, and seeing the reality of the peaceful Brahmins is liberation.

original: mchod 'os pa rnams kyi ltar na 'khor ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: mchod 'os pa rnams kyi ltar na 'khor ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i blo 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: According to the Āryās, saṃsāra is the transformation of the mind, such as desire.

original: thar pa ni dus gsum char du'ang dngos po thams cad 'gyur bar shes pas dag pa'i bdag gi de kho na nyid mthong ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa ni dus gsum char du'ang dngos po thams cad 'gyur bar shes pas dag pa'i bdag gi de kho na nyid mthong ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the vision of the reality of the pure self, by knowing that all things are transformed in all three times.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams kyi ltar na med par lta ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med pa'o zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams kyi ltar na med par lta ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med pa'o zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: According to the Lokāyatas, the world beyond does not exist, because they are nihilists. This is the theory of bondage and liberation.

original: de rnams ni gzhan gyi bde ba rnams kyi 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni gzhan gyi bde ba rnams kyi 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag yin no //
translated: For them, saṃsāra and nirvāṇa are the happiness of others.

original: re zhig rang gi sde pa rnams kyi brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig rang gi sde pa rnams kyi brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we must discuss the views of our own schools.

original: bye brag tu smra ba ltar na nyon mongs pa rnams khams dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis dbye ba'i sgo nas grangs @145b dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yod pas khams gsum pa bcings pa ni 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba ltar na nyon mongs pa rnams khams dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis dbye ba'i sgo nas grangs @145b dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yod pas khams gsum pa bcings pa ni 'khor ba yin la /
translated: According to the Vaibhasikas, since there are ninety eight afflictions that are classified by realm and aspect, samsara is the three realms that are bound by them.

original: de rnams nyid mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis sa'i rim pa rnam par sbyangs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang nyan thos kyi byang chub thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis sa'i rim pa rnam par sbyangs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang nyan thos kyi byang chub thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nonperception, and the attainment of the enlightenment of sravakas, after the stages of the path of seeing and meditation have purified the afflictions.

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na rjes su dpag pas grub pa nyid kyi phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po sems kyi rang gi ngo bor yongs su ma shes pa ni 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na rjes su dpag pas grub pa nyid kyi phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po sems kyi rang gi ngo bor yongs su ma shes pa ni 'khor ba yin la /
translated: According to the Sautrantikas, since it is established by inference, samsara is the nonunderstanding of external things as the nature of the mind.

original: de nyid sems kyi rang gi ngo bor yongs su shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems kyi rang gi ngo bor yongs su shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the understanding of external things as the nature of the mind.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi ltar na gcig dang du ma nyid du med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don med do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi ltar na gcig dang du ma nyid du med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don med do //
translated: According to the Yogācāra, external objects do not exist because they are neither one nor many.

original: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'khrul pa ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'khrul pa ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the error of the aspect of the apprehended and the aspect of the apprehender is saṃsāra.

original: dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa nam mkha' lta bu chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig pa 'ba' zhig kho na mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa nam mkha' lta bu chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rig pa 'ba' zhig kho na mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The stainless, infinite, space-like, pure consciousness alone, which is the nature of the dharmakāya, is nirvāṇa.

original: rnam pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba'i rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par rig pa ni 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba'i rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par rig pa ni 'khor ba yin la /
translated: According to the Yogācāra who propound mere consciousness without aspects, consciousness with aspects is saṃsāra.

original: gzugs brnyan dang bral ba'i rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang bral ba'i rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Mere consciousness free from the aspect of an image is nirvāṇa.

original: dbu ma rnams kyi ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtag pa'i 'khrul pa tsam gyi rang bzhin gyi sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang gi ngo bo khams gsum pa 'di ni 'khor ba yin la stong pa nyid bco brgyad kyis rim gyis thob par
analyzed: dbu ma rnams kyi ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin par brtag pa'i 'khrul pa tsam gyi rang bzhin gyi sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang gi ngo bo khams gsum pa 'di ni 'khor ba yin la stong pa nyid bco brgyad kyis rim gyis thob par
translated: According to the Madhyamikas, this world of the three realms, whose nature is the mere error of the imagined subject and object, is samsara.

original: bya ba'i thams cad stong pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i thams cad stong pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Nirvana is the emptiness of all things, which is attained gradually through the eighteen emptinesses.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ni tha mal pa'i rang gi lus su mngon par zhen pa yin la mya ngan las 'das pa ni lha'i sku grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ni tha mal pa'i rang gi lus su mngon par zhen pa yin la mya ngan las 'das pa ni lha'i sku grub pa yin no //
translated: For yogis who practice the action and so on, samsara is the ordinary clinging to one's own body, and nirvana is the accomplishment of the divine body.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ni lha'i sku bsgom pa yin la mya ngan las 'das pa ni ye shes kyi sku yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ni lha'i sku bsgom pa yin la mya ngan las 'das pa ni ye shes kyi sku yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: For yogis who practice the creation stage, samsara is the meditation on the divine body, and nirvana is the attainment of the body of wisdom.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ni dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang ci yang rung ba yin la mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ni dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang ci yang rung ba yin la mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa tsam yin no //
translated: For yogins of the stage of completion, samsara is any conceptualization that is an object of observation, and nirvana is merely the entry into clear light.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bsdus pa ni dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag phra ba 'am rags pa gang rung ba de ni 'khor ba'i phyogs kho na yin no//
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bsdus pa ni dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag phra ba 'am rags pa gang rung ba de ni 'khor ba'i phyogs kho na yin no//
translated: Therefore, here, the summary is that any subtle or coarse conceptualization that has the nature of an object of observation is only the side of samsara.

original: @146a * // de dag dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid sems kyi dga' ba nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: @146a * // de dag dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid sems kyi dga' ba nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: The mind’s delight in reality free from those is nirvana.

original: 'phags pa kam pa la'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa kam pa la'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: Ārya Kambala also says:

original: 'dod chags la sogs dri bcas sems //🔽'khor ba yin te des dben pa //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs dri bcas sems // 'khor ba yin te des dben pa //
translated: The mind polluted by attachment and so forth🔽is samsara.🔽Freedom from that

original: mdor na thar pa yin par ni //
analyzed: mdor na thar pa yin par ni //
translated: is nirvana.

original: rgyal ba sgrib pa spangs pas gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal ba sgrib pa spangs pas gsungs //
translated: The Victor, who is free of obscurations,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: taught this in brief.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag spangs shing bcom pas na ting nge 'dzin gang du dngos po gcig ste tha mi dad par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag spangs shing bcom pas na ting nge 'dzin gang du dngos po gcig ste tha mi dad par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since it is the one that eliminates and conquers the concepts of samsara and nirvana, it is the samadhi in which one thing becomes undifferentiated.

original: 'grub pa de ni zung du 'jug par te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa de ni zung du 'jug par te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since those conceptualizations of cyclic existence and nirvana are abandoned and destroyed, that samadhi in which one thing, i.e., non-difference, is accomplished is to be called the samadhi of non-abiding nirvana, i.e., the stage of union.

original: de bzhin du yang 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin las mi g-yo ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba las mi gnas pa yin la 'ja' tshon lta bu'i ye shes kyi sku 'dzin pas sems can thams cad kyi don sgrub par nus pa yin pa'i phyir mya ngan
analyzed: de bzhin du yang 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin las mi g-yo ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba las mi gnas pa yin la 'ja' tshon lta bu'i ye shes kyi sku 'dzin pas sems can thams cad kyi don sgrub par nus pa yin pa'i phyir mya ngan
translated: Likewise, since it is unmoving from the clear light samadhi, it does not abide in cyclic existence, and since it is able to accomplish the welfare of all sentient beings by holding the rainbow-like body of exalted wisdom, it does not abide in nirvana.

original: las 'das pa la mi gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos su zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i don dang mthun pa'i ming bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las 'das pa la mi gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos su zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i don dang mthun pa'i ming bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the name that is consistent with the meaning of the stage of union.

original: de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te dgongs pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te dgongs pa yin pa'o //
translated: This is the general definition, i.e., the intention.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of distinction is

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par byang //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par byang //
translated: affliction and purification.

original: don dam nyid du shes nas ni //🔽gang gi gcig pa nyid shes pa //
analyzed: don dam nyid du shes nas ni // gang gi gcig pa nyid shes pa //
translated: Having understood reality itself,🔽one who knows their oneness

original: de yi zung du 'jug pa shes //
analyzed: de yi zung du 'jug pa shes //
translated: knows their union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni sems las byung bas bsdus pa'i khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni sems las byung bas bsdus pa'i khams gsum pa'o //
translated: Affliction is the three realms subsumed by mental functions.

original: rnam par byang ba ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Purification is the virtuous natures that are their antidotes.

original: de bzhin du yang sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang // 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste rje btsun dkon mchog sgrol ma las /🔽gnyis ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi bden pa dag yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang // 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa dang zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste rje btsun dkon mchog sgrol ma las / gnyis ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi bden pa dag yin la /
translated: Similarly, the four noble truths are the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.🔽The Venerable Tārā says:🔽Two are the truths of the noble śrāvakas,

original: yang gnyis ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gnyis ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: and two are the noble truths.

original: de la 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa gang dang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa gang dang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the truth of the noble ones?

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ste gang gi phyir de rnams ni 'khor ba spang bar 'dod ba'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams @146b kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bden pa nyid du brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ste gang gi phyir de rnams ni 'khor ba spang bar 'dod ba'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams @146b kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por bden pa nyid du brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truths of suffering and origination are the truth of the noble ones because noble persons who desire to abandon samsara investigate them as true in terms of cause and effect.

original: de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa'i 'gog pa dang / lam dag ni 'dus ma byas nyid dang rang nyid nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa'i 'gog pa dang / lam dag ni 'dus ma byas nyid dang rang nyid nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa yin zhing /
translated: The truths of cessation and path are the truth of the noble ones because they are unconditioned and they are free of affliction by nature.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid dang tshad mas 'thad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid dang tshad mas 'thad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bden pa'o //
translated: They are the truth of the noble ones because they are preceded by correct knowledge and they are established by valid knowledge.

original: de ni rnam par byang ba ste kun nas nyon mongs pa khyad par du byang bar byed cing nyams par byed pas na rnam par byang ba yin zhing dge ba'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de ni rnam par byang ba ste kun nas nyon mongs pa khyad par du byang bar byed cing nyams par byed pas na rnam par byang ba yin zhing dge ba'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i lam mo //
translated: That is purification, because it purifies and diminishes afflicted phenomena. It is the path subsumed by the side of virtue.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim pas khams gsum pa'i yul can gyis nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim pas khams gsum pa'i yul can gyis nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by the stages of the paths of seeing and cultivation, the afflictions with the three realms as their objects are completely pacified.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni skad cig bzhi'i dbye bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams khong du chud pas chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni skad cig bzhi'i dbye bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos rnams khong du chud pas chos kyi sku'o //
translated: For the practitioners of the perfections, the dharmakāya is realized through the four moments, and the factors conducive to penetration are understood.

original: rtogs pa'i dus de srid du mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus de srid du mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: For that long, the conceptualizations of the side of the antidotes and the side of the objects of abandonment arise.

original: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byas pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gang la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bya'i rnam par rtog pa de 'di yin no snyam du snang ba med cing /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byas pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gang la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po'i phyogs gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bya'i rnam par rtog pa de 'di yin no snyam du snang ba med cing /
translated: Because the reality of clear light is actualized, in whatever samādhi the conceptualizations of the side of the objects of abandonment and the side of the antidotes do not appear, thinking, “This is the side of the objects of abandonment and this is the side of the antidotes.”

original: 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa gang gis gcig pa nyid du ste gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes shing rtogs pa des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa gang gis gcig pa nyid du ste gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes shing rtogs pa des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: However, the yogi who knows and realizes the identity, i.e., the nondual nature, he knows the stage of union. This is the meaning, and it is not a case of indirect discourse.

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba'i phyogs snga mar bkod pa'i sgo nas tha mi dad pa'i ting nge 'dzin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba'i phyogs snga mar bkod pa'i sgo nas tha mi dad pa'i ting nge 'dzin /
translated: The stage of union is taught in the Yogācāra system, in the first part of the text, in the following verse:🔽The yogi who is engaged in the practice of the nondifferentiation of things,

original: dngos po rnams bcas kun rtog dang // rnam pa med pa'i rtog pa dang // gcig bcas spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: dngos po rnams bcas kun rtog dang // rnam pa med pa'i rtog pa dang // gcig bcas spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: the nondifferentiation of imagination, the nondifferentiation of form, and the nondifferentiation of action,

original: de ni zung du 'jug shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zung du 'jug shes pa'o //
translated: he knows the stage of union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba kha cig gi phyogs ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba kha cig gi phyogs ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the position of some Yogācāras.

original: 'di lta ste bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po phyi rol na snang ba gang ci yang rung ba de rnams ni rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin te rang gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dngos po phyi rol na snang ba gang ci yang rung ba de rnams ni rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin te rang gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever things appear externally, such as pots, cloth, etc., they do not exist by their own nature, because they are self-luminous.

original: dngos po gang dang gang rang gsal ba'i ngo bo de yod de rnam par rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang rang gsal ba'i ngo bo de yod de rnam par rig pa bzhin no //
translated: Whatever entity is the nature of self-clarity exists, like consciousness.

original: @147a * // gang zhig gzhan gyi gsal ba de ni yod pa ma yin te gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @147a * // gang zhig gzhan gyi gsal ba de ni yod pa ma yin te gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever is the clarity of another does not exist, because it is dependent on another.

original: gzhan la rag lus pa ni rnam par rig pa kho nas gsal bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la rag lus pa ni rnam par rig pa kho nas gsal bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which depends on another is to be clarified only by consciousness.

original: de bas na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de rnams ni rnam par rig pa tsam la rag lus pa kho na ste me long du byung ba'i gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni rnam par shes pa rnams dang
analyzed: de bas na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de rnams ni rnam par rig pa tsam la rag lus pa kho na ste me long du byung ba'i gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni rnam par shes pa rnams dang
translated: Therefore, whatever aspects there are, such as blue and yellow, they are dependent only on mere consciousness, like reflections appearing in a mirror.

original: bcas par smra ba rnams kyis dngos por kun du rtogs pa ste phyi rol gyi tshogs su snang ba'i rtog pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bcas par smra ba rnams kyis dngos por kun du rtogs pa ste phyi rol gyi tshogs su snang ba'i rtog pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the conception of an entity by those who speak of consciousness and its objects together, the arising of the conception that appears as an external collection.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam smra ba gzhan dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam smra ba gzhan dag ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Other proponents of mere consciousness think this:

original: dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba thams cad spangs shing rnam pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa 'ba' zhig de la don las 'byung ba'am der snang ba'i rnam pa de dag gis gos
analyzed: dri ma med cing mtha' yas pa'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba thams cad spangs shing rnam pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa 'ba' zhig de la don las 'byung ba'am der snang ba'i rnam pa de dag gis gos
translated: It is not possible for that cognition, which is immaculate and infinite like space, which is devoid of all defilement and purification, and which is a mere non-dual cognition, to be covered by those aspects that arise from objects or appear as objects,

original: par rung ba ma yin te rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: par rung ba ma yin te rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: because it is naturally pure, like space.

original: glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams snang ba ni snang ba med pa kho na yin te bcom ldan 'das ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams snang ba ni snang ba med pa kho na yin te bcom ldan 'das ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The appearance of adventitious defilements is only non-appearance, because it is the Blessed Lady herself.

original: snang ba lta bur nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de rnams ni /
analyzed: snang ba lta bur nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de rnams ni /
translated: Those that are experienced as if they were appearances,

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin du med pa yin pas na rnam pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa 'ba' zhig yin no zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyis rnam pa med pa nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin du med pa yin pas na rnam pa med pa'i rnam par rig pa 'ba' zhig yin no zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyis rnam pa med pa nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus, the Yogācāra conceive of the absence of aspects.

original: de lta bu'i phyogs gnyis 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid khong du chud pas gcig tu byas nas te ro gcig tu byas nas spyod cing shes pa'i rnal 'byor pa yongs su grub pa'i de kho na nyid la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni zung du
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyogs gnyis 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid khong du chud pas gcig tu byas nas te ro gcig tu byas nas spyod cing shes pa'i rnal 'byor pa yongs su grub pa'i de kho na nyid la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni zung du
translated: The yoga of the practitioner who abides in the reality of the consummate, who practices and knows by unifying or making one taste those two positions, is

original: 'jug pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid shes pa ste mthong ba'am thos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid shes pa ste mthong ba'am thos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: the union. That is the knowledge or seeing of reality, which is the nature of the dhātu of nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: dbu ma'i phyogs ni /🔽gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: dbu ma'i phyogs ni / gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa yi //
translated: The Madhyamaka position is as follows.🔽The two cognitions

original: blo rnams gnyis ni yod min gyi //
analyzed: blo rnams gnyis ni yod min gyi //
translated: of apprehendeds and apprehenders do not exist.

original: gang du mi phyed yod gyur pa //
analyzed: gang du mi phyed yod gyur pa //
translated: Where there is no division,

original: de ni zung du 'jug par bshad //
analyzed: de ni zung du 'jug par bshad //
translated: That is said to be the union.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te dbu ma pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi gzung ba gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i @147b phyir med par 'dod do //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te dbu ma pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi gzung ba gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i @147b phyir med par 'dod do //
translated: The Madhyamikas assert that external objects do not exist because they are free from being one or many.

original: de'i phyir gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa med ces zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa med ces zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since there is no object, there is no subject.

original: de ltar de rnams kyi ltar na blo ste shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa gnyis su gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de rnams kyi ltar na blo ste shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa gnyis su gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, according to them, the mind, that is, consciousness, does not exist in the aspect of the two, the nature of object and subject.

original: de bzhin du yang du yang de rnams ni 'di skad du dngos po 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin med de gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang du yang de rnams ni 'di skad du dngos po 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin med de gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, they say again and again, “All these things are essenceless because they are free from being one or many, like a reflection.”

original: dngos po gang zhig gcig dang du ma nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga la sogs pa lta bu yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / tshad ma med pa kho na yin zhes smra'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig gcig dang du ma nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga la sogs pa lta bu yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / tshad ma med pa kho na yin zhes smra'o //
translated: Any entity that is endowed with unity and multiplicity, etc., is a counter-correlate, like the twenty-five realities imagined by others.

original: de ltar na dbu ma pa rnams la gnyis su snang ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar na dbu ma pa rnams la gnyis su snang ba med de /
translated: Thus, the Centrists do not have a dualistic appearance.🔽Since that is the position of the ultimate alone, it is stated in order to eliminate that:🔽“The sameness of the two realities is the sameness of the two truths.”🔽The sameness of the two realities is the sameness of the two truths.

analyzed: de ni don dam pa 'ba' zhig gi phyogs yin pas de bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa / zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gang du mi phyed pa ni gcig pa ste /

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag gnyis su med pa'i dngos por yod cing /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag gnyis su med pa'i dngos por yod cing /
translated: The sameness of the two realities is the sameness of the two truths.🔽The sameness of the

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung tshad ma yin par bstan te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung tshad ma yin par bstan te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān has said that the samādhi that is the object of the yogis is called “union.” This shows that the Bhagavān’s statement is valid, and it is not a statement of implied meaning.

original: rgol ba thams cad kyi phyogs dgag pa'i phyir /🔽rtag dang chad pa'i blo dag ni //
analyzed: rgol ba thams cad kyi phyogs dgag pa'i phyir / rtag dang chad pa'i blo dag ni //
translated: In order to refute the positions of all opponents,🔽the following is said:🔽Those who abandon the views of eternalism and nihilism

original: gang gis spangs nas rab gnas pa //
analyzed: gang gis spangs nas rab gnas pa //
translated: and abide in

original: zung 'jug rim pa shes bya ba //
analyzed: zung 'jug rim pa shes bya ba //
translated: the stage of union

original: gang gis de shes mkhas pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis de shes mkhas pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are wise ones who know that.

original: de bzhin du yang bdag tu lta bas zin pa pha rol rgol ba gang du yang rung ba de thams cad ni 'khor ba'i dug gi ljon shing gi rgyur gyur pa rnam grangs gzhan ther zug nyid ces bya ba ni rtag pa'i phyogs kyi lam la gnas pa
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bdag tu lta bas zin pa pha rol rgol ba gang du yang rung ba de thams cad ni 'khor ba'i dug gi ljon shing gi rgyur gyur pa rnam grangs gzhan ther zug nyid ces bya ba ni rtag pa'i phyogs kyi lam la gnas pa
translated: Thus, all opponents who are seized by the view of self are causes for the poisonous tree of saṃsāra. Another term for that is “permanence.” They abide in the path of the eternalist position.

original: yin zhing / de rnams ni 'khor ba'i zhags pa'i mdud pa las grol ba ma yin te thar pa'i lam yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //🔽bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa kha cig rang gi phung po la sogs pa 'gags pa @148a * //
analyzed: yin zhing / de rnams ni 'khor ba'i zhags pa'i mdud pa las grol ba ma yin te thar pa'i lam yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro // bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa kha cig rang gi phung po la sogs pa 'gags pa @148a * //
translated: and they are not liberated from the bonds of cyclic existence, because they do not know the path to liberation.🔽Some, such as the Vaibhasikas, assert that nirvana is like a flame extinguished,

original: las ; til mar zad pas mar me shi ba bzhin du mar me lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: las ; til mar zad pas mar me shi ba bzhin du mar me lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa yin te /
translated: from the cessation of one’s aggregates and so on, like a butter lamp going out when the oil is used up.

original: de rnams ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i bde ba dang yid bde ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis las 'das shing chad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i bde ba dang yid bde ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis las 'das shing chad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: They assert that liberation is beyond the two valid cognitions and has the character of annihilation, because it is devoid of the bliss and mental bliss of working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyang grol bar mi 'gyur te thar pa yongs su ma dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang grol bar mi 'gyur te thar pa yongs su ma dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not liberated, because liberation is by nature completely pure.

original: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid khong du chud pa'i dbang gis dngos po thams cad ro gcig tu byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang la rtag pa dang chad pa'i blo spangs shing mi gnas pa de lta bu'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa gang gis shes shing
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid khong du chud pa'i dbang gis dngos po thams cad ro gcig tu byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang la rtag pa dang chad pa'i blo spangs shing mi gnas pa de lta bu'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa gang gis shes shing
translated: By the power of understanding the reality of luminosity, the samādhi that makes all things one taste, in which the mind of eternalism and nihilism is abandoned and does not abide, is the stage of union.

original: rig pa de ni mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa de ni mkhas pa ste /
translated: Whoever knows and understands that is a scholar.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that he is a yogin who sees things as they are.

original: rgyal po rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang /
analyzed: rgyal po rin po che'i phreng ba las kyang /
translated: Also, in the Ratnāvalī, it says:

original: bdag gzhan phan pa yongs shes nas //🔽rtag tu lus ngag yid kyi las //
analyzed: bdag gzhan phan pa yongs shes nas // rtag tu lus ngag yid kyi las //
translated: Having fully understood the benefit for self and other,

original: thams cad yongs su brtags nas su //
analyzed: thams cad yongs su brtags nas su //
translated: always examine all the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: byed pa de ni mkhas pa yin //🔽bdag med yod par mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: byed pa de ni mkhas pa yin // bdag med yod par mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: The one who does this is a scholar.🔽Selflessness does not become existent,

original: bdag gi med cing yod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi med cing yod mi 'gyur //
translated: and without a self, existence does not occur.

original: zhes pas byis pa skrag par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes pas byis pa skrag par 'gyur //
translated: This terrifies the childish,

original: mkhas pa srid pa zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pa srid pa zad par 'gyur //
translated: but the wise extinguish existence.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the non-intentional.

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: That itself is:

original: shes rab snying rje gcig par ni //
analyzed: shes rab snying rje gcig par ni //
translated: Wisdom and compassion are one,

original: shes nas rab tu 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: shes nas rab tu 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: and having known, one enters.

original: zung 'jug ces byar bshad pa ste //
analyzed: zung 'jug ces byar bshad pa ste //
translated: This is explained as the union,

original: rim 'di sangs rgyas spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rim 'di sangs rgyas spyod yul lo //
translated: and this stage is the domain of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te de la shes rab ces bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa las byung ba dang bsgoms pa las byung ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te de la shes rab ces bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa las byung ba dang bsgoms pa las byung ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Therein, “wisdom” is threefold: that which arises from hearing, that which arises from reflection, and that which arises from cultivation.

original: de la thos pa la sogs pa las byung ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la de'i rjes la thob pa ni dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la thos pa la sogs pa las byung ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la de'i rjes la thob pa ni dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Among them, that which arises from hearing, etc. is with reference, and its post-attainment is without reference.

original: snying rje ni sems la dmigs pa dang chos la dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: snying rje ni sems la dmigs pa dang chos la dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: “Compassion” is threefold: that which has the mind as its reference, that which has the Dharma as its reference, and that which is without reference.

original: gnyis ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la tha ma ni dmigs pa med pa yin te de nyid snying rje chen po yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la tha ma ni dmigs pa med pa yin te de nyid snying rje chen po yin no //
translated: The first two have reference, and the last is without reference, and that itself is great compassion.

original: shes rab snying rje dag gcig par te tha dad pa med par shes shing rtogs nas rnal 'byor pa rab tu 'jug cing sems can @148b gyi don byed pa de ni sangs rgyas spyod yul te de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa zhes bya
analyzed: shes rab snying rje dag gcig par te tha dad pa med par shes shing rtogs nas rnal 'byor pa rab tu 'jug cing sems can @148b gyi don byed pa de ni sangs rgyas spyod yul te de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa zhes bya
translated: Having understood and realized that wisdom and compassion are one, that is, are not different, the yogi/ni engages in the realm of the buddhas, the stage of the union of the object of the tathagatas.

original: spro ba'i rim pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mi 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan sprul pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba'i don byed pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul sa bcu gnyis pa thob
analyzed: spro ba'i rim pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mi 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan sprul pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba'i don byed pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul sa bcu gnyis pa thob
translated: The stage of union is the stage of non-abiding nirvana, which is the attainment of the twelfth stage, the field of activity of a buddha.

original: par bya ba yin no zhes bshad par bya ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: par bya ba yin no zhes bshad par bya ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: This is explained to be the definitive meaning.

original: yang na shes rab ni don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is the ultimate mind of enlightenment,

original: snying rje ni kun rdzob kyi sems yin zhing de dag gcig par te /
analyzed: snying rje ni kun rdzob kyi sems yin zhing de dag gcig par te /
translated: and compassion is the conventional mind of enlightenment, and those are unified.

original: rdo rje'i mor 'dzin pa'i yan lag gis ro gcig par shes shing nyams su myong nas rnal 'byor pa gang zhig rab tu 'jug pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i bde ba chen po'i de kho na nyid la gnas pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: rdo rje'i mor 'dzin pa'i yan lag gis ro gcig par shes shing nyams su myong nas rnal 'byor pa gang zhig rab tu 'jug pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i bde ba chen po'i de kho na nyid la gnas pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi
translated: Having known and experienced the single taste with the branch of vajra-clasping, the yogi who enters, who abides in the reality of the great bliss of the connate great bliss, is a buddha.

original: spyod yul te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas yang dag par khong du chud par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo zung du 'jug pa zhes bshad par bya ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas yang dag par khong du chud par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo zung du 'jug pa zhes bshad par bya ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of union should be explained as that which is to be fully understood by the valid cognition of reflexive awareness, the domain of that.

original: yang na shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.🔽Compassion is the five perfections. Their unity is their accomplishment through the purity of the three spheres.

original: snying rje ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ste de dag gcig pa ni 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas bsgrub pa ste de lta bur shes shing bsgrubs nas rnal 'byor pa gang zhig rab tu 'jug pa ste sbyin pa la sogs pa la rab tu
analyzed: snying rje ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ste de dag gcig pa ni 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas bsgrub pa ste de lta bur shes shing bsgrubs nas rnal 'byor pa gang zhig rab tu 'jug pa ste sbyin pa la sogs pa la rab tu
translated: Having understood and accomplished it in that way, the yogi who engages in generosity and so on,

original: 'jug par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste gnyis su med pa'i rim pa mngon par shes shing sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul te de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la gnas pa yin no zhes bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste gnyis su med pa'i rim pa mngon par shes shing sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul te de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la gnas pa yin no zhes bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i
translated: that yogi who engages in generosity and so on, will understand and abide in the stage of union, the stage of nonduality, the domain of the buddhas, the level of the tathagatas.

original: don to // da ni phyogs gzhan gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: don to // da ni phyogs gzhan gyi sgo nas /
translated: Now, from another point of view,

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pas /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms 'jug pas /

original: thams cad rang bzhin shes nas ni //
analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin shes nas ni //
translated: knowing all things to be of the nature of coemergence,

original: rnal 'byor chen po gang du gnas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po gang du gnas //
translated: wherever the great yogin abides,

original: de ni zung du 'jug par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te shes rab ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'o //🔽thabs ni rdo rje 'chang gi sku ste de dag snyoms par 'jug pa'i sbyor bas 'dod chags la sogs pa thams @149a * //

translated: that is declared to be the union.

original: cad lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin du shes shing rtogs nas rnal 'byor pa lhan cig skyes pa gang du gnas shing 'jug pa de ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya bar brjod par bya ste drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: cad lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin du shes shing rtogs nas rnal 'byor pa lhan cig skyes pa gang du gnas shing 'jug pa de ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya bar brjod par bya ste drang ba'i don to //
translated: Insight is the gnosis seal, and means is the body of Vajradhara. Through the yoga of their union, knowing and realizing all things such as desire to be of the nature of coemergence, wherever the coemergent yogin abides and engages, that is declared to be the union. This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: yang na shes rab ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, insight is the stage of the pure mind, and means is the stage of the pure body.

original: thabs ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por spro ba dang bsdu ba dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ste de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por spro ba dang bsdu ba dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The method is the stage of self-consecration, and the emanation and gathering of those as the entities of cause and effect is meditative equipoise.

original: des khams gsum pa thams cad rang bzhin te bsdus nas shes shing sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis dang mtshungs par nye bar rtogs nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i mngon par shes pa'i rnal 'byor ba chen po gang du ste /

translated: Having understood that all of the three realms are of the nature of emptiness, and having realized that they are similar to the twelve examples of illusoriness, the great yoga of the clear light of the stage of completion is wherever one abides.🔽Wherever one abides in the vajra-like samadhi, that is to be called the reality called the stage of union.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang du gnas pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gang du gnas pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.🔽The Shravaka

original: nyan thos phyogs snga mar bzhag pa'i sgo nas /🔽gang du phung po lhag bcas dang // de bzhin phung po lhag med ces //
analyzed: nyan thos phyogs snga mar bzhag pa'i sgo nas / gang du phung po lhag bcas dang // de bzhin phung po lhag med ces //
translated: The Shravaka is posited as the opponent:🔽Where there is the “embodiment with remainder”🔽And the “embodiment without remainder,”

original: de lta'i rtog pa med gyur pa //
analyzed: de lta'i rtog pa med gyur pa //
translated: There is no such conception.

original: de shes zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de shes zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: That is the knowledge of the union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te nyan thos rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam pa gnyis te phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te nyan thos rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam pa gnyis te phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: The nirvana of the sravakas is twofold: with a remainder of the aggregates and without a remainder of the aggregates.

original: de la nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis bcings pa'i phung po la sogs pa ni phung po ste de dang lhan cig gnas pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis bcings pa'i phung po la sogs pa ni phung po ste de dang lhan cig gnas pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The aggregates are the aggregates of form, etc. , bound by the latent impressions of the afflictions and secondary afflictions. The nirvana with a remainder of the aggregates is that which is present together with them.

original: gang gi tshe mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs su zin kyang sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis lus ma zad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spangs su zin kyang sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis lus ma zad pa de'i tshe /
translated: When, although the afflictions have been abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation, the body does not perish due to the power of previous latent impressions,

original: nyan thos kyi rigs can rnams grol yang ma grol snyam du sems so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs can rnams grol yang ma grol snyam du sems so //
translated: those of the sravaka type think that they are liberated, although they are not.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa rnams zad cing phung po rnams nub pa de'i tshe til mar zad pa'i mar me bzhin du nub par gyur pa ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa rnams zad cing phung po rnams nub pa de'i tshe til mar zad pa'i mar me bzhin du nub par gyur pa ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: When the afflictions are extinguished and the aggregates subside, then like a butter lamp whose fuel is exhausted, they subside, and that is nirvana without remainder.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de gnyis ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de gnyis ni /
translated: Therefore, these two conceptual thoughts🔽should be known and understood as the samādhi that is the characteristic of union.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la med pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin yin par shes shing rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la med pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin yin par shes shing rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: phyogs de nyid /🔽gang du gang zag bdag med dang // chos bdag med ces bya ba yi //
analyzed: phyogs de nyid / gang du gang zag bdag med dang // chos bdag med ces bya ba yi //
translated: That very point is🔽where there is no realization of the selflessness of persons

original: rtogs pa yis ni dben gyur pa //
analyzed: rtogs pa yis ni dben gyur pa //
translated: and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan @149b nyid do //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i mtshan @149b nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po bstan pa'i sgo nas gang zag med pa'i gang zag la bdag med pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pa'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa med pa'i chos la bdag med pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po bstan pa'i sgo nas gang zag med pa'i gang zag la bdag med pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du bstan pa'i sgo nas phung po la sogs pa med pa'i chos la bdag med pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the Lord taught the selflessness of persons in the context of teaching the aggregates, and the selflessness of phenomena in the context of teaching mere representation.

original: de yang bye brag tu smra pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi phyogs gnyis te rnam par rtog pa de gnyis su snang ba ting nge 'dzin gang la med pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhing chos nyid yin no zhes
analyzed: de yang bye brag tu smra pa dang rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyi phyogs gnyis te rnam par rtog pa de gnyis su snang ba ting nge 'dzin gang la med pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhing chos nyid yin no zhes
translated: Moreover, the two positions of the Vaibhāṣikas and Yogācāras are the two conceptualizations. The samādhi in which those two appear is the characteristic of the stage of union, and it is reality.

original: bya ba'i tha tshig ste spyi'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i tha tshig ste spyi'i don to //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: yang na gang zag la bdag med pa zhes bya ba stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang zag la bdag med pa zhes bya ba stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, the selflessness of persons is the realization of the reality of emptiness by the path of meditation on the liberation door of emptiness and so on.

original: chos la bdag med pas ni skur sgrub pas lus dang ngag dang yid dag mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas lha'i 'khor lo'i dbus na gnas pa ste de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid dam pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pas ni skur sgrub pas lus dang ngag dang yid dag mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas lha'i 'khor lo'i dbus na gnas pa ste de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid dam pa yin no //
translated: By the selflessness of phenomena, one abides in the center of the circle of deities by way of not observing body, speech, and mind, through the process of deprecation and establishment. This is the supreme reality for those who are yogis of the stage of generation.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang la rtogs pa de gnyis med pa ni mi slob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhing rang bzhin yin te spyi'i don to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang la rtogs pa de gnyis med pa ni mi slob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhing rang bzhin yin te spyi'i don to //
translated: The reality of the stage of union is the reality of the stage of completion, which is the non-duality of those two realizations, because it is the state of no-more-learning. It is the characteristic and the nature of the stage of union. This is the general meaning.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs ni /🔽bdag byin brlab dang 'od gsal dang // de nyid rig pas rim shes nas //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs ni / bdag byin brlab dang 'od gsal dang // de nyid rig pas rim shes nas //
translated: The stage of completion is as follows:🔽Having understood the stages of self-consecration and clear light

original: de dag 'dus pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa gang yin pa //
translated: By means of the knowledge of reality,🔽The union of those two

original: de ni zung 'jug rim pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zung 'jug rim pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Is the stage of union.

original: bdag byin brlab pa las cig car lha'i rnam par spro ba ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag byin brlab pa las cig car lha'i rnam par spro ba ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The stage of self-consecration is the simultaneous emanation of the form of the deity, which is the nature of conventional truth.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ni de yang de nyid du rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dag gis gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ni de yang de nyid du rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dag gis gzhug pa'o //
translated: The clear light is introduced by the second and fourth stages, respectively.

original: de dag rim ste rjes su mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur shes shing mngon du byas nas phyis rim pa lnga pas gnyis po de dag 'dus pa ste /
