analyzed: de dag rim ste rjes su mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur shes shing mngon du byas nas phyis rim pa lnga pas gnyis po de dag 'dus pa ste /
translated: Having understood and realized the stages as concordant and discordant causes and effects, later, by the fifth stage, those two are combined,

original: gcig tu gyur cing tha mi dad par byas pa gang yin pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur cing tha mi dad par byas pa gang yin pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: that is, made into one, and not differentiated. That is called the stage of union.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i thabs kyi phyogs ni /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'i thabs kyi phyogs ni /
translated: The method side of the stage of manifest enlightenment is taught in the following:

original: ril por 'dzin dang rjes gzhig gis //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin dang rjes gzhig gis //
translated: Grasping the total, and the subsequent destruction,🔽 entering the basis by suchness, and the fifth, the equality in that,

original: de bzhin nyid kyis gzhir 'jug dang // de la mnyam du lnga pa gang //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis gzhir 'jug dang // de la mnyam du lnga pa gang //
translated: are the union.🔽 The stage of manifest enlightenment is taught in the following:🔽The five stages are the path of the perfection stage.🔽 The five stages are the path of the creation stage.

original: de ni zung du 'jug pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni zung du 'jug pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The five stages are the path of the union stage.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni rnal @150a * //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni rnal @150a * //
translated: The five stages are the path of the stage of manifest enlightenment.🔽 The five stages are the path of the stage of union.

original: 'byor rnams kyi thabs ni gnyis pa ste phyag rgya'i rim pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor rnams kyi thabs ni gnyis pa ste phyag rgya'i rim pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'o //
translated: The means for the wealthy is the second, which is the stage of the seal and the stage of meditative concentration.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'o //
translated: Therein, the stage of meditative concentration is twofold: the retention of the whole and the subsequent destruction.

original: ril por 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mgo nas rkang pa'i bar dang de dag yang ma go bo'i bar du 'od zer gyi 'khor los rang bdag nyid snang ba med par bya'o //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mgo nas rkang pa'i bar dang de dag yang ma go bo'i bar du 'od zer gyi 'khor los rang bdag nyid snang ba med par bya'o //
translated: The so-called retention of the whole is the non-appearance of one's own self by means of the circle of light rays from the head to the feet and from them to the earth.

original: de'i 'og tu rjes gzhig ni rim pa de nyid kyis dang por khams gsum pa snang ba med par bya zhing de nas bdag nyid snang bar med par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ste de dag ni ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rjes gzhig ni rim pa de nyid kyis dang por khams gsum pa snang ba med par bya zhing de nas bdag nyid snang bar med par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ste de dag ni ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin
translated: Then, the subsequent destruction is the non-appearance of the three realms by that very process, and then the non-appearance of the self. These are the meditative concentrations of the retention of the whole and the subsequent destruction.

original: zhes bya'o // ting nge 'dzin de dag gis de bzhin nyid kyi gzhi ste thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis mngon par byang chub pa la 'jug cing rnal 'byor pa de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug par bya ba dang de'i rjes la 'di ni don dam pa'i🔽phyogs yin gyi kun rdzob ni ma yin no zhes rmi lam bzhin du shes nas 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir de las te 'od gsal ba de kho na nyid de las mnyam zhing dus mtshungs par skad cig gis ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa
analyzed: zhes bya'o // ting nge 'dzin de dag gis de bzhin nyid kyi gzhi ste thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis mngon par byang chub pa la 'jug cing rnal 'byor pa de'i bdag nyid du rjes su 'jug par bya ba dang de'i rjes la 'di ni don dam pa'i phyogs yin gyi kun rdzob ni ma yin no zhes rmi lam bzhin du shes nas 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir de las te 'od gsal ba de kho na nyid de las mnyam zhing dus mtshungs par skad cig gis ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa
translated: After that, one should know that this is the ultimate🔽and not the conventional, like a dream.

original: dang bral ba'i sems kyis cig car ldang ba ste /
analyzed: dang bral ba'i sems kyis cig car ldang ba ste /
translated: Then, in order to benefit migrating beings, one should arise simultaneously from that, from the reality of utter lucidity, by means of the two samadhis, the mind free from conceptual thought, in a single instant, in a single moment.🔽The arising of the body is the union, the divine body arisen from the cause of the two samadhis.

original: sku spro ba gang yin pa de ni zung du 'jug pa ste ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi rgyu las byung pa'i lha'i sku yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: sku spro ba gang yin pa de ni zung du 'jug pa ste ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyi rgyu las byung pa'i lha'i sku yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the verse, the conclusion.

original: rim pa gzhan gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: rim pa gzhan gyi sgo nas /
translated: From another point of view,🔽having understood that the conventional and the ultimate

original: kun rdzob dang ni don dam dag / tha dad bye brag med shes nas //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni don dam dag / tha dad bye brag med shes nas //
translated: are not different,

original: gang du yang dag 'dres gyur pa //
analyzed: gang du yang dag 'dres gyur pa //
translated: that which is their perfect fusion

original: de ni zung 'jug yin par brjod //
analyzed: de ni zung 'jug yin par brjod //
translated: is said to be their coalescence.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te kun rdzob ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa la snang ba'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te kun rdzob ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa la snang ba'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conventional is the conceptualization of pots, etc., which appear to a conceptual consciousness.🔽The ultimate is the cessation of the conceptualization of subject and object, which occurs on the basis of a special path.

original: don dam ni lam khyad par can la brten nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa log pa gang yin pa ste kamba la'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang //
analyzed: don dam ni lam khyad par can la brten nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa log pa gang yin pa ste kamba la'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang //
translated: Kambala also says:

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan med pa'i //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan med pa'i //
translated: The absence of other conceptualizations

original: rnam rtog kun rdzob ces bya ste //
analyzed: rnam rtog kun rdzob ces bya ste //
translated: is called the conventional of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa de nyid ni //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de nyid ni //
translated: That very conceptualization

original: log par byed pa'i kun rdzob yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: log par byed pa'i kun rdzob yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: is the conventional of error.

original: de dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par rnam par gnas pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang don dam par bye brag med par gnas so //
analyzed: de dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par rnam par gnas pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang don dam par bye brag med par gnas so //
translated: Although they are differentiated by the distinctions of cyclic existence and nirvana, they are, in fact, undifferentiated.

original: kun rdzob las logs @150b shig tu don dam pa ni mi dmigs te don dam pa ni de kho na'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob las logs @150b shig tu don dam pa ni mi dmigs te don dam pa ni de kho na'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is not observed apart from the conventional, because the ultimate is the reality of thatness.

original: de yang don dam pa las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang don dam pa las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not different from the ultimate,

original: chos nyid las logs shig tu chos can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid las logs shig tu chos can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the phenomenon is not observed apart from reality.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi 'grel pa las kyang /🔽bu ram gyis ni mngar dang me'i //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi 'grel pa las kyang / bu ram gyis ni mngar dang me'i //
translated: The Commentary on the Awakening Mind states:🔽Just as sweetness is the nature of molasses

original: tsha ba rang bzhin yin pa ltar //🔽de bzhin kho nar chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: tsha ba rang bzhin yin pa ltar // de bzhin kho nar chos rnams kyi //
translated: and heat is the nature of fire,🔽emptiness is the nature

original: stong pa rang bzhin yin par 'dod //
analyzed: stong pa rang bzhin yin par 'dod //
translated: of all phenomena.

original: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag bzhin //
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag bzhin //
translated: Just as being produced and impermanence🔽are ascertained to be inseparable,🔽the ultimate and the conventional

original: med na mi 'byung nges pa yin //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges pa yin //
translated: are also ascertained to be inseparable.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom states:

original: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: Form is empty by intrinsic nature.

original: gzugs nyid stong pa'o //🔽stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nyid stong pa'o // stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Form itself is emptiness.🔽Emptiness is not other than form.

original: gzugs las kyang stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs las kyang stong pa nyid gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.

original: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag bye brag med par shes nas ting nge 'dzin gang du yang dag par 'dres te gcig tu gyur cing tha dad pa med par gyur pa de ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin par brjod par bya ste
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag bye brag med par shes nas ting nge 'dzin gang du yang dag par 'dres te gcig tu gyur cing tha dad pa med par gyur pa de ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin par brjod par bya ste
translated: Thus, having understood that the conventional and the ultimate are not different, that samādhi in which they are mixed together, become one, and become non-dual, that should be called “union.”

original: spyi'i don to //
analyzed: spyi'i don to //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: yang na kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag ste de dag bye brag med par shes nas ting nge 'dzin gang du rnal 'byor pas yang dag par 'dres par byed pa ni de'i zung du 'jug pa yin no zhes
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob dang don dam pa dag ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag ste de dag bye brag med par shes nas ting nge 'dzin gang du rnal 'byor pas yang dag par 'dres par byed pa ni de'i zung du 'jug pa yin no zhes
translated: Or else, the conventional and the ultimate are the creation and completion stages. Having understood that they are not different, that samādhi in which the yogin mixes them together is their union.

original: brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be stated.

original: yang na kun rdzob kyi rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob kyi rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi ste /
translated: Or else, the four stages of the vajra repetition of the conventional and so forth.

original: 'di nyid las /
analyzed: 'di nyid las /
translated: This very tantra states:

original: ji srid bsgom pa dang ldan pa //
analyzed: ji srid bsgom pa dang ldan pa //
translated: As long as one possesses meditation,🔽for that long one is a beginner.

original: de srid dang po'i las can yin //🔽zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de srid dang po'i las can yin // zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the five stages.🔽When one knows those without distinction and without differentiation, and one correctly mixes them and makes them of one taste, that is the union, which should be said to be the culmination.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.

original: don dam pa ni rim pa lnga ste de dag bye brag med cing tha dad pa med par shes nas yang dag par 'dres par byed cing ro gcig par byed pa gang yin pa de ni zung du 'jug pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste mthar thug
analyzed: don dam pa ni rim pa lnga ste de dag bye brag med cing tha dad pa med par shes nas yang dag par 'dres par byed cing ro gcig par byed pa gang yin pa de ni zung du 'jug pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste mthar thug
translated: The stage of completion is the stage of union.

original: pa'o // rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: pa'o // rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang // gang du ldang ba nyid med pa //🔽der ni zung du 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang // gang du ldang ba nyid med pa // der ni zung du 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: The stage of completion is the stage of union.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni mi zad gnas //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni mi zad gnas //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.🔽The stage of completion is the stage of union.

original: de bzhin nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa thams cad bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yin zhing rnam grangs gzhan 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //🔽de la bzhugs su zin @151a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa thams cad bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yin zhing rnam grangs gzhan 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o // de la bzhugs su zin @151a * //
translated: Suchness is a special meditative stabilization free from all the faults of the discursive thoughts of defilement and purification, and is called by another name, “clear light.”

original: kyang de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ste de 'di yin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: kyang de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ste de 'di yin no zhe 'am /
translated: Even though one abides in that, one does not have the conception of “I am abiding in suchness,” or the conception of “I have attained reality,” or the conception of “suchness is this,” or the conception of “I have attained that reality.”🔽And likewise, in order to benefit sentient beings, one arises by the stage of self-consecration with enthusiasm, and one does not generate the conception of “I am arising,” or the conception of “I am arising in order to benefit sentient beings,” or the conception of “I am arising by the stage of self-consecration,” or the conception of “I am arising by the stage of self-consecration in order to benefit sentient beings.”

original: bdag gis de kho na nyid thob bo snyam du so sor kun du rtog pa'i 'dzin pa med pa dang / de bzhin du sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ldang ba ni spro bas te de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi bskyed pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mi zad cing
analyzed: bdag gis de kho na nyid thob bo snyam du so sor kun du rtog pa'i 'dzin pa med pa dang / de bzhin du sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ldang ba ni spro bas te de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi bskyed pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mi zad cing
translated: This is the practice of the perfection stage yogis’ inexhaustible bliss.

original: zad pa med pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid mngon du byed pa'i gnas te de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spas pa dang mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa med pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid mngon du byed pa'i gnas te de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spas pa dang mthar thug pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate and the most sublime.

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: gnyid log sad pa zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: gnyid log sad pa zhes bya ba'i //
translated: The state of waking and sleeping

original: gnas skabs de nyid spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnas skabs de nyid spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: is abandoned in the state of union.

original: gnyid log sad pa dang bral ba'i //
analyzed: gnyid log sad pa dang bral ba'i //
translated: The Teacher, free from waking and sleeping,

original: ston pa zung du 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: ston pa zung du 'jug pa yin //
translated: is the state of union.🔽Waking is the state of sleep of the mind, the state of ignorance, at the time of the night of the fault of nescience, due to the non-understanding of the nature of entities.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te gnyid log ces bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas ma rig pa'i nyes pa'i mtshan mo'i dus su sems kyi gnyid log pa ste mi shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te gnyid log ces bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas ma rig pa'i nyes pa'i mtshan mo'i dus su sems kyi gnyid log pa ste mi shes pa nyid do //
translated: Sleeping is the state of sleep of the mind, the state of nescience, due to the non-understanding of the nature of entities.

original: sang pa ni tshad mas yongs su dpyad pa'i sgo nas dngos po rang rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: sang pa ni tshad mas yongs su dpyad pa'i sgo nas dngos po rang rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Waking is the understanding of the nature of entities, individually, by way of thorough analysis with valid cognitions.

original: gnas skabs de gnyis te sems kyi 'jug pa'i skad cig gis bye brag nyid spangs shing gsal ba'i phyir gnyid log sad pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs de gnyis te sems kyi 'jug pa'i skad cig gis bye brag nyid spangs shing gsal ba'i phyir gnyid log sad pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Since those two states, the state of sleep and the state of waking, are abandoned by the moment of the engagement of mind, and since they are clear, they are free from sleep and waking.

original: shes pa dang mi shes pa spangs pa'i ston pa sangs rgyas ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni rnal 'byor pas zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa dang mi shes pa spangs pa'i ston pa sangs rgyas ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni rnal 'byor pas zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: The teacher, the Buddha, who is free from consciousness and non-consciousness, abides in that samādhi. That samādhi should be known by the yogin as being called “union.” This is the general meaning.

original: yang na gnyid log ces bya ba ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong gi nang du thim pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: yang na gnyid log ces bya ba ni rtsa bdun khri nyis stong gi nang du thim pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Or else, “sleep” is the bodhicitta that dissolves into the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: sad pa zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas de nyid de rnams nas 'dzag nas rdo rje'i rtse mor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sad pa zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas de nyid de rnams nas 'dzag nas rdo rje'i rtse mor gnas pa'o //
translated: “Waking” is the state of that [bodhicitta] that, through the process of the union of method and wisdom, descends from those [channels] and abides at the tip of the vajra.

original: gnas skabs de lta bu gnyis sangs pa las gnyid log pa dang sad pa ste 'jug pa dang ldang ba dag spangs shing zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas shing ston pa thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de lta bu gnyis sangs pa las gnyid log pa dang sad pa ste 'jug pa dang ldang ba dag spangs shing zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas shing ston pa thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: These two states are abandoned by the purification of sleep and waking, that is, entering and rising, and one abides in the stage of union and becomes the omniscient teacher. This is the ultimate.

original: de nyid ni /🔽mnyam par gzhag dang ma gzhag pa //
analyzed: de nyid ni / mnyam par gzhag dang ma gzhag pa //
translated: That itself is stated:🔽He who is not in equipoise or nonequipoise

original: gang la rnam pa kun du med //
analyzed: gang la rnam pa kun du med //
translated: in any way,

original: dngos dang dngos med rnam spangs pa'i //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnam spangs pa'i //
translated: the yogi/nī who abandons entity and non-entity

original: rnal 'byor pa ni zung 'jug gnas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni zung 'jug gnas //
translated: abides in union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te bskyed @151b pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha'i sku bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te bskyed @151b pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha'i sku bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The equipoise of the yogi/nī of the creation stage is the accomplishment of the deity’s body by way of the stages of the first union and so forth.

original: mnyam par ma gzhag pa ni nge dag thams cad byas nas thun mtshams su spyod lam bzhis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma gzhag pa ni nge dag thams cad byas nas thun mtshams su spyod lam bzhis gnas pa'o //
translated: The nonequipoise is the performance of all of those and then abiding in the four behaviors during the session breaks.

original: de bzhin du rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i sgom pa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa mnyam par gzhag pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i sgom pa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the perfect yogi is one who delights in the meditation of vajra repetition and so forth.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa ni snang ba nyid kyis de las ldang ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa ni snang ba nyid kyis de las ldang ba'o //
translated: The equipoised one is one who arises from that by means of appearance.

original: gnyis po de ting nge 'dzin gang la rnam pa kun du ste dus gsum du yang med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po de ting nge 'dzin gang la rnam pa kun du ste dus gsum du yang med pa'o //
translated: Those two are in no way, at any time, in any concentration.

original: rnal 'byor pa de ni dngos dang dngos min te ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par g-yeng ba dag rnam par spangs shing bor nas zung du 'jug pa la gnas pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes pa ni tshig lhag ma ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de ni dngos dang dngos min te ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par g-yeng ba dag rnam par spangs shing bor nas zung du 'jug pa la gnas pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes pa ni tshig lhag ma ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: That yogi, having abandoned and rejected both concentration and distraction, which are real and unreal, respectively, is one who abides in the state of union. This is the remainder of the verse, the conclusion.

original: yang na mnyam par gzhag pa ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mnyam par gzhag pa ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, equipoise is the entry and abiding.

original: mnyam par ma gzhag pa ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma gzhag pa ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Nonequipoise is the arising.

original: de rnams ting nge 'dzin gang la rnam pa kun du ste rlung gi dus gsum char du yang med pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni dngos dang dngos med de srog dang rtsol pa'i rlung dag gis 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i sbyor ba spangs shing zung du 'jug pa
analyzed: de rnams ting nge 'dzin gang la rnam pa kun du ste rlung gi dus gsum char du yang med pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni dngos dang dngos med de srog dang rtsol pa'i rlung dag gis 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i sbyor ba spangs shing zung du 'jug pa
translated: One who is a yogi/nī in whom those are in every way, that is, in all three times of the wind, do not exist, should be known as abiding in the union that is free of the engagement and withdrawal of the winds of prāṇa and āyāma, that is, of the substantial and the insubstantial.

original: la gnas pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: la gnas pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the intended meaning.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i phyogs ni /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa'i phyogs ni /
translated: The section on the stage of the purification of the mind🔽is as follows:

original: dran dang mi dran las grol zhing //
analyzed: dran dang mi dran las grol zhing //
translated: Free of mindfulness and non-mindfulness,

original: rtag tu rgyun du gnas pa ste //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun du gnas pa ste //
translated: always and continuously abiding,

original: rnal 'byor pa ni 'dod bzhin spyod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni 'dod bzhin spyod //
translated: the yogi/nī acts as he/she wishes.

original: zung 'jug rim pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zung 'jug rim pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the stage of union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te dran pa ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyis 'od gsal ba khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te dran pa ni thams cad stong pa nyid kyis 'od gsal ba khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the realization of clear light through the emptiness of everything.

original: mi dran pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang rang bzhin rnams 'gags pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas thob pa ste de dag las grol ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dran pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gsum dang rang bzhin rnams 'gags pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas thob pa ste de dag las grol ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: Non-memory is the attainment of the state of non-conceptuality through the cessation of the three consciousnesses and the natures, and liberation from them is abandonment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtag tu rgyun du ste 'khor ba'i rgyun ji srid kyi bar du gnas pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir sdod pas na rtag tu rgyun du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtag tu rgyun du ste 'khor ba'i rgyun ji srid kyi bar du gnas pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir sdod pas na rtag tu rgyun du gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, always, continuously, for as long as the continuum of cyclic existence lasts, he remains, he abides, in order to act for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa ni 'dod bzhin te rang dbang du spyod lam bzhi rten spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pa ni 'dod bzhin te rang dbang du spyod lam bzhi rten spyod pa'o //
translated: Such a yogi acts in the four modes of behavior as he wishes, that is, with his own independence.

original: de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: One should understand that he is abiding in the stage of union.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa dag ni /🔽chags dang @152a * //
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa dag ni / chags dang @152a * //
translated: The stages of self-consecration and manifest enlightenment are

original: chags min las grol zhing //
analyzed: chags min las grol zhing //
translated: freed from attachment and non-attachment,

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i lus dang ldan //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i lus dang ldan //
translated: endowed with a body of supreme joy,

original: zung 'jug rnam par sgom byed pa //
analyzed: zung 'jug rnam par sgom byed pa //
translated: meditating on union.

original: 'khor ba srid du gnas byed pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba srid du gnas byed pa //
translated: It is the cause of the world's existence.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te chags pa ni dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te chags pa ni dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dag go //
translated: Attachment is pleasure and supreme pleasure.

original: chags min dga' bral te rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang rnam par smin pa dang rnam par nyed pa'i rang bzhin can de dag las grol zhing spangs pa'o //
analyzed: chags min dga' bral te rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang rnam par smin pa dang rnam par nyed pa'i rang bzhin can de dag las grol zhing spangs pa'o //
translated: Nonattachment is the absence of pleasure, free from the various kinds of pleasure, the nature of which is maturation and dissolution.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog tu dga' ba ni mtshan nyid dang bral pa'i skad cig gis rang bzhin gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog tu dga' ba ni mtshan nyid dang bral pa'i skad cig gis rang bzhin gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, supreme pleasure is the innate bliss, the nature of which is free from the characteristics of the four joys.

original: gang la de'i rang bzhin gyi lus te ngo bo yod pa de ni mchog tu dga' ba'i lus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la de'i rang bzhin gyi lus te ngo bo yod pa de ni mchog tu dga' ba'i lus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The body that has that nature, that essence, is endowed with the body of supreme pleasure.

original: mchog ste khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' pa yin zhing mchog tu dga' ba ni bzhi pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ste khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' pa yin zhing mchog tu dga' ba ni bzhi pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The supreme joy is the innate joy, and the supreme pleasure is the fourth.

original: yang na mchog las pha rol gyi dga' ba ni mchog tu dga' ba zhes pas 'dzin pa'i tshig bsdu ba la lo ma'i rgyal po la sogs pa bzhin du bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa yin pas mchog tu dga' ba bzhi pa nyid par brjod par
analyzed: yang na mchog las pha rol gyi dga' ba ni mchog tu dga' ba zhes pas 'dzin pa'i tshig bsdu ba la lo ma'i rgyal po la sogs pa bzhin du bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa yin pas mchog tu dga' ba bzhi pa nyid par brjod par
translated: Therefore, the fourth is called the supreme joy.

original: bya'o // yang na mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin du yan lag gi don bshad du med pa'i mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsgrags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya'o // yang na mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin du yan lag gi don bshad du med pa'i mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsgrags pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, like the term dakini, the term supreme joy is proclaimed to be inexpressible in terms of its component meaning.

original: bzhi pa rjod par byed pa yin la sbyor bas grag ba'i sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir ni gnyis pa la 'jug pas nyes pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa rjod par byed pa yin la sbyor bas grag ba'i sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir ni gnyis pa la 'jug pas nyes pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Since it is a term that is renowned through application, it is the fourth. Since it is renowned through application, there is no fault in applying it to the second. This is the final position.

original: de'i rjes la sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir de las skad cig gis langs te lha'i skur dmigs nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir de las skad cig gis langs te lha'i skur dmigs nas /
translated: After that, in order to benefit sentient beings, one arises from that in an instant and visualizes the deity’s body.

original: 'khor ba ji srid du ste 'khor ba'i mthar thug par gnas par byed cing gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mi 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan spro ba'i sgo nas gnas pa ste de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid du ste 'khor ba'i mthar thug par gnas par byed cing gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mi 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan spro ba'i sgo nas gnas pa ste de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas
translated: One should know that when the yogi/nī abides in the stage of union by means of emanating other and other different maṇḍala wheels, at that time the yogi/nī abides in the stage of union.

original: pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
analyzed: pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbas pa'o //
translated: This is the hidden meaning.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas rim pa lnga pa /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas rim pa lnga pa /
translated: The five stages from the perspective of their own characteristics.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
translated: Having made cause and effect

original: rang bzhin mi phyed byas nas su //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi phyed byas nas su //
translated: and the indivisible nature,

original: rnal 'byor pa ni gang zhig gnas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni gang zhig gnas //
translated: the yogi/nī who abides

original: de ni zung 'jug sangs rgyas gsungs //
analyzed: de ni zung 'jug sangs rgyas gsungs //
translated: in that is said to be a buddha of union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang 'brel ba'i bag chags kyi @152b tshogs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang 'brel ba'i bag chags kyi @152b tshogs so //
translated: “Cause” is the collection of habitual tendencies connected with the ālaya consciousness.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni khu ba dang khrag gi thig le las byung ba'i lus so //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni khu ba dang khrag gi thig le las byung ba'i lus so //
translated: “Effect” is the body that arises from the drop of blood and semen.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of those causes and results is indivisible.

original: yang mi skye ba'i chos can du byas nas rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gnas pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa yin par sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: yang mi skye ba'i chos can du byas nas rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gnas pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa yin par sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The yogi who abides in the state of non-arising is said to be in the stage of union by the buddhas.

original: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni lhan cig skyes pa dang shes rab kyi padma dag go //
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni lhan cig skyes pa dang shes rab kyi padma dag go //
translated: Or, the cause and result are co-emergent and the lotus of wisdom.

original: de dag mi phyed par byas nas rnal 'byor ba gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid rnal 'byor pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa yin par sangs rgyas rnams gsungs te drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag mi phyed par byas nas rnal 'byor ba gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid rnal 'byor pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa yin par sangs rgyas rnams gsungs te drang ba'i don to //
translated: The yogi who abides in the state of their indivisibility is said to be in the stage of union of the yogi by the buddhas. This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: rgyu ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi'o //
translated: The cause is the four stages of vajra repetition and so forth.

original: 'bras bu ni rim pa lnga pa ste de rnams mi phyed par byas shing ro gcig par byas nas rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gnas pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa yin par sangs rgyas rnams gsungs so zhes bya ba ni nges ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rim pa lnga pa ste de rnams mi phyed par byas shing ro gcig par byas nas rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gnas pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa yin par sangs rgyas rnams gsungs so zhes bya ba ni nges ba'i don to //
translated: The result is the five stages. The buddhas have taught that the yoga of the one who abides by making those inseparable and of one taste is the stage of union. This is the definitive meaning.

original: da ni rim pa gnyis kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: da ni rim pa gnyis kyi sgo nas /
translated: Now, by means of the two stages,🔽this generation stage and

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di gcig dang // rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa 'di gcig dang // rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba //
translated: that called perfection stage,

original: gnyis po gang du gcig gyur pa //
analyzed: gnyis po gang du gcig gyur pa //
translated: the two that have become one

original: de ni zung du 'jug par gsungs //
analyzed: de ni zung du 'jug par gsungs //
translated: is taught to be union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te thun mong gi bsnyen pa ni rdo rje bzhi po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te thun mong gi bsnyen pa ni rdo rje bzhi po ste /
translated: The common approximation is the four vajras.

original: rim pa des lha'i rnam pa grub pa gang yin pa de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa des lha'i rnam pa grub pa gang yin pa de ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The generation stage is that which accomplishes the form of the deity by that stage.

original: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor dang rtsa rgyu ba'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang thig le'i rnal 'byor dang thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa dang de'i yan lag bsnyen pa la sogs pa rnams dang / rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga dang /
analyzed: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor dang rtsa rgyu ba'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang thig le'i rnal 'byor dang thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa dang de'i yan lag bsnyen pa la sogs pa rnams dang / rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga dang /
translated: The yoga of the six limbs, the yoga of the movement of the channels, the subtle yoga, the bindu yoga, the union of method and wisdom, and its branches, the service and so forth, and the five stages of vajra repetition and so forth,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu dang rigs mthun pa spros pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi bsgom pa'i lam ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu dang rigs mthun pa spros pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi bsgom pa'i lam ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: and other similar practices that are characterized by the unelaborated reality are the completion stage.

original: rim pa de dag ting nge 'dzin gang du gcig ste tha dad pa'i blo med pa nyid du gyur pa de ni zung du 'jug pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rim pa de dag ting nge 'dzin gang du gcig ste tha dad pa'i blo med pa nyid du gyur pa de ni zung du 'jug pa yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān has said that when those stages are unified in a single samādhi, free from the mind of differentiation, that is union.

original: de bzhin du yang ting nge 'dzin de la 'od gsal ba mngon du byed pa dang 'ja' tshon lta bu'i sku dang / dkyil 'khor pa rnams te 'di yin no zhes snang ba med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang ting nge 'dzin de la 'od gsal ba mngon du byed pa dang 'ja' tshon lta bu'i sku dang / dkyil 'khor pa rnams te 'di yin no zhes snang ba med de /
translated: Likewise, in that samādhi, the clear light is manifested, and the body like a rainbow, and the maṇḍala, are not seen, saying, “This is it.”

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid dang rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad nub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'on kyang sems can @153a * //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid dang rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad nub pa yin pa'i phyir ro // 'on kyang sems can @153a * //
translated: Because it is the nature of the sphere of non-abiding nirvāṇa, and all conceptual stains have subsided.

original: thams cad kyi don ni bsgrub po zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi don ni bsgrub po zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: However, the benefit of all sentient beings is accomplished, it is said, but that is not the intention.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i lha'i sku'i dbye ba gnyis kyi phyogs kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i lha'i sku'i dbye ba gnyis kyi phyogs kyi sgo nas /
translated: From the perspective of the two divisions of the deity’s form in the creation stage,

original: 'di ni yongs su dag pa'i lha //
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su dag pa'i lha //
translated: this is the pure deity,

original: 'di ni ma dag par gyur zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni ma dag par gyur zhes //
translated: and this is the impure one.

original: rtog pa gang du gcig pa nyid //
analyzed: rtog pa gang du gcig pa nyid //
translated: Wherever there is such a concept,

original: de ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: that is the union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba las skad cig gis sku bskyed pa ni yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku ye shes kyi sku'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba las skad cig gis sku bskyed pa ni yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku ye shes kyi sku'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the arising of the body in an instant from clear light by the stage of self-consecration is the body of a pure deity, the body of intuition.

original: zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la brten nas sku 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni yongs su ma dag pa'i lha'i sku ste rnam par rtog pa spro ba mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim gyis dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la brten nas sku 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni yongs su ma dag pa'i lha'i sku ste rnam par rtog pa spro ba mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The body that arises by means of the three samadhis, beginning with the first application, by the stages of moon, vajra, etc., is the body of an impure deity, because it is the proliferation of many discursive thoughts.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngags kyi sku zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngags kyi sku zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be called the body of mantra.

original: sku de dag ting nge 'dzin gang du tha dad med par gyur pa de ni zung du 'jug pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sku de dag ting nge 'dzin gang du tha dad med par gyur pa de ni zung du 'jug pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That samadhi in which those bodies become undifferentiated should be called the union, according to the explicit teaching.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbye ba gnyis ni //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbye ba gnyis ni //
translated: The two divisions of the perfection stage are

original: gzugs can dang ni gzugs med ces //
analyzed: gzugs can dang ni gzugs med ces //
translated: the one with form and the formless.

original: rtog pa gnyis pa spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis pa spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: The second concept is abandoned🔽because of the absence of form.

original: zhi ba rnal 'byor dbang po shes //
analyzed: zhi ba rnal 'byor dbang po shes //
translated: The lord of yogis knows peace.

original: de ni zung 'jug thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zung 'jug thob pa'o //
translated: He has attained the stage of union.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te de la re zhig gzugs can ni rnam par shes pa ma rtogs pa'i phung po khams dang skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te de la re zhig gzugs can ni rnam par shes pa ma rtogs pa'i phung po khams dang skye mched rnams so //
translated: Here, the “embodiment” is the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that are not realized consciousness.

original: gzugs med ni nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gnyis so //🔽de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ting nge 'dzin gang la snang ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir zhi ba ste rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba gang gi tshe rnal 'byor dbang po ste /
analyzed: gzugs med ni nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gnyis so // de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis ting nge 'dzin gang la snang ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir zhi ba ste rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba gang gi tshe rnal 'byor dbang po ste /
translated: The “embodiment without form” is the two, space and consciousness.🔽When the lord of yogis, the perfect yogi, knows the non-appearance of those two kinds of conceptualization in any samādhi, then he has attained the stage of union.

original: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas shes pa de'i tshe de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa thob pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas shes pa de'i tshe de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa thob pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste drang ba'i don to //
translated: This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: yang na gzugs can ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i 'ja' tshon lta bu'i sku'o //
analyzed: yang na gzugs can ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i 'ja' tshon lta bu'i sku'o //
translated: Alternatively, the “embodiment” is the rainbow-like body that arises from clear light.

original: gzugs med ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs med ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The formless is the reality of clear light.

original: de kho na nyid du snang ba de gnyis spangs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i dbang po ni mi gnas pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa zhi ba thob pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du snang ba de gnyis spangs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i dbang po ni mi gnas pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa zhi ba thob pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: The yogi/nī who has abandoned those two appearances of reality attains the stage of union, the nature of the sphere of non-abiding peace.

original: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The result of the perfect yogi/nī is stated:

original: de ltar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi/nī who abides in that way

original: zung 'jug rim @153b la gnas pa ste //
analyzed: zung 'jug rim @153b la gnas pa ste //
translated: abides in the stage of union.

original: de ni kun mkhyen de nyid mthong //
analyzed: de ni kun mkhyen de nyid mthong //
translated: He sees the reality of omniscience

original: sna tshogs 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: and is called the “holder of variety.”

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas shing mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa yin par rig par
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas shing mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa yin par rig par
translated: The yogi/nī who abides in the stage of samādhi just explained abides in the stage of union and attains the sphere of non-abiding nirvāṇa.

original: bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir de ni kun mkhyen te dngos po thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bos mkhyen pa dang / de nyid kho na ste thams cad stong pa'i bdag nyid kyi zung du 'jug pas de kho na nying mthong bas de kho na nyid mthong ba dang /
analyzed: bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir de ni kun mkhyen te dngos po thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bos mkhyen pa dang / de nyid kho na ste thams cad stong pa'i bdag nyid kyi zung du 'jug pas de kho na nying mthong bas de kho na nyid mthong ba dang /
translated: He is just that, seeing reality by means of the union of the nature of all things being emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khams gsum pa sna tshogs dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mi 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan spro ba'i sgo nas rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang 'dzin par byed cing thob par byed pa yin pas na sna tshogs 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khams gsum pa sna tshogs dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mi 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan spro ba'i sgo nas rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang 'dzin par byed cing thob par byed pa yin pas na sna tshogs 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is the holder of variety, holding the state of Vajradhara by means of the emanation of the various mandalas of the three realms, which are different from each other.

original: des ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang de'i thabs phun sum tshogs pa gsal bar byas pa yin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: des ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang de'i thabs phun sum tshogs pa gsal bar byas pa yin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This clarifies the perfection of one's own and others' goals and the perfection of the means for that, which is not the intended meaning.

original: mi slob pa nyid ni /
analyzed: mi slob pa nyid ni /
translated: The state of no more learning

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba mngon sangs rgyas //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba mngon sangs rgyas //
translated: is the manifest enlightenment of the net of magical illusion.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol son //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol son //
translated: It is the transcendence of the ocean of samsara.

original: bya ba byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who has done what was to be done

original: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas //
translated: dwells in the way of the two truths.

original: zhes bya pa gsungs te bden pa gnyis kyi tshul te kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni 'di lta bu'i rnam pa can yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya pa gsungs te bden pa gnyis kyi tshul te kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa de ni 'di lta bu'i rnam pa can yin no //
translated: The yogi who has become one who dwells in the stage of union, the way of the two truths, the nature of the non-difference of the conventional and the ultimate, is of this kind.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is he like?

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis bskor ba'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis bskor ba'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: The so-called “web of magic” is the wheel of samsara surrounded by the traces of the afflictions.

original: der mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pas de kho na nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: der mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pas de kho na nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: To be fully enlightened in that is to realize reality by fully knowing its nature.

original: de bzhin du 'khor pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams te de dag nyid rgal bar dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams te de dag nyid rgal bar dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho yin la /
translated: Likewise, samsara is the phenomena of mind and mental factors. Since they are difficult to cross over, they are like an ocean, so they are an ocean.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rim pa rnams dang 'dis de'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir pha rol son pa'o //🔽de nyid kyi phyir mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa nyid yin pas bya ba byas pa ste bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum chogs pa grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de las pha ro na bya ba gzhan med do zhes bya ba ni drang @154a *
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rim pa rnams dang 'dis de'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir pha rol son pa'o // de nyid kyi phyir mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa nyid yin pas bya ba byas pa ste bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum chogs pa grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de las pha ro na bya ba gzhan med do zhes bya ba ni drang @154a *
translated: He has gone beyond that by the stages explained above, so he has gone to the other shore.🔽Therefore, he is one who has done what was to be done, because he is one who has accomplished the perfection of his own and others' goals, since he is one who has attained the path of no-more-learning.

original: // ba'i don to //
analyzed: // ba'i don to //
translated: The provisional meaning is that there is nothing else to be done beyond that.

original: yang na sgyu 'phrul dra ba ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis dang mtshungs par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: yang na sgyu 'phrul dra ba ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis dang mtshungs par mthong ba ste /
translated: Or else, the net of magical illusion is the vision of the twelve examples of magical illusion.

original: des mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: des mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
translated: He is fully enlightened by that, which means that he is one who has attained the meditative absorption that is like a magical illusion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ste rtag pa'i rnal 'byor gyi pha rol du son pa nyid yin pas bya ba byas pa'i rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la ste zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi rim pa la gnas pa
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ste rtag pa'i rnal 'byor gyi pha rol du son pa nyid yin pas bya ba byas pa'i rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la ste zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi rim pa la gnas pa
translated: Therefore, since he has reached the other shore of the ocean of cyclic existence, the yoga of the accomplished one who has done what was to be done is to be known as abiding in the mode of the two truths, the stage of the nature of union.

original: yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.

original: da ni ming la mngon par zhen pa rnams la tshigs su bcad pa nyid kyis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i rnam grangs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ming la mngon par zhen pa rnams la tshigs su bcad pa nyid kyis zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i rnam grangs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, for those who are attached to names, the enumeration of the stage of union will be stated in verse.

original: de nyid gnyis med ye shes te //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis med ye shes te //
translated: That is nondual wisdom,

original: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa yin //
analyzed: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa yin //
translated: nirvāṇa without abode,

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje sems dpa' nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje sems dpa' nyid //
translated: buddhahood, the state of Vajrasattva,

original: de bzhin kun gyi dbang phyug nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin kun gyi dbang phyug nyid //
translated: and likewise, the state of all lords.🔽The vajra-like meditative stabilization,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting 'dzin dang // rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting 'dzin dang // rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyid dang ni //
translated: the stage of completion itself,🔽the illusion-like meditative stabilization—

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting 'dzin dang // gnyis su med par de bshad do //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting 'dzin dang // gnyis su med par de bshad do //
translated: that is explained as nonduality.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pa'i phyir gnyis med spyi'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pa'i phyir gnyis med spyi'i don to //
translated: It is the general meaning because it is nondual, since there is no duality of the conceptualization of the object and the subject.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pa'i phyir gnyis med de mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pa'i phyir gnyis med de mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate because it is nondual, since there is no duality of the conceptualization of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: 'jig rten las 'das shing khyad par du 'phags pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ye shes te spyi'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das shing khyad par du 'phags pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ye shes te spyi'i don to //
translated: It is wisdom, the general meaning, because it is the special, transcendent nature.

original: ye shes lnga sdud par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga sdud par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It is wisdom, the ultimate, because it is the very essence of the five wisdoms.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag las mi gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag las mi gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It is the nondwelling nirvana, the ultimate, because it does not dwell in either samsara or nirvana.

original: sa bcu gnyis pa thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu gnyis pa thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is the Buddha, the implied meaning, because it is the attainment of the twelfth bhumi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga sdud par byed pa dang dbang phyug gi yon tan thams cad kyi rten nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga sdud par byed pa dang dbang phyug gi yon tan thams cad kyi rten nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the vajra, the hidden meaning, because it is the essence of the five tathagatas and the support of all the qualities of lordship.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid de mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid de mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the ultimate.🔽The eight kinds of mastery are mastery over:🔽smallness and greatness,🔽omnipresence,🔽at will,🔽lightness,

original: chung du dang chen po dang gar yang phyin pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan pa dang / yang ba dang / bdag por gyur pa dang / dbang du gyur pa dang / dga' mgur gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chung du dang chen po dang gar yang phyin pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan pa dang / yang ba dang / bdag por gyur pa dang / dbang du gyur pa dang / dga' mgur gnas pa ste /
translated: lordship,🔽mastery,🔽and dwelling at will.

original: rdzu 'phrul brgyad ni kun gyi dbang phyug ste de thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul brgyad ni kun gyi dbang phyug ste de thob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The eight kinds of mastery are the mastery of all, because one attains them.🔽Or else,🔽Mastery of body, mastery of speech,🔽mastery of mind,🔽mastery of magical power, mastery of giving,

original: yang na / sku yi dbang @154b phyug gsung dbang phyug / de bzhin thugs kyi dbang phyug dang // rdzu 'phrul yon tan kun dbang phyug / byed po zad byed yon tan brgyad //
analyzed: yang na / sku yi dbang @154b phyug gsung dbang phyug / de bzhin thugs kyi dbang phyug dang // rdzu 'phrul yon tan kun dbang phyug / byed po zad byed yon tan brgyad //
translated: mastery of knowledge, mastery of action,🔽mastery of destruction, and mastery of the qualities are the eight qualities.

original: ces bya ba rnams khong du chud pa'i phyir kun gyi dbang phyug yin te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba rnams khong du chud pa'i phyir kun gyi dbang phyug yin te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: One has mastery over all because one has understood these.

original: kun gzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur nas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes mngon du byas pa dang // phung po'i bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis bskyod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur nas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes mngon du byas pa dang // phung po'i bdud la sogs pa rnams kyis bskyod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The vajra-like samadhi is the ultimate, because the consciousnesses such as the store consciousness are transformed and the intuition of the realm of the Dharma is realized, and because it is not to be shaken by such things as the demon of the aggregates.

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa yin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / rang bzhin gyis grub pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa yin te dgongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The vajra-like samadhi itself is the perfection stage, because it is free from all conceptual elaborations and is naturally accomplished. This is the indirect intention.

original: sgyu ma'i dpe rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i sku ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe rnam pa bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i sku ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: The body illustrated by the twelve examples of magical illusion is the illusion-like samadhi.

original: rim pa gsum pa las 'di la bye brag ci zhig yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rim pa gsum pa las 'di la bye brag ci zhig yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t this the same as the third stage?

original: brjod par bya ste rim pa gsum pa ni ji srid du rim pa bzhi pas dag par ma byas pa de srid du yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste rim pa gsum pa ni ji srid du rim pa bzhi pas dag par ma byas pa de srid du yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is to be said that the third stage is not completely pure as long as it is not purified by the fourth stage.

original: rim pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa yin pas de la dag par byed pa gzhan mi dgos te mi slob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa yin pas de la dag par byed pa gzhan mi dgos te mi slob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This stage is naturally pure, so it does not need another purifier, because it is the state of no-more-learning.

original: der ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid du lta bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: der ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid du lta bar byed pa yin la /
translated: There, one views things as illusion-like.

original: 'dir ni lhun gyis grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par te sbas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni lhun gyis grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par te sbas pa'o //
translated: Here, it is spontaneous. This is the difference, the hidden meaning.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rim pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa rnams tha dad med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rim pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa rnams tha dad med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: It is to be said that by the previously explained stages, samsara and nirvana, etc. are non-dual because they are not different. This is the ultimate.

original: rgyud thams cad 'di nyid kyi tshad ma yin par /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad 'di nyid kyi tshad ma yin par /
translated: All tantras are the measure of this.

original: skye nga med la sogs pa'i sgra //
analyzed: skye nga med la sogs pa'i sgra //
translated: The words “non-arisen,” etc.

original: gnyis med ye shes ston pa rnams //
analyzed: gnyis med ye shes ston pa rnams //
translated: Teach non-dual wisdom.

original: thams cad 'di yis rjod byed de //
analyzed: thams cad 'di yis rjod byed de //
translated: All of them express this.

original: der ni gzhan dag ma bstan to //
analyzed: der ni gzhan dag ma bstan to //
translated: There, others are not taught.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te bcom ldan 'das kyis mod sde dang rgyud kyi rnam pa tha dad pa rnams las gsungs pa dang // skye ba med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te bcom ldan 'das kyis mod sde dang rgyud kyi rnam pa tha dad pa rnams las gsungs pa dang // skye ba med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān taught in the various sūtras and tantras, and in the various forms, the non-arisen, suchness, the perfect limit, sameness, emptiness,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / dag pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / grol ba dang / rnam par rig @155a * //🔽pa tsam nyid dang / dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra gnyis med ye shes te mi gnas pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi de kho na nying ston cing rjod par byed pa yin par gyur pa gang yin pa de rnams ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / dag pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / grol ba dang / rnam par rig @155a * // pa tsam nyid dang / dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i sgra gnyis med ye shes te mi gnas pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi de kho na nying ston cing rjod par byed pa yin par gyur pa gang yin pa de rnams ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim
translated: non-conceptual wisdom, pure mundane, supramundane, liberation, freedom, mere cognition, and the middle path.

original: pa 'di nyid kyis rjod byed de ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: pa 'di nyid kyis rjod byed de ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Those terms that teach and express suchness, the nature of the non-abiding dhātu, are expressed by this very stage of union.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa der gzhan ma bstan te rim pa 'di ma gtogs par brjod par bya ba gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa der gzhan ma bstan te rim pa 'di ma gtogs par brjod par bya ba gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the sutras and so forth, nothing else is taught, meaning that there is no other subject matter apart from this sequence.

original: des ni bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung tha dad du zin kyang /
analyzed: des ni bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung tha dad du zin kyang /
translated: Although the texts on action and so forth are different,

original: de kho na nyid ni gcig pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni gcig pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: they explain that reality is one.

original: lam tha dad pa ni de kho na nyid tha dad par sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lam tha dad pa ni de kho na nyid tha dad par sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Different paths do not establish different realities,

original: rtag pa nyid dang gcig pa dang chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid dang gcig pa dang chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because reality is permanent, one, and the nature of dharmata.🔽In accordance with the distinctions of the basis, it becomes different.

original: tshul bzhin du rten gyi bye brag gis tha dad par gyur pa ni 'phags pa byams pas /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rten gyi bye brag gis tha dad par gyur pa ni 'phags pa byams pas /
translated: The noble Maitreya says:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Because the dharmadhatu is indivisible,

original: rigs 'di tha dad rung ma yin //
analyzed: rigs 'di tha dad rung ma yin //
translated: this lineage is not suitable to be different.

original: brten pa chos kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: brten pa chos kyi bye brag gis //
translated: Because of the distinctions of the supported dharmas,

original: de yi dbye ba yongs su brjod //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba yongs su brjod //
translated: its divisions are fully expressed.

original: ces gsungs te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs te sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is literal.

original: rim pa 'di ni dus gsum kyi sangs rgyas grub par byed pa yin par /
analyzed: rim pa 'di ni dus gsum kyi sangs rgyas grub par byed pa yin par /
translated: This sequence is the means of accomplishing the buddhas of the three times.

original: gang+g'a yi ni bye snyed kyi //
analyzed: gang+g'a yi ni bye snyed kyi //
translated: “As many as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,🔽

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'di nyid kyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'di nyid kyi //
translated: The buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges🔽have accomplished the nature of the great seal🔽through this very [stage]

original: yod dang med pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i //🔽phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid grub //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te re zhig gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas te dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi rim pa 'di nyid kyi sgo nas phyag rgya chen po grub cing rdo
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i // phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid grub // ces bya ba gsungs te re zhig gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas te dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi rim pa 'di nyid kyi sgo nas phyag rgya chen po grub cing rdo
translated: which abandons the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob bo //
analyzed: rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob bo //
translated: The buddhas who are equal to the sands of the Ganges River, that is, the tathāgatas of the three times, have accomplished the great seal and attained the stage of Great Vajradhara through this very stage of union.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yod dang med pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The positions of existence and nonexistence,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral zhing spangs pa zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral zhing spangs pa zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, being free from and abandoning the positions of existence and nonexistence, is the nature of the samādhi of union.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rim pa gnyis pa las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bskul nas sh'akya seng ges sangs rgyas nyid thob po zhes gsungs pa'i rigs pa ste mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rim pa gnyis pa las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bskul nas sh'akya seng ges sangs rgyas nyid thob po zhes gsungs pa'i rigs pa ste mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the second stage says, “Having been urged by all the Tathāgatas, the Lion of the Śākyas attained Buddhahood.”

original: rgyu'i rim pa bshad nas 'bras bu'i rim pa'i sgo nas spyod pa /🔽zung 'jug go 'phang la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: rgyu'i rim pa bshad nas 'bras bu'i rim pa'i sgo nas spyod pa / zung 'jug go 'phang la gnas pa'i //
translated: Having explained the causal stage, the stage of the result is explained in terms of conduct.🔽The conduct of the great yoga

original: rnal 'byor chen po spyod pa ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po spyod pa ni //
translated: who abides in the stage of union

original: @155b zung du 'jug pa'i bsgom pa bzhin //
analyzed: @155b zung du 'jug pa'i bsgom pa bzhin //
translated: is like the meditation of union.
